loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул, 64 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 2 детей, сейчас уже растят внуков. У Бактыгул - среднее образование, она на пенсии, в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 40,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 20 овец, 4 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ягнят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить на покупку квартиры в городе.
texts.en:
Baktygul is 64 years old, married, brought up two children with her husband, and is already raising grandchildren. Baktygul has secondary education, and she is retired. She breeds livestock for the family's income, having started 19 years ago from the purchase of livestock with 40,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Baktygul's persistent hard work, today her farm has six cows, twenty sheep, and four horses. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS) on average. 

With a view to further develop her farm, Baktygul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy lambs for increasing her livestock headcount. Baktygul plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further increase of her livestock headcount, and wants to save to buy an apartment in the city.

loans.use: to purchase additional lambs in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Issy

texts.en:
Meet Issy - she is determined to be successful so that she can change her family’s story for the better. She is the youngest of three children and is 20 years old. Growing up in poverty, Issy and her family had to rely on support from the community for food and school fees. Today, she is requesting a Kiva loan to start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent.

Issy says that the difficulties she has gone through in life have taught her to stay strong and focused. Her father died when she was young and her mother could not find employment. Her elder brother Lucky, who is five years older than she is, had to drop out of high school to set up a makeshift grocery shop so that he could provide for the family. Going without meals sometimes did not stop Issy; she continued to go to a community school and finished high school. She is happy that she did not quit because she is able to read, write, and speak English.

Today Issy is requesting her first Kiva loan so that she can start her own business. She heard about Zoona from her elder brother Lucky, who started his own Zoona mobile money transfer business earlier in the year (Lucky is also a Kiva beneficiary). With a loan, Issy will be able to purchase a Zoona trading trolley and a web-enabled phone. She will also be able to serve her customers in Karonga, because this loan will provide the cash needed.

When Issy starts running her business, she wants to help her brother in supporting their mother and hopefully return to school so that she can be educated through post-secondary school. Issy thanks Kiva for changing her life.

loans.use: to start her own business by purchasing a trading trolley and a web-enabled phone and to provide the funds needed to serve people in Karonga, Malawi.

loans.name: Wyness

texts.en:
Wyness is 19 years old. She lives with her mother and father in Mzuzu, Malawi. Wyness has always wanted to run her own business. Growing up, she watched her mother run a successful business and this inspired her. Wyness just finished training with Zoona so that she can start her own Zoona mobile money transfer business in Mzimba, Malawi. She will be relocating from Mzuzu to Mzimba, which is 113 km away.

Wyness completed her high school education in 2012, and did a one year course studying human resource management. She says her life will change once she starts running her own business because she will be able to provide for her basic needs and help out her family by buying groceries and paying utility bills. She wishes to make her mother proud.

Wyness needs a Kiva loan in order to start her Zoona mobile money transfer business. The loan will be used to provide essential funds needed for her to serve her customers who need to access financial services. She will also use the loan to purchase a trading trolley and a mobile phone. These items are necessary for her to start her business. The loan will provide funds needed to serve her customers on a daily basis. Wyness has big dreams for the future, including running a successful business and creating more employment in her country.

loans.use: to start her own business as a Zoona Mobile money transfer agent so that she can provide financial services to people in Mzimba.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Linda is married and her husband works as a lift operator. They have been married for three years and have a three-year-old daughter named Meghan.

Linda is requesting a Kiva loan so she can purchase a trading trolley and a phone as well as provide the working capital needed to start her own business. She is excited to start her own business. Linda has run some small businesses in the past, but could not scale up due to a lack of funding. She is happy that her dream is turning into reality because it will help her earn an income so that she can support her young family. The business will also help her grow and meet more people in her community. She says that by setting up her business, she will enable people to send and receive money much faster, as Mzimba is a rural area without too many financial services.

Linda’s dream is to grow her mobile money transfer business and diversify into poultry at a later stage. She is also hopeful that, when the time is right, she can go back to school and get a better education so that she can be an educated business owner.

loans.use: to start her own business providing financial services to people in her community.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en:
Moureen, 20, is cheerful and hardworking. She is one of five siblings and has taken on the responsibility of caring for three of her siblings. Moureen is requesting a Kiva loan so she can start her own business and better provide for her siblings.

Before Moureen heard about Zoona, she worked in the hotel and tourism industry, first as a waitress and later as a receptionist. These two jobs helped her to interact with people and learn a lot about good customer service. Today, Moureen is very excited about the prospect of running her own business. Her face brightens up when she says, “I have a better future when I can work for myself because I can take more control of my destiny. I would like to own my own business.” Moureen will set up her business in Mzimba, Malawi, where she will be one of the main operators of a Zoona mobile money transfer business. Moureen’s business will provide financial services such as mobile money transfer and bill payments to people in the community. It will help people to easily and safely send and receive money. Moureen explains that if one has to travel all the way to town to do banking, it can take hours and cost a lot of money.

With this loan, Moureen will be able to purchase a small trolley, which she will set up at one of the farmer’s shops. She will also purchase a web-enabled phone, which she needs to make the transactions and serve her customers. Part of the funds from the loan will go towards providing working capital to do pay-outs and enable customers to send money.

Moureen is grateful to Kiva and Zoona for this massive opportunity. She says earning a bit more money will make it easier for her to continue supporting her sisters and brother through school and one day maybe she too can have a chance to go back and finish her high school education.

loans.use: to purchase a trolley and an internet-enabled phone so that she can start her own business providing financial services to people in her community.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana signed up for membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start a sari-sari store (variety store). She is thankful for the capital that PMPC extended to a small time borrower like her.

Susana has been able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn has broad experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring for, and harvesting plants, and earns an income as well. She supports her husband doing this type of work.

Lyn has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Lyn hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 64 years old and resides in Southern Looc, Plaridel, Mis.Occ. She is a widow and is blessed with only one child who is an adult. Carmelita joined PMPC in 2008 in order to access the programs and services of the cooperative.

Recently, Carmelita took her eighth loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 for additional working capital for her business, which is selling a variety of food products in the local community, and to buy a variety of commodities.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie landed at the right place to access the capital she needed when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet after she went broke when her first business failed. PMPC came to Virgie's rescue by lending her money when she needed it the most.

Now, Vergie is taking another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed the money to pay for land and seedbed preparation. Virgie perseveres and always believes she will reach her goal of continuously providing for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Winser Fernando

texts.es: Winser tiene 19 años de edad, de estado civil soltero vive con sus padres y su  hermano Juan de 15 años,  él es muy trabajador comenzó  su pequeño negocio a muy temprana edad cuando el dueño  de  hacienda donde trabajan sus padres le envió  a sacrificar  una ternera que  estaba  enferma Winser en lugar de matarla la alivio, alimento y cuido  .  El necesita el dinero para lograr comprar   terneras, con el tiempo y suma  dedicación  convertirlas en vacas lecheras obteniendo otro ingreso por la venta de leche que le permita comprar un terreno y construir una casa para ofrecer a su familia.
texts.en: Winser is 19 years old , single and lives with his parents and his brother Juan who is 15 years old. He is very hard-working. He started his small business at an early age when the owner of the ranch his parents worked on sent him to kill a calf that was sick. Winser instead of killing it, comforted it, fed it and cared for it. He needs the loan to manage to buy calves which with time and great dedication will become milk cows, obtaining another income by selling the milk. This will allow him to buy a plot of land and construct  house to offer to his family.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón asadas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 14 años y tiene clientes fijos por la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para comprar más semillas de marañón por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener junto con su madre una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She works selling roasted cashews. She has been in this business for 14 years and she has fixed clients for the quality of her product. With what she makes from her sales she manages to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy more cashews wholesale to be able to continue with her work. Then together with her mother she can have a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy cashews wholesale.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. Recently, she took a loan to buy additional piglets and purchase bags of feed. In addition to a project of concreting her pig pens, she is also thinking of opening a meat shop in the nearby town.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and purchase bags of feed.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and a mother of 4 children. She owns and manage an internet cafe just to earn for a living.Her husband is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) who helps her in the bills for their daily expenses and also sending their children in school. She want to work and want to earn more profit, so she decided to engage in this business. She want to expand her business. She gained access and joined in GDMPC, Recently, she took a loan to purchase another computer for her internet cafe.

Grace's plan for the future is to save money and improved their living condition.

loans.use: to buy additional computer for her internet cafe

location.town: P-4, VILLAFLOR, OROQUIETA CITY, MIS. OCC.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Mrs. Sen is 46 years old. She is married and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Husbandry and cultivation are the main income of her family. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family's living standards and protect the environment as well.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Chamampi Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHAMAMPI SARTASIÑANI” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal German Busch, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nelfy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces, venta de fruta, venta de tarjetas telefónicas, venta de cereales, venta de ropa, venta de helados, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nelfy es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una prima que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió ayudando a sus padres, hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en las ferias de Oruro y Villazón. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank Chamampi Sartasiñani will start their eleventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Focus Center. The bank is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors, of which Nelfy is president. The group members conduct varied businesses, such as the sale of sweets, fruit, calling cards, cereal, clothing, ice cream and vegetables. The loan that they will take out will benefit the group of small businesses of which Nelfy is a member. She states that four years ago she joined Pro Mujer after a cousin, a client of the institution, invited her.

Currently, she has a business selling sweets. She says that she learned this business from her parents several years ago. The loan that she will take out will increase her capital to buy sweets in bulk, which she will purchase from other female merchants in the city of El Alto. Afterwards, she will sell them at the fairs at Oruro and Villazón. This work method enables her to generate resources to economically support her family, since she lives in a common-law marriage. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy sweets in bulk.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy is from the village of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old and married. Juvy owns and operates a "sari-sari" retail store, selling a variety of products to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Juvy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to buy more good items for store to sell. This loan will be her 12th cycle from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has ten branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy several kinds of vegetables such as kangkung, spinach, mustard greens, chilies, tomatoes, etc

loans.name: Bhagyasini

texts.en: Bhagyasini is 35 years old and hails from a small village of Bolangir, Odisha. She lives in her own house with her life companion and her two children, aged 12 and 9 years old. She is a hardworking woman who, due to her friendliness, has many customers who visit her business of selling fish. One factor that concerns her is that she does not have access to a hygienic latrine at her home. Therefore, Bhagyasini is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR. She will use the loan amount to install a toilet in her home so that she would no longer have to depend on an open field for defecation.This intelligent woman believes that it is the right time to get a Kiva loan with Peoples Forum. She will invest it in finishing construction on her bathroom. She is dedicated to improving the health of her family, and that is why she is making these changes, which also help to stop ground contamination.

loans.use: to install a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Jahnabi

texts.en: Jahnabi, 46, lives in her own humble home made of daub and wattle in a small village in Bolangir district. She has lived there for a number of years with her husband and their two daughters, ages 22 and 24, and their 19-year-old son.Jahnabi works as a vegetable vendor in the community and provides quality service to a large customer base. This is how she has been able to support the household finances. Jahnabi is well-known by her neighbors for being an honest and hardworking woman.Jahnabi is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to buy sand, cement, a flush toilet, steel, and other materials to build a septic system so that she can provide her family with better hygiene. She hopes to be able to rely on this loan, because she wants to do this project as soon as possible so that she can provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a septic system.

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 8 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, gracias a su trabajo es como el ha podido salir adelante con sus gastos familiares, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana, 36 years old and lives in her own house with her family.  For eight years, she has made a living making and selling tortillas.  Her business is located in her house and she has several clients.  Thanks to her work, she has been able to cover some more of her household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to purchase corn in bulk and lime in order to continue making tortillas.  This way, she can have a better income and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk and lime.

loans.name: Los Vecinos Ii Group

texts.es:
Leidy continúa con su negocio de venta de empanadas y pacumutos (sentada a la izquierda, viste blusa blanca y carga a su bebe). El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de una parrilla. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio trabajó continuamente. Actualmente sigue liderando la banca de emprendimiento y su negocio creció porque cuenta con nuevas comidas en su menú, “ahora con nuevas comidas preparadas a la parrilla mis clientes aumentaron…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con nuevo menú, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de insumos de cocina como; carne, carbón, huevo y otros. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Leidy solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para mejorar el menú de su negocio.
texts.en:
Leidy continues with her business selling empanadas and kebabs. (She is seated on the left, wearing a white blouse and holding her baby). Her previous loan was invested in buying a grill. Her payments were on time as her business functioned the whole time.

She currently continues to head her communal bank and her business grew as she added new items to her menu. "Now with the new foods prepared on the grill my clients have increased" she commented. The advantage of her business is that she has a new menu and her disadvantage is the lack of money to buy cooking supplies like meat, charcoal, eggs and others.

Her dream is to open a restaurant. She wants to buy cooking supplies. This is her second loan with the institution in the four years she has been carrying out this activity. For these reasons Leidy is requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies to improve the menu of her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies to improve the menu of her business.

loans.name: Fidel Ángel

texts.es:
Fidel, de 48 años de edad, trabaja como agricultor desde muy joven, solo pudo estudiar lo básico, actualmente tiene tres hijos, uno de ellos está estudiando octavo grado y dos de ellas están pequeñas de 5 y 4 años de edad, su esposa se dedica a trabajar en el comercio informal.

Fidel, trabaja en la agricultura desde hace veinte años, específicamente cultiva de maíz, hace algunos  años en compañía de un amigo empezó a trabajar la agricultura, esta actividad la realiza dos veces por  año, porque es en donde trabajan con sistema de riego, es decir que todo el día pasan regando los cultivos, pero tiene que madrugar a las 4:00 de la mañana abordando un autobús que lo conduce al lugar de su trabajo y que este se encuentra a 10 kilómetros de su casa, su esposa lo apoya en los gastos de la casa, porque se dedica al comercio informal a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras con lo que le apoya en los gastos de la familia.

Fidel, necesita el préstamo para comprar de fertilizantes, abonos y pesticidas para preparar 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

Sus sueños son comprar animales de granja, vacas lecheras y poner una granja de gallinas ponedoras, además quiere que sus hijos puedan estudiar y prepararse y que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Fidel is 48 years old. He has worked as a farmer since he was very young. He was only able to attend elementary school. Currently, he has three children: one of them is in eighth grade and the two girls are 5 and 4 years old. His wife works in informal commerce. 

Fidel has worked in agriculture for twenty years. Specifically, he cultivates corn. Some years ago, together with a friend he started working in farming. He does this twice a year, because it's where they work with an irrigation system. On all other days he has to water the crops by hand. He has to get up very early, at 4 a.m., taking a bus that takes him to his place of work which is located 10 kilometers from his house. His wife helps him with household expenses, because she works in the informal commerce of buying and selling fruits and vegetables, with which she helps paying for family expenses. 

Fidel needs the loan to buy fertilizers, manure and pesticides to prepare 21,000 square meters of corn.  His dreams are to buy farm animals, dairy cows, and to start a farm with laying hens. Also, he wants his children to study and get prepared so they can have a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure and pesticides to prepare 21,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Kelly Johana

texts.es: Kelly es una comerciante de víveres y abarrotes que diariamente en su tienda oferta una gran gama de productos que hacen parte de la canasta familiar a los residentes de un barrio ubicado al sur de Barranquilla, esta actividad la ejerce en compañía de su cónyuge quien por tradición heredó la tienda de su padre en Valledupar y por años laboraron en ella, con toda esta experiencia emprendieron nuevos horizontes cuando se trasladaron a Barranquilla para inaugurar un negocio de este mismo formato al aprovechar una oportunidad que se les presentó con el antiguo propietario del establecimiento en donde actualmente se encuentran. Hoy en día cuentan con seis años en esta actividad y desean mejorar el surtido de su negocio, principalmente en artículos misceláneos con lo que se logra marginar un buen porcentaje.  Su meta a futuro es seguir prosperando en su negocio gracias a su compromiso y dedicación.
texts.en:
Kelly is a merchant who sells food provisions and groceries. She offers, daily, to the residents of her barrio in Barranquilla a great range of products that are part of the family basket. She carries out this activity with her husband who, by tradition, inherited their original store from his father in Valledupar and who for years has worked with her.

With their extensive experience, they sought new horizons, moving to Barranquilla to launch a new store in the same format. They seized an opportunity which was offered by the former proprietor of the establishment where they are presently located.

Today they can count on six years in this activity, and they wish to improve their business's merchandise selection, principally in miscellaneous articles, which should improve their profit percentage.

Kelly's goal for the future is to continue prospering in her business, thanks to her commitment and dedication.

loans.use: improve the inventory selection in her grocery business, principally in miscellaneous articles for sale.

loans.name: Jose Lazaro

texts.es:
Lázaro, de 37 años de edad, es una persona honesta, trabajadora y responsable, se ha dedicado siempre a la agricultura, pero también siempre le ha gustado tener sus tres vaquillas; está acompañado y junto a su pareja han procreado tres hijos que están estudiando.

Lázaro, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a cultivar hortalizas como pipianes, pepino, tomates y chile, ya que es de donde obtiene sus ganancias para cubrir los gastos de su familia.

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar cuatro novillas, para poder cuidarlas ya que siempre ha tenido sus tres vaquillas y de esa manera él puede sacar sus ganancias a un corto tiempo.

Lázaro, sueña con poder ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y sean personas de bien y puedan tener una mejor vida de la que hoy en día tienen.
texts.en:
Lázaro, who is 37 years old, is a responsible, honest and hardworking man. He has always made a living from agriculture, but in addition he typically rears three heifers. He and his partner have three sons who are at school.

For the last 7 years Lázaro has made a living growing vegetables including squash, cucumber, tomatoes and chili peppers. This gives him an income to meet his family expenses. He needs a loan to buy four heifers which he will rear allowing him to make some extra money quickly. He has previously reared three heifers.


Lázaro dreams of being able to help his sons to study so they can become responsible people and enjoy a better life than the one they have today.

loans.use: to buy four heifers

loans.name: Maylinda

texts.en:
Maylinda is 36 years old. She is married with three chidren ages 8, 10 and 12. Maylinda has been in the business of selling street food such as hot dogs and tempura (seafood-flavored battered Japanese dish). "Tempura" is usually deep-fried and to be dip in a hot and sweet sauce. "Tempura" is famous among schools and where there are children.

Maylinda is asking a loan to buy more of these type. She will use the loan to buy hot dogs and stocks of tempura and also pay for cement and renovation of her house. Her income will also pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more tempura, cement and also pay for her house renovation.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma resides in Jagna, Bohol. She is 44 years old and a Sari-sari store owner. She has been operating this business for eight years earning her PHP3000 per month. She is asking a loan to buy liquor, canned food and rice. These items sell in a daily basis. By buying in bulk, she can be assured of a higher earnings. Vilma plans to manage her business well so she can further expand, save and reinvest in the same business, in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned food and liquor

loans.name: Intesar

texts.en:
Intesar is a 35-year-old woman, lives in conflict area located in Dairalla. This woman decided ‎to defy all difficulties, two of which were the most important of difficulties, the deaths of ‎her father and also her husband, so she stated to raise and sell livestock.

She has made great ‎progress with this business. With the income generated, she covers all her needs, such as ‎food and clothing. She is requesting a loan, which she will invest in the purchase of sheep ‎and cows, and to buy more food for the livestock. This woman is working hard to survive ‎along with her family, she is worthy of support and it would be good to loan to her and ‎support the assistance she is requesting.‎

loans.use: to purchase sheep ‎and cows and to buy more food for the livestock.

loans.name: Fidel Angel

texts.es:
Fidel, de 43 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, dejo de estudiar por dedicarse a trabajar y ayudar su padres en los trabajos agrícolas, luego se acompañó con quien actualmente es su esposa y con la que ha procreado tres hijos, de los cuales tres están estudiando y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar el ganado que tienen. 
 
Fidel, es una persona muy trabajadora se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas y a la crianza de ganado, desde muy pequeño le ayudaba a su padre y fue él quien le enseño a trabajar y ahora siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 14,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, de esa manera tiene ingresos para que sus hijos sigan estudiando y tengan lo necesario en su hogar.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos y para comprar dos terneros para repasto.

Fidel, desea seguir trabajando y comprar más ganado para mejorar sus ingresos, para que sus hijos tengan una vida menos sufrida y más estable.
texts.en:
Fidel, 43 years old, studied until the ninth grade. He stopped studying to focus on work and to help his parents with their agricultural work. Later, he entered into a relationship with his current wife. Together, they have three children, two of whom are studying. His wife is a homemaker and cares for their livestock. Fidel is a very hardworking person who makes a living doing agricultural work and raising livestock. Since he was very little, he helped his father, who taught him to work. Now, he plants 7,000 square meters of corn and 14,000 square meters of beans, which provides him with income so that his children can continue studying and have what they need at home.

He needs the loan to purchase organic and chemical fertilizer for his crops and two grazing calves. Fidel wants to continue working and to purchase more cattle to increase his income so that his children have a less troubled and more stable life.

loans.use: to purchase organic and chemical fertilizer for his crops and two grazing calves.

loans.name: Chimwemwe

texts.en:
Chimwemwe is passionate about education. She says because of school she is able to read, write and manage money. Chimwemwe is 29 years old. She is married and has a 3-year-old son called Vincent. Chimwemwe’s dream is to see her son Vincent through college.

Chimwemwe completed her high school education in 2007 and went to college to pursue a course in Accounting. She then worked from 2009 as a sales lady for a sim card distributor and a cashier at a mall. She says the experiences taught her how to deal with customers and manage cash. Chimwemwe left her job when she had her son, she explains that the owner of the shop where she worked could not give her maternity leave and so she had no choice but to leave. She has been looking to start her own business but has had problems accessing start-up capital. It is for this reason that Chimwemwe is requesting her first Kiva loan.

Chimwemwe is requesting for her first Kiva loan so that she can start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent in Lilongwe, Malawi. She will use the loan to purchase a small trading trolley where she will operate from. The trolley is going to be placed outside one of the biggest shops in Malawi and so there will be a lot of traffic. The loan will also be used to serve customers as working capital float in her day to day transactions and to purchase a mobile phone which she will use to perform the transactions.

With the earnings from her business, Chimwemwe is hopeful that she can take her son to a good school. She hopes to grow her business and empower her community by providing jobs so that more people can have an opportunity to have an income and go back to school.

loans.use: to purchase a branded trading trolley and a web-enabled phone and provide the funds needed for her to serve people who need to access financial services .

loans.name: Yeneil

texts.es: Yeneil es un comerciante habitante de Soledad que se inició en esta actividad con la finalidad de sostener a su familia, inicialmente su cadena de comercialización estaba muy limitada; manejaba encargos de familiares, amigos y conocidos, hoy en día su oferta se extiende a trabajadores de empresas sobre todo en el gremio de conductores y sus necesidades de capital de inversión son mayores, es por ello que  está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir prendas de vestir y calzado al por mayor para minimizar los costos y abastecerse para la demanda futura que es la mejor temporada del año en navidad. Yeneil convive con su compañera sentimental y es padre de tres hijos menores de edad a quienes ofrece bienestar con los frutos de su trabajo.  Su meta a futuro es continuar con un inventario variado para que sus ventas se dinamicen.
texts.en: Yeneil is a merchant who lives in Soledad.  He started this profession with the aim of supporting his family.  Initially, his supply chain was very limited; he fulfilled orders from family members, friends and acquaintances.  Today, his supply extends to the workers of businesses mostly in the transportation unions and he has a greater need for capital.  This is why he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to invest in clothing items and footwear in bulk to minimize his costs and to stock up for future demand, since the best season of the year is at Christmastime.  Yeneil lives with his partner and is the father to three dependent children, to whom he provides well-being with the fruits of his labor.  His future goal is to continue with a varied inventory to invigorate his sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing items and footwear.

loans.name: Overcome Challenges - N07T04Tvậnthoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng is 36 years old and she is married. Hằng lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is the group leader of "Overcome challenges - N07T04Tvậnthoá Group", which consists of four members.

Hằng has had a service business providing makeup sessions for four years. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Hằng faces is lack of capital.

Hằng is requesting a loan to purchase more styles of wedding dresses to hire out. This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could improve her living standards.

In the future, Hằng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more styles of wedding dresses to hire out.

loans.name: Alto Mariscal Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALTO MARISCAL SANTA CRUZ” iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elva es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de fruta, servicio de limpieza, venta de cereales, venta de ropa, costura y venta de chamarras, venta de carne.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elva es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de chamarras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió ayudando a sus padres, hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de tela y fibra por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente, a la elaboración de las chamarras, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, las capacitaciones y las reuniones de pago que se realiza en la institución.
texts.en: The communal bank Alto Mariscal Santa Cruz will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo II regional office.  It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors, of which Elva is president.  The members carry out varied businesses, such as food sales, fruit sales, cleaning services, grain sales, clothing sales, chamarra sales [a garment similar to a poncho] and meat sales.  The loan that they will take out will benefit the group of small businesses of which Elva is a member.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago after receiving an invitation from a large-scale promotion that the institution carried out in her area.  Currently, she has a business sewing and selling chamarras.  She says that she learned this business from her parents several years ago.  The loan that she will take out will increase her capital through the purchase of fabric and thread in bulk, which she will acquire from female wholesalers in the city of La Paz.  Afterwards, she will make the chamarras, which she will sell at her market space.  This work method allows her to generate resources to economically support her family, as she is married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health component, the training and the repayment meetings that the institution carries out.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is 43, a widow and has 2 daughters. The only source of income for the family comes from selling small toys. She is requesting 5000 EGP loan to buy more toys to increase her income and guarantee better living conditions for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy more toys for sale as this is her only income.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Chanthou is 30 years old and married with two young children. She lives in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has worked in a factory since 2012, earning $ 7 per day. One of her children attends school who is joining her in the picture. Her husband is 36 years old and he earns the main income to support the family from working as a contraction worker. He has been in the business since 2010, earning $ 5 per day. Chanthou would like to take out a loan, because she needs finances to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell. This loan will help her have enough finances to buy cows and improve her family’s finances. For her future plans, she is going to build fence around her house and support her children to earn high school diplomas.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and breed for calves to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 44 years old and lives in Bien Unido, Bohol. This town is situated near the coastal areas where people relies in fishing and seafood to earn a living. For ten years, she has been engaged in making and selling of salted fish and dried fish. These are a staple food for almost every Filipino household. Salted fish which is locally known as "ginamos" serves as an appetizer every meal time, while dried fish known as "bulad" is usually fried and dipped in vinegar for breakfast. These two are Filipino people's favorite food and some considered it "a-must" in every home.

She is asking a loan to buy salt, more dried fish and salted fish. Anecita hope that through CEVI, she can improve the quality of life for her family and send her children ages 11 and 20 to college.

loans.use: to  buy salt, dried fish and salted fish

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Teresita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell to customers.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 33 years old and lives in Ramtha.‎ He owns a photo studio and he is able to cater for his wife and his three children through the income he gets from this business.

He wants to improve his family house, ‎and improve the standards of his life. Mohammad is a very hardworking man and can be trusted with a loan.

He is now requesting ‎a loan to buy new digital cameras and new tools for his business to expand his work.‎

loans.use: to buy new digital cameras and new tools for his business.

loans.name: Ean

texts.en: Ean is a 31-year-old married grocer with a small child who lives in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has been doing her business for over 5 years. Her husband is a 32-year-old car driver. Ean and her husband can earn around $13 per day. Ean would like to improve her family’s finances, so she needs a loan to buy more groceries and improve her business. In the future, she is going to expand her business, save money to build a proper house, and support her children to go through high school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and improve her business

loans.name: Arcelly

texts.en: Arcelly has started a “Dry Goods” business in 2007. She sell plastic wares, kitchen utensils, slippers, bags and clothes in the municipality of San Miguel, Bohol. As there are competitors, Arcelly has to make ways to have edge over other entrepreneurs on the same business. Arcelly is asking a loan of PHP10000 to buy more plastic wares and clothes that she can sell. With increase inventory and many stocks to choose from she is confident that her business will attract more customers. Her income will be for her three children’s education  ages 7, 8 and 9.

loans.use: to buy more plastic wares and clothes

loans.name: Juanaria

texts.en:
Juanaria is a 58-year-old farmer from the town of  Trinidad, Bohol. She is a hard-working  woman born out of raising seven children that are now grown. Five years ago she also started a Sari-sari store business. She sell seasoning, condiments, items in sachet like coffee, creamer, toothpaste, shampoo, bath soap and detergent. Juanaria is asking a loan to buy fertilizer  for her farm, canned food, shampoo, detergent, coffee, sugar, cooking oil and chips. A well-stock shelves will definitely attract customers.
Juanaria hopes to expand her business so she will not become dependent from her children when it comes to her needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer  for her farm, canned food, shampoo, detergent, coffee, sugar, cooking oil and chips

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hard-working woman who earns a living through running a sari-sari(variety) store. She sold basic household commodities like bread, biscuits, noodles, canned goods,edible oil, eggs, coffee, sugar, powdered milk, bath soap and condiments.
She is married with six children. Four of them are still attending school ages 12-19 year old respectively.
Her husband works in a construction.

For the past 7 years,  María caters mostly neighbors and local settlers in her place. This is why she is asking for a loan from KIVA, through field partner CEVI to purchase grocery items like food, dry goods and soft drinks. In this way she hopes to improve her financial income.

She is very grateful, for your support, and in return she is doing her best to handle it properly to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items like food, dry goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Fe is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of used clothes to sell for her buy and sell used clothes business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Selgie

texts.en:
Selgie is 40 years old, married with two children. One of whom is in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Selgie has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Selgie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more spices and vegetables to sell to customers.

Selgie has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Selgie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell to customers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old and married with four children, She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc

loans.name: Requilda

texts.es:
Requilda con 59 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a sus conviviente desde hace 20 años, no tiene carga familiar.Vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Requilda se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (bodega), además percibe ingresos por su esposo quien es pensionista.El préstamo lo invertirá en scompra de víveres para venta y otros gastos personale, con ello tendrá mayor venta y atención a clientes y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en la calidad de vida.

Requilda con experiencia crediticia con otros bancos (Edpyme Edyficar), pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Requilda is 59 years old. For the past twenty years she and her partner have lived in their own home. She does not have any other family living with her. They live in the Cayaltí district in the Chiclayo province in the department of Lambayeque in Peru. The residents of this area work in commerce, agriculture and ranching.
Requilda sells basic groceries out of her bodega. She also receives income from her husband, who has a pension. 
The loan will be used to purchase provisions which she will sell, and for some personal expenses. Through this loan she will increase her sales and improve her service to customers, thereby increasing her income to improve her quality of life.
She has experience as a borrower with other banks (Edpyme, Edyficar), and [made] punctual repayments

loans.use: to purchase supplies to sell.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel, 33 years old, is married and has three children, all in school. Raquel works very hard to provide for them. For the past six years, Raquel has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell. In the future, Raquel would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past seven years, she has operated a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Salvacion successfully repaid her previous loan and she has now requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Salvacion has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. In the future, Salvacion would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily, 48 years old, is married and has one child who is in school. Emily works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 23 years, Emily has operated a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as sugar, spices, canned goods and other groceries.

Emily has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell. In the future, Emily would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tina Marie

texts.en: Tina Marie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She has a general store in the Philippines. Tina Marie successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Tina Marie dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Charmilou

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Charmilou works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Charmilou successfully repaid her previous loan, and she has now requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Charmilou is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell. Charmilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Ountouch's Group

texts.en:
The members of Ountouch’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province, Cambodia. Ountouch works as a farm laborer and also does extra work as a construction worker to support her family.

In Ountouch's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en: The members of Ra’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province, Cambodia. Ra works as a farmer and also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family. In his village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Saem's Group

texts.en:
Saem’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Saem works as farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ny works as farmer and she also does extra work as a construction worker and tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phally works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
For the last 3 years, Anabelle has raised livestock like goats and cows. To have additional an source of income, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities ranging from beverages, seasonings, noodles, and canned goods to toiletries.


Anabelle is a married woman with four children residing in the town of Barili, Cebu. She owns a house and in front of it is situated her sari-sari (variety) store, catering mostly to locals in her place. She would like to improve her earnings by increasing her amount of livestock and having additional capital to purchase inventory for her store. She has requested a loan to buy a goat and groceries for the store such as powdered milk, eggs, cooking oil and toiletries.

She is thankful for your support as this loan could serve as the tool to improve her livelihood and a way to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy a goat and groceries for her store such as powdered milk, eggs, cooking oil and toiletries.

loans.name: Delmis Esmeralda

texts.es:
Delmis, de 36 años de edad, es una persona emprendedora, estudio hasta quinto grado, cuando ella tenía tres años de edad sus padres se separaron y ella quedó bajo la responsabilidad de su abuela y desde los doce años de edad ella empezó a trabajar, para ayudar a su abuela con la alimentación; ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra y trabajo tres años de empleada doméstica, pero actualmente se dedica a hacer recuerdos y adornos para bautismos, cumpleaños y bodas. 

Delmis, se dedica a hacer recuerdos y adornos para bautismos cumpleaños, quince años, bodas y toda ocasión, de esa manera obtiene ingresos para llevar el sustento diario a su familia y para mandar a su hija y a sus sobrinos a estudiar, para que en un futuro tengan una mejor estabilidad y puedan tener más oportunidades de superación. 

Delmis, necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para seguir haciendo arreglos, porque tiene seis trabajos que le han encargado y no tiene la suficiente materia prima para cumplir con los encargos. 

Delmis, sueña con ampliar su negocio y contratar una o dos personas más para que le ayuden en su negocio.
texts.en:
Delmis is 36 years old. She is an entrepreneurial person. She went to school up to the fifth grade. When she was three years old her parents separated and she was left under the responsibility of her grandmother. From the time she was twelve years of age she began to work in order to help her grandmother with food. She learned to work the land and she worked three years as a domestic. Now, she works making souvenirs and adornments for baptisms, birthdays and weddings.

Delmis works making souvenirs and adornments for baptisms, birthdays, special fifteen-year-old birthday celebrations, weddings and for all occasions. In this way she has income for the daily support of her family and to send her daughter and her nieces/nephews to study so that in the future they will have improved stability and can have more opportunities for self-improvement.

Delmis needs the loan to buy goods in order to continue making party supplies because she has six orders that have to be delivered and she does not have sufficient raw material to fulfill those orders.

Delmis' dream is to expand her business and to hire one or two more people to help her in her business.

loans.use: to buy goods to continue making party supplies

loans.name: Wensie

texts.en:
Wensie is 46 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Wensie has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. Wensie requested a PHP 11,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

In the future, Wensie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Narin

texts.en:
Narin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business. Narin has been in this business for 2 years. She earns additional income from planting vegetables.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Phus's Group

texts.en:
The members of Phus’ group live in a rural village in Kandal province, Cambodia. Phus makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In Phus' village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Theoun's Group

texts.en:
The members of Theoun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province, Cambodia. Theoun makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a factory laborer and seller to support her family.

In Theoun's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Khishigdavaa

texts.en:
Mr. Khishigdavaa, 48 years old, lives with his wife and son in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been transporting people from city to city since 2008. His wife stays at home and takes care of domestic work. Their son provides a taxi service.

Mr. Khishigdavaa is requesting a loan of $1,500 US to renovate his house as winter is near. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Enkhshur

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkshur, 28 years old, lives with her husband and son in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as an inspector at the power plant since 2012. Her husband is a photographer and owns his studio. Their son goes to elementary school.

She is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. By doing so her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara, a 28-year-old woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol is into selling fresh fish.  She is  married with three children ages 1, 3 and 4. Her husband is a farmer. Clara spend her time selling fish, crabs and shrimp. She usually buy her seafoods from the fishermen in her place. She is asking a loan to buy more supplies of shrimp, crabs and fresh fish. With an additional capital, she will have a chance to sell more way into the afternoon and earn better this way. Her income will put a healthy meal for her children and pay their school fees.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, crabs and fresh fish

loans.name: Helaria

texts.en:
Helaria works hard to support her family. Helaria is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair.

Helaria has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Helaria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets and materials for boat repair.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 9 years. 

In the future Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Herra

texts.en:
Herra is 39 years old and a widow with two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Herra has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to resell.

Herra has been in this business for three years. In the future, Herra would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en:
Maysoon is a 30 year old woman. She has four children and lives with her family in rented ‎house in Wihdat.
Maysoon is very hard worker, for years she has made living selling dresses, to improve the ‎standards of her living and to help her husband in the household expenses, her business is ‎going well and she wants to expand and develop it.‎

With this loan she will be able to supply new dresses. She is very thankful to Kiva because ‎she will be able to continue strengthening her business and provide greater variety to her ‎customers. In the future, she has planned to open independent shop in order to continue ‎growing.‎

loans.use: to be able to buy more dresses for sale.

texts.en:

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

texts.en: Seinath’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Seinath makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and accountant to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Leatu

texts.en:
Leatu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Leatu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Leatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Leatu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest time. As a Babban Gona member, Leatu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Leatu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time .

loans.name: Nhel's Group

texts.en: Nhel’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nhel makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and officer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana, 51, is from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is happily married to Nolasco, her business partner. Raising seven children in a third world country is a big challenge for the couple but with their faith and hard work they face the challenge courageously. Although not all her children has finished schooling, all seven of them are already working. They have one child who is a college student and one who is a high school student. 

Juana derives her income from her small general store which she has been running for eight years. To grow and fill her store with essential food items such as bread, biscuits, canned good, instant noodles, eggs, oil and toiletries, she is seeking your help in the amount of Php 30,000. She hopes you can help her so she could continue to send her two children to school and meet their daily needs.

Her precious dream is to see her two children finish college. She aims to expand her store. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell pineapples.  Maria Fe is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish  vending business.

Maria Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Lizyl

Lizyl requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Lizyl would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Nelinda has been in this business for 20 years. Nelinda earns more income from buy and sell bananas and bread.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en:
Norlyn is 38 years old and married with nine children.

She  works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell dried coconut meat in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Norlyn has been in this business for 10 years.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 28 years old and has three children. May is married and has three children are currently in school.

May is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. May requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

May has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, May would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like charcoal retailing.

Marilyn dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell accessories.  Melanie is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to  purchase more items of ready-to-wear clothing to sell like T-shirts, shirts, shorts, etc.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to.

loans.use: to purchase more items of ready-to-wear clothing to sell like T-shirts, shirts, shorts, etc

loans.name: Melcha

texts.en:
Melcha is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melcha is 52 years old and has two children are still in school.

Melcha has a food vending business in the Philippines. Melcha requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients meat, fish, pork, spices and other materials for her food production business.

Melcha has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients meat, fish, pork, spices and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 50 years old, married and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Olivia requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Olivia has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Olivia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 49 years old, married with four children.

Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care.

Mercy has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending and E-loading.

Mercy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:

She is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

Victoria has been  for 10 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers

texts.en: Sreyra’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreyra makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and as a seller by selling fish to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Armando Cesar

texts.es: Armando es un microempresario que habita junto a su familia en un barrio de Barranquilla, que inició su propio negocio con la intensión de velar por el bienestar de su hogar, él decidió aceptar la propuesta que su hija le hizo de vender en su vivienda refrescos, bolis, cubetas de hielo y pasabocas, actividad que desarrolla todos los días de la semana a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. Este emprendedor de 66 años de edad encontró una oportunidad de generar ingresos y de estar en constante dinamismo hace cinco años, en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en gaseosas, jugos y pasabocas al por mayor con la finalidad de mejorar sus costos y garantizar mayores ganancias.  Su meta de negocio es remodelar el local para mejorar la imagen y su meta personal es realizar adecuaciones para tener mejores condiciones de habitabilidad.
texts.en:
Armando is a micro-entrepreneur who lives with his family in a neighbourhood of Barranquilla. He began his own business with the intention of ensuring the well-being of his home. He decided to accept the proposal that his daughter made him of selling soft drinks, ice cream treats, ice trays and appetizers from his house. He does this every day of the week from 8AM until 8PM.

This entrepreneur is 66 years old. Five years ago he encountered an opportunity to generate income and he has put constant energy into it. He is now applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo to invest in wholesale soft drinks, juices and appetizers with the purpose of improving his costs and guaranteeing greater earnings. His business goal is to remodel his selling area to improve its looks and his personal goal is to make renovations to have improved living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in wholesale soft drinks, juices and appetizers

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 22 years old and single. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Mary Joy has a buy-and-sell jewelry business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more jewelry to sell.

Mary Joy has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Lysreylang's Group

texts.en: Lysreylang’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Lysreylang makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Soun's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Tbaung Khmum province, Soun is 55 years old and a mother of six children. Nowadays, she needs to support two schoolchildren.

For a living, Soun grows cassava and rice as her main source of income. The cassava’s price is decreasing in the market and it also made her family’s income decrease. She has involved in her business for 37 years and it earns her about USD 11 per day.

This is Soun's first loan cycle with VisionFund Cambodia and she is the group leader of three members.

Soun will spend her portion of the loan to purchase more fertilizer to use on her cassava farm, to produce a good yield.
