She hopes that her cassava grows well and earns her a decent income, to upgrade her living condition and support her children’s education on time.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizer to use on her cassava farm in order to grow her crop well and increase her income.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hard-working entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy charcoal to sell through her business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like farming rice.

Marilou dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell through her business.

loans.name: Jeanie

texts.en:
Jeanie is 20 years old. She is very hardworking and friendly. She is the youngest of five siblings. Jeanie describes growing up as tough, she lost her mother when she was only two years old and grew up with my Aunt in Lilongwe, the capital city of Malawi. She says it was hard because her aunt already had many other children to take care of.

Jeanie has just completed a training with Zoona to start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent in Lilongwe. This means that Jeanie will provide mobile money services to people who need to access financial services and earn a profit. In the first six months of her business, Zoona will support her with a weekly stipend to support her while she gets her business off the ground. Jeanie says starting her own business will give her the opportunity to be self-sufficient and no longer be dependent on her aunt. She is hopeful that with the income, she can be able to assist her family by helping to provide their daily needs such as Sugar and Maize meal every month. This would be her way of giving back for the support they have given her though out the years.

With this loan, Jeanie will be able to purchase a trading trolley, a mobile phone and have the funds needed to serve her customers. She says she is excited to run her own business as a Zoona Agent because Zoona is easy to use and the people really benefit because financial institutions can be difficult for people in Malawi who only have little education.
Jeanie’s dream is to save up enough money so that she can take herself to school to study for a diploma in Business Management. She thanks Kiva and Zoona for this opportunity.

loans.use: to provide the working capital float and purchase the equipment need for her to set up her  own business as a Zoona mobile money Agent in Lilongwe, Malawi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pig food.

loans.name: Maynor Norberto

texts.es:
Maynor es un hombre  de 25 años de edad, es casado con dos hijos de las edades entre 2 y 4 años de edad, él vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en una comunidad de San Jorge La Laguna.
Mayor su principal actividad económica es la compra y venta de abarrotes pues desde la comunidad de su hogar tiene instalada una tienda, con este negocio tiene él tres años de realizarlo. Mayor  está solicitando un préstamo para realizar una inversión en su pequeña tienda de abarrotes esto con el fin de surtir mejor su tienda y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes.
Su gran esperanza de vida es lograra tener su propia casa y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Maynor is a 25-year-old man who is married with two children between the ages of 2 and 4. He lives with his wife and their children in a community of San Jorge La Laguna. Maynor's primary business is buying and selling groceries, since he has a store in his home. He has had this business for three years. Maynor is asking for a loan to make an investment in his small grocery store in order to better stock his store and satisfy his customers' needs. His great hope in life is to be able to have his own home and to improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy and sell groceries

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She has run a farming business since 2000. She also operate a Sari-sari store business in the area. She and her support  two children ages 16 and 19. With the money that she applied for a loan, she plans to use it for the purchase of farming maintenance like fertilizer and merchandise such as canned sardines, corned beef, sausages, seasoning, condiments and toiletries. The additional income will go to her children’s education and the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and merchandise such as canned sardines, corned beef, sausages, seasoning, condiments and toiletries

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en: Virgilia is dependent on her rice fields to provide for her family. Other than this livelihood, her husband also helped by driving a motorcycle to earn a living. Virgilia is asking a loan of PHP20000 to buy cement, hard wood and pay for labor so that she can renovate her house. It is also important for her to give her family a decent home. Virgilia plans to manage her business well so that she can pay her dues on time. Any other income generated will be for family consumption and school fees of her three children ages six, twelve and fifteen.

loans.use: to buy cement, hard wood, nails and pay for labor

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, milk, egg, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling dried fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Julie dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, milk, egg, etc.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her raising ducks.

Emely dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Felanie

texts.en:
Ma. Felanie is 46 years old and married with ten children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Felanie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Felanie requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Ma. Felanie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Oyunbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunbayar, 55 years old, lives with her only daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been teaching at a local health science university for 31 years and is renowned for her extraordinary teaching ability.

In 2010, she began to run a pharmacy near her home in order to generate more income. Her daughter helps her to operate the pharmacy. She is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for her house renovation. By doing so her family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Greyler

texts.en:
Greyler is a hard-working entrepreneur and mother of two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

She earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Greyler dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell.

loans.name: Elsea

texts.en:
Elsea is a hard-working entrepreneur and mother of three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, and noodles.

She earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

Elsea dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.
.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, and noodles.

loans.name: Decty Yaneth

texts.es:
Decty, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, debido a que su familia era de bajos recursos económicos no siguió estudiando, ella desde muy pequeña ha trabajado vendiendo verduras y pescado, casa por casa por toda la comunidad, para ayudar económicamente a su familia, actualmente está acompañada y tiene un hijo por el cual se esmera trabajando para darle la alimentación y el apoyo para que siga estudiando.

Decty, se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, tiene varios años de vender en el mercado durante la mañana y durante la tarde vende en su comunidad y en los alrededores casa por casa, para llevar el sustento diario a su familia y para mandar a su hijo a la escuela, para que en un futuro tenga una mejor estabilidad y pueda tener un mejor trabajo. 

Decty, necesita el préstamo para comprar chile, tomate, zanahoria, repollo y plátanos para salir a vender.

Decty, sueña con tener mejores ingresos para construir su vivienda, porque actualmente su casa es de láminas.
texts.en:
Decty is 31 years old and studied up to the second grade. She did not continue studying because family had few financial resources. From a very young age, she has worked selling vegetables and fish door-to-door around her entire community in order to help her family financially. She is currently in a relationship and has a son for whom she strives while working so she can feed him and support him so he keeps studying.

Decty makes a living by selling fruits and vegetables. For many years, she has been selling in the market in the mornings and in her community and the surrounding areas during the afternoons. She does this to support her family on a daily basis and to send her son to school so that he can have greater stability in the future and have a better job.

Decty needs the loan to buy peppers, tomatoes, carrots, cabbage and plantains to go out to sell.

Decty dreams of having better earnings to build her own home, because her house is currently made of sheet metal.

loans.use: to buy peppers, tomatoes, carrots, cabbage and plantains to go out to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 33 years old and a member of CCT General Trias branch. She is married to Nemuel, an offset printer operator. They have one child who is in elementary school and another who is a toddler.

The couple help each other make a living to cover their daily needs and prepare for the education of their children. She has been a van operator for four years and her income has helped with her family's daily sustenance.

Virginia offers her van to rent for transportation service or for people who need a van for out-of- town trips. She provide services within the city and to nearby provinces. As the population grows in her province, more people are in need of transportation.

To help her continue operation of her business, Virginia is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to buy a radiator and tires for her van. Proper and regular maintenance of her unit is a must to ensure safe and efficient service. She will be grateful for your support of her livelihood. This will enable her to send her children to school.

Virginia aims to acquire one more van to increase her income and save for the education of her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for a radiator and tires for her van.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 30 years old and married, with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Leny has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Leny has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 56 years ol and married with five children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Corazon has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional firewood to sell.

Corazon has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 42 years old, married and has four children who are all in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Marlyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the labor of farm preparation and to buy rice seed.

Marlyn has been farming rice for 10 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for the labor of farm preparation and to buy rice seed.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Nilda works hard to support her family. She has a jewelry "buy-and-sell" business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from frozen foods.

Nilda is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy more jewelry to resell. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to resell.

loans.name: Ernanie

texts.en:
Ernanie is 48 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more household goods to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, etc.

Ernanie has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more household goods to sell, like soap, shampoo, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Elba Elena

texts.es:
Elba es una joven de 22 años muy emprendedora, egresada de la carrera de Marketing y Publicidad. Su principal apoyo son su mama y su abuelita. Elba decidió estudiar esta carrera porque presenta mucha demanda de trabajo y ella quiere crecer profesionalmente. 
Elba tiene deseos de obtener su título y convertirse en una profesional es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para pagar su título profesional y de esta manera contribuir al desarrollo de su país y a la economía de su hogar.
texts.en: Elba is a very enterprising 22-year-old young woman who has graduated from a degree program in Marketing and Publicity. She is supported primarily by her mom and grandmother. Elba decided to study for this career because there is a lot of demand for this work and she wants to grow professionally. Elba wants to obtain her certification and become a professional. For this reason she is asking for a loan to pay for her professional certification so she can contribute to her country's development and to her household budget.

loans.use: to pay for her professional certification

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hard-working entrepreneur with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Edna dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is single and works hard to support herself. She has a snack food vending business in the Philippines

She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more snack food to resell.

Virginia has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more snack food to resell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, noodles, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Rose has been in this business for two years. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, noodles, spices, etc

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a widow woman and has eight grown children. She hails from the town of Dumanjug, Cebu. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and maintaining capital for her enterprise.

She weaves native products like coin purses made of native palm. Also, for almost five years she has owned a sari-sari (variety) store, serving neighbors and local dwellers. She faces a major challenge in that she lacks liquid capital to expand both of her sources of income.

Teresa decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost her business. With the 5,000 PHP, she wants to purchase grocery items and materials for weaving, like native palm. She is hoping to have a stable source of income in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase materials for weaving, like native palm, and grocery items.

loans.name: Greenchar

texts.en:
GreenChar turns agricultural waste into charcoal briquettes for use as a clean-burning cooking fuel.

Founded in 2014 by Tom (pictured), an 18 year-old Kenyan entrepreneur, GreenChar is eliminating the smoke from wood and biomass cooking fires common to Kenya and Sub-Saharan Africa.  Smoke from these fires kill millions of women and children each year, and sickens millions of others, including Tom's mother.

GreenChar has to-date sold over 10 tons of near-smokeless briquettes, manufactured from the leftover waste of sugarcane growers.  These briquettes have reached 4,000 households, effecting 20,000 lives.

All this progress, and the company doesn't own a vehicle to distribute the briquettes.  The money you lend will be used to fill that gap, to help GreenChar expand their distribution across all of Kenya.

GreenChar is a revenue-generating, for-profit social enterprise, which will grow its revenues with your help.

loans.use: to purchase a truck for distributing briquettes to retailers

loans.name: Andre

texts.pt: O senhor Andre é casado, vive com a esposa e três filhos. É docente/militar, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar materiais de construção tais como, cimento, chapas de zinco, pranchas, tijoleiras, cimento cola e ferro. Tem sonho de concluir e mobiliar a sua casa e comprar uma viatura para o negócio. Tem como maior desafio, o financeiro.
texts.en:
Andre is married, and lives with his wife and three children. He is a teacher and works for the military.

With this loan, he is planning to buy construction materials, such as cement, zinc sheets, dimensional lumber, bricks, mortar, and iron.

He dreams of finishing building his house and furnishing it, and buying a vehicle for his business. Financing is his main challenge.

loans.use: to buy cement, zinc sheets, dimensional lumbers, bricks, mortar, and iron.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 55 years old and married, with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy charcoal to sell through her business.

Edna has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell through her business.

loans.name: Evelin Maria

texts.es:
Evelin, de 26 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 6 hijos.

Evelin, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 3 años, fue su madre quien le enseño a vender y a trabajar de esta manera, por lo cual le agradece por esta enseñanza, que le permite hoy ganarse el pan de cada día, con esto ella logrará ayudar con los gastos de la casa y les permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Evelin, necesita el dinero para comprar ropa y accesorios de belleza para vender.

Evelin, sueña con ver crecer a sus hijos y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Evelin, aged 26, is in a relationship and has six children.

She has been earning a living selling clothing for the last three years. It was her mother who taught her about sales and how to follow this occupation. Evelin is grateful for these teachings, which allow her to earn her daily bread, help with the household expenses, and have a better quality of life.

Evelin is requesting this loan to buy clothing and beauty accessories to sell.

Her dreams are to see her children grow and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing and beauty accessories to sell.

loans.name: Jairo Abelino

texts.es:
Jairo, de 28 años de edad, es un joven trabajador y responsable, está casado y su esposa y su pequeña hija son su adoración y felicidad.

Jairo, trabaja con su pick-up transportando estudiantes y además transporta agua, porque en la zona donde vive es muy escasa y es necesario comprarla.

Jairo, necesita el préstamo para comprar un tanque, una bomba achicadora y comprar nueva la suspensión de su vehículo.

Jairo, sueña con comprar un mejor vehículo para hacer viajes al aeropuerto.
texts.en:
Jairo is a hard-working and responsible young man. He is 28 years old and married. His wife and little daughter are his devotion and happiness.

Jairo works with his pick-up truck transporting students and also water, because it is very scarce in the area where he lives and it is necessary to buy it.

Jairo needs the loan to buy a tank, water pump and also to buy a new suspension for his vehicle.

Jairo dreams of buying a better vehicle to make trips to the airport.

loans.use: to buy a tank, a water pump and a new suspension for his vehicle.

loans.name: Makbuba

texts.ru: Макбуба, 54 года, замужем, есть 2 детей. Образование у нее среднее. На протяжении 30 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее есть 2 коровы, на 1,0 Га земли выращивает кукурузу. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Макбуба обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и на полеводческие нужды. Доходы от бизнеса Макбуба собирается направить на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Makbuba is 54 years old, married, and has 2 daughters. She has a secondary-level education. Over the course of the last 30 years, she has been doing agricultural work. Makbuba has 2 cows, and she grows corn on 1.0 hectare of land. Her monthly income is around 20,000 som (KGS).

In order to further expand her business, Makbuba has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock and some required items for working her field. Makbuba is going to use the income from her business to continue developing her business, and to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy livestock and to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Albino

texts.pt: O senhor Albino é casado, vive com a esposa e cinco filhos. É um reformado, com o presente  empréstimo pretende comprar matérias primas para o fabrico de blocos para vender, tais como,pó de pedra, areia e cimento. Tem sonho de desenvolver no seu negocio de estaleiro cada vez mais para poder oferecer melhores condições de vida a sua familia. Tem como maior desafio, trabalhar cada vez mais.
texts.en:
Albino is married, and lives with his wife and five children. He is retired from the military.

He will use the loan to buy raw materials to make bricks for sale, such as stone dust, sand, and cement.

His dream is to expand his bricks business every day more, in order to better provide for his family. His main challenge is to work every day more.

loans.use: to purchase stone dust, sand, and cement.

loans.name: Borey

texts.en:
Borey is 20 years old and single. He is a student from the Kandal Province in Cambodia. He is taking an Accounting major at a university.

In order to support his studying, he has also worked at an insurance company in the city. Being on staff, Borey can earn approximately $6.83 per day.

Borey is in his second year at the university. Since he is lacking finances to pay his second-semester tuition fees for his second year, he requested a loan, which will help him finish this semester successfully.

In the future, he plans on finding another better job with a reasonable salary, so that he will be able to build a new proper house.

loans.use: to pay his second-semester tuition fees for his second year.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 43-year-old married woman with two children.

She has raised pigs for 8 years and needs 24,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies. She earns additional income from a general store.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies to raise her business.

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is a 42-year-old married woman with five children, one attends schools. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.\

Regie has had a barber shop business for 10 years and needs 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials to maintain her business.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Serlina

texts.en:
Serlina works hard to support her family. She is married with one child and has a buy and sell personal collection business in the Philippines.

Serlina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products like body lotion, beauty soap, perfume, etc., to sell.

Serlina has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products like body lotion, beauty soap, perfume, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ester works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Ester is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ester has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional baskets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Arzykan

texts.ru: Арзыкан, 56 лет, замужем, 2 детей (школьник и студент). У Арзыкан высшее образование, в 2005 году она начала заниматься торговлей женской одеждой на рынке в арендованном контейнере. Благодаря упорному труду, Арзыкан увеличила товарооборот до 200,000 сом (KGS), что позволило ей накопить на покупку квартиры для ее семьи. Арзыкан обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для расширения ассортимента. Арзыкан приобретет куртки, плащи, теплые кофты и прочее. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в расширение бизнеса, Арзыкан планирует арендовать еще один контейнер.
texts.en:
Arzykan is 56 years and married. She has two children, one in school and one studying at a university. Arzykan has a post-secondary education, and in 2005 she began working in retail sale, selling women's clothing at the market from a rented stall. Thanks to her very hard work, Arzykan has increased her turnover to 200,000 som (KGS), which has allowed her to save to buy an apartment for her family.

Arzykan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy clothing to expand her selection. Arzykan will purchase jackets, raincoats, warm sweaters, and other similar items. She plans to invest the income from her loan in the expansion of her business. Arzykan plans to rent another stall.

loans.use: to purchase jackets, coats, warm sweaters and others women's clothes for retail sale

loans.name: Alberata

texts.pt: A senhora Alberata é casada, vive com o esposo e três filhos.  É docente, com o presente  empréstimo pretende comprar materiais de construção tais como cimento e ferro. Tem sonho de terminar a casa, mobiliar e adquirir um novo espaço para construir outra casa. Tem como maior desafio, dedicação em assumir os seus compromissos.
texts.en:
Alberata is married, and lives with her husband and three children. She is a teacher.

She is planning to use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement and iron.

She dreams of finishing building and furnishing her house, and of buying a new piece of land where she can build another house. Her main challenge is to focus on fulfilling her responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy cement and iron.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 55 years old and married, with four children.

She is in an agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Merlita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Merlita has been in this business for ten years and also earns additional income from raising ducks.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a 62-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Norma has had a fire wood business for 5 years and needs 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fire wood to sell.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fire wood to sell.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina works hard to support her family and 2 children.

She has a food vending business and earns additional income from a general store. Rizalina is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy meat, fish, vegetables, spices, pork, and cooking oil for her food production business.

Rizalina has sustained her business through 2 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy  meat, fish, vegetables, spices, pork, and cooking oil for her food production business.

loans.name: Leonor Martina

texts.es:
En el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos se encuentra el Recinto San Bernabé un lugar muy hermoso con un  clima cálido húmedo, su gente es muy amable y trabajadora este Recinto  es el punto de llegada de muchos turistas ya que a los alrededores del mismo tienen hosterías y ríos en las que se puede descansar y ser tratados con mucha amabilidad.
En este Recinto vive y tiene su negocio la señora Leonor una mujer luchadora y emprendedora de 56 años ella es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo de 13 años y un sobrino de 19 años que también vive con ella; Leonor se dedica a crianza de cerdos y venta de lechones, aprendió este negocio por iniciativa propia para poder mantener a su hijo y sobrino, le dedica un promedio de 4 horas diarias.
Solicita el crédito para ampliar su negocio construyendo más chancheras ya que tiene cerdas madres y necesita espacio para los lechones ella sabe que es una actividad que le ha ayudado a salir adelante motivo por el cual desea seguir mejorando su negocio.
Con esta nueva inversión espera mejorar sus ingresos ya que podrá atraer a más compradores de cerdos teniendo mayor demanda, la señora Leonor agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
In the San Miguel de los Bancos canton you can find the precinct of San Bernabé, a very beautiful place with a warm, humid climate. The people there are very friendly and hard-working. This precinct is the point of arrival for many tourists and there are inns and rivers in the outskirts where one can rest and be treated with great kindness.

Leonor lives and has her business in this precinct. She is a brave and enterprising 56-year-old woman. She is a single mother with one son aged 13 and a 19-year-old nephew who also lives with her. Leonor earns a living through breeding pigs and selling piglets. She learned this trade on her own initiative so that she could support her son and nephew. She works an average of 4 hours per day.

She is asking for the loan to increase her business by building more pigsties as she already has expectant sows and she needs space for the piglets. She knows this is a job that has helped her to get ahead which is why she wants to keep improving her business.

With this new investment she hopes to improve her income so that she will be able to attract more buyers with pigs being in greater demand. Leonor is grateful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the help and opportunities they have given.

loans.use: to expand her pigsties and get more sows so that she can attract more buyers and have greater demand.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Молодая красивая девушка Шахноза. Она жительница города Душанбе. Девушки города Душанбе талантливые, умные, образованные, трудолюбивые и красивые. Шахноза одна из тех жителей города. Ей 19 лет. Она замужем и не имеет детей. Шахноза живет вместе матерью и мужем. У Шахнозы мечта иметь собственный бизнес. Она любить кроить и шить женскую одежду. Шахноза решила заниматься шитьем женской одежды и идти по стопам матерью. Шахноза просит кредит для купли швейной машинки и швейные принадлежности. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей начать швейную дело.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a beautiful young woman. She is a resident of Dushanbe. Young women from Dushanbe are talented, intelligent, educated, hard-working and beautiful, and Shahnoza is one of these residents.

Shahnoza is 19 years old, married, and does not have children. She lives with her mother and husband. Shahnoza dreams of having her own business, and she loves to cut out and sew women's clothing. She has decided to follow in her mother's footsteps and work by sewing women's clothing.

Shahnoza is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine and other sewing accessories. The requested loan will help her start her sewing business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and other sewing accessories.

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia works hard to support her family and 3 children.

She has a fishing business and earns additional income from a general store. Francia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests an additional loan to further build her business.

Francia has sustained her business with 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a 37-year-old married woman with two children, both attend school

Roselyn has raised pigs for 3 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies.

She has previously borrowed 3 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Aziya

texts.ru: Азия, 53 года, в разводе, воспитывает 3 детей. На протяжении 15 лет она занимается полеводством и животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы и 15 овец. На земельной доле она выращивает клубнику. Также занимается реализацией овощей и фруктов. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 15,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи, поэтому, в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Азия обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 8 овец. Азия является одной из 3 участников группы "Ак-Пейил". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en: Aziya is 53 years old, divorced and raising 3 children. She has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 15 years. She has 3 cows and 15 sheep on her farm. She grows strawberries on her land. Aziya is also involved in selling vegetables and fruits. Her monthly profit amounts to 15,000 som (KGS), but this money is not enough for a decent life and support for her family. This is why, to continue developing her business, Aziya requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to increase her livestock headcount by buying 8 sheep. Aziya is one of the three members of the Ak-Peyil group. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase 8 sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount and income

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru: Уулкан, 53 года, замужем, 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Уулкан, у нее есть 4 коровы, 20 коз и овец. Летом скот отгоняют на пастбище, зимой содержат в сараях. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, Уулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита Уулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса и покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en:
Uulkan is 53 years old, married, and has 3 children. She has a secondary-level education, and she does agricultural work as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to Uulkan's very hard work, she has 4 cows, 20 goats and a sheep. In summer she sends the livestock out to pasture, and in winter she keeps them in shelters. Uulkan's monthly income is around 11,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Uulkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for breeding. Uulkan plans to invest the income from her loan by continuing to enlarge her business, and plans to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy some livestock to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 42 years old. He has been working as an electrician for over five years. Mario needs a loan to buy electric tools and materials to resell. Mario is convinced that he will do a good business because he has experience with the costs of the materials.

Mario is still helping his parents and living with them. Mario is at his house in the picture.

loans.use: to buy electric tools and materials to resell.

loans.name: Primavera Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Primavera Poty está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité, es un grupo nuevo que se unió para que todas por medio del trabajo unido puedan ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Porfiria es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su pequeña despensa en donde tiene lo básico como comestibles, artículos de limpieza,. Verduras, etc. Solicita este préstamo para poder surtir su local, con verduras, frutas, bebidas, carne, panificados y otros, y así brindarle a la gente de su alrededor mas variedades sin tener que depender de las ciudades aledañas. Desea que esta ayuda pueda servirle a ella y a sus compañeras de comités para progresar, darles un futuro mejor a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Primavera Poty" loan group is on its first loan cycle as part of the women's committee programme. This is a new group where the members are helping their families through their work.

Porfiria is one member of the group. She has a small shop where she sells consumables, cleaning products, vegetables and more.

Porfiria is applying for this loan in order to stock up her shop with vegetables, fruits, drinks, meat, breads and more. She can thus offer locals more variety, and they will not have to depend on the nearby cities.

Porfiria hopes that this loan will help her and her fellow members of the communal bank to progress, and will give their families a better future.

loans.use: Comprar verduras, frutas, bebidas, carne, panificados y otros

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
16 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, ellas son de la ciudad de San Ignacio, cada una esta poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Eva es una de las integrantes del grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que se esfuerza para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener, y de esa forma evitar que pasen por necesidades.
Eva pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, botones, hilos y otros, ya que ella se dedica a las confecciones pues es modista, y de esa forma poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, y seguir creciendo en el emprendimiento que tiene.
texts.en:
Sixteen women make up this group. They are from the city of San Ignacio, and each one is putting in her greatest effort to improve the living conditions of herself and her family.

Mrs. Eva is one of the members of this group. She’s a very hardworking and enterprising woman who strives to give her family everything that she didn’t. In this way, she keeps them from lacking anything.

Eva asks for this loan to be able to buy fabric, thread, buttons, yarn, and other items since she is a dressmaker and makes readymade dresses. With it, she will be able to fill her customer’s orders and continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, yarn, and other items.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena es una joven de 24 años que hace parte del negocio familiar de panadería, esta emprendedora mujer es madre de una niña de apenas dos años de edad y en compañía de su cónyuge residen en un barrio de Barranquilla.  Lorena decidió estar al tanto del negocio familiar porque le permitía estar más cerca de su hija velando por su educación, así mismo esta experiencia es muy valiosa para su vida y le permite ofrecer bienestar a su familia.  Diariamente su negocio apertura a las 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. horario en el que distribuye a seis vendedores que recorren la ciudad para vender panes, deditos (queso cubierto con harina de trigo), pastelitos, donas y muslitos de pollo. Lorena realizó una solicitud de su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en materias primas y continuar con el ejercicio de su actividad sin contratiempos y así garantizar mayores ventas.  Su meta a futuro es realizar mejoras locativas al negocio y adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en: Lorena is a young woman of 24 years who is part of a family bakery business. She is an entrepreneurial woman and the mother of a daughter who is just two years old and with her spouse lives in a neighborhood in Barranquilla. Lorena decided to be part of the family business because it allows her to be close to her daughter looking after her education, and at the same time the experience is very valuable for her life and allows her to provide for her family. Everyday her business is open from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m., during which time six vendors travel all over the city to sell bread, deditos (cheese covered with wheat flour) cakes, donuts, and chicken drumsticks. Lorena is requesting a Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest it in ingredients and continue to work at this business without problems and thus guarantee greater sales. Her goal for the future is to achieve better gains  for the business and to have her own home.

loans.use: to invest in ingredients

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes has engaged in vegetable gardening for three years now. She grows tomatoes, eggplants, and other vegetables that are suitable in a hot climate.

She has a three-year old son and it gives her a source of inspiration and joy to work hard every day to meet her child's basic needs, like nutritious food and better shelter. Her partner also has an income that could defray the family's daily expenses.

She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy farm supplies, like medicine, fertilizer, and seedlings. These will help augment her higher yield. Thus, she could slowly settle her obligation and be able to improve her gardening livelihood, too.

In the future, Agnes is looking forward to doing her very best in order to save money for the education of her child, for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, like medicine, fertilizer, and seedlings.

loans.name: Burulbu

texts.ru: Бурулбу, 56 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении 21 года она занимается полеводством и животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы и 20 овец. На 2,50 Га земли она выращивает картофель, фасоль. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 29,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота, часть средств направит на покупку удобрений и топлива для полеводства. Бурулбу является одним из 3 участников группы "Ак-Пейил". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса и покупку трактора.
texts.en: Burulbu is 56 years old, a widow and mother of 3 children. She has a secondary education and has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 21 years. Her farm contains 4 cows and 20 sheep. She grows potatoes and beans on 2.50 hectares of land. Her monthly profit amounts to 29,000 som (KGS). To continue developing her business, Burulbu requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to increase her livestock headcount, buy fertilizers and fuel for farming. Burulbu is one of the three members of the Ak-Peyil group. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into growing her business and buying a tractor.

loans.use: to buy livestock, fertilizers, and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Nyshanbubu

texts.ru: Нышанбубу, 52 года, замужем, дети взрослые и самостоятельные, живут отдельно. У нее среднее образование, она целеустремленна, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. В качестве дохода для своей семьи она на протяжении 30 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Нышанбубу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: лошадь, 3 коровы и 20 овец. На 1,80 Га земли выращивает кукурузу и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,900 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нышанбубу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади и 2 коров с телятами. Доходы от кредита Нышанбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и накопить на покупку автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Nyshanbubu is 52 years old and married. Her children are grown and independent, and live on their own. Nyshanbubu has a secondary-level education, and she is purposeful, knows exactly what she wants, and strives for it with her entire strength.

As a source of income for her family, Nyshanbubu has been raising animals and growing crops for the last 30 years. Thanks to Nyshanbubu's very hard work, her farm now has a horse, 3 cows and 20 sheep. She grows corn and clover on 1.80 hectares of land. Her monthly income is 17,900 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farm, Nyshanbubu has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to buy a horse and 2 cows with calves. Nyshanbubu plans to invest the income from her loan in continuing to increase her number of domestic livestock, and plans to save to buy an automobile for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a horse and two cows with calves to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Mayra Yaneth

texts.es:
Mayra, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera, se dedica a la venta de pupusas y vive en la casa con sus dos padres.

Mayra, se dedica a vender pupusas desde hace 4 años y lo aprendió gracias a su mamá y después de trabajar 6 meses en un restaurante, decidido colocar su propio negocio, el cual tiene en su casa y empieza a vender a las 5:00 a.m. hasta las 11:00 a.m. y su mamá le ayuda.

Mayra, necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima para preparar las pupusas, específicamente comprará aceite, harina, queso y chicharrón.

Los sueños son poder estudiar una carrera universitaria y poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mayra is 45 years old and has a high school degree. She is single, works selling pupusas, and lives at home with her two parents.

Mayra has been selling pupusas for four years. She learned this work from her mother and after working for six months in a restaurant, she decided to open her own business. She runs it from her home. She starts to sell pupusas at 5:00am and continues until 11:00am, and her mother helps her.

Mayra is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients to prepare pupusas, specifically she will purchase oil, flour, cheese, and chicharrones. Her dreams are to be able to attend university and be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare pupusas, specifically oil, flour, cheese, and chicharrones.

loans.name: María

texts.es: Maria es una muchacha que se esmera día con día para obtener una mejor calidad de vida, ella tiene 37 años de edad, soltera con grandes aspiraciones de vida. Maria cuenta que gracias al crédito logro una muy buena inversión pues con ello logro comprar sus materiales de bisutería, y logro modernizar sus productos, a Dios gracias este anagrama le dejo a ella una muy buena ganancia y con ello pudo realizar lagunas mejoras para su vivienda. Maria nuevamente solicita un préstamo para la inversión en su negocio de artesanía con el crédito ella comprara  (bisutería) mostacilla de jade, piedras  de diferentes colores para la elaboración de aretes, collares. Con esta inversión Maria espera seguir modernizado sus productos. Su esperanza de vida es comprar su propio terreno.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman that strives day by day to obtain a better quality of life. She is 37 years old and single with big aspirations for her life.

Maria says that thanks to the previous loan she made a good investment which she can use to buy jewellery-making materials and modernise her products. She is grateful to God for the logo that gave her a good income and which she can use for home improvements.

Maria is currently asking for a loan to invest in her craft business. With the loan she will buy (jewellery), jade beads and different coloured stones to make bracelets and necklaces.

With this investment, Maria hopes to keep modernising her products. Her hope for her life is to buy her own land.

loans.use: to buy beads to make earrings and necklaces.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a variety of drinks including soda, wine, beer and others as well as snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama MUJERES UNIDAS está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres integrado por 14 mujeres todos ellas vecinas y amigas hacen todo lo posible para salir adelante con sus familias.
Nelly es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a las ventas, tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de productos, y también hace artesanías que después vende. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que quiere salir adelante y es por ello que pone todo su esfuerzo para poder lograr sus metas.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su despensa con verduras, carne, frutas, enlatados, panificados y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group MUJERES UNIDAS is in its number 1 program cycle of the committee comprised of 15 women, all of them neighbors and friends who are doing everything in their power to improve their lives and the lives their families.

Nelly is one of the members of this group. She works in sales. She has a well-stocked pantry with all type of products. She also makes handcrafts which she also sells. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who wants to get ahead in life. That is why she makes an effort to be able to achieve her goals.

She is requesting this loan in order to stock her pantry with vegetables, meat, fruit, canned products, baked goods and other products, and to be able to continue with her sales as she's been doing up till now.

loans.use: buy vegetables, meat, fruit, canned products, baked goods, and other supplies for her small store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy Bermuda shorts, T-shirts, dresses, and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Meet 26-year-old Tabitha. She is an emerging entrepreneur and has successfully completed her training with Zoona to start running her own business as a Zoona Mobile money transfer agent in Blantyre, Malawi. This means that Tabitha will provide mobile money services to people who need to access financial services in her community. Tabitha lives with her aunt who took her in when her parents died. She has three brothers.

Tabitha completed her high school education in the year 2006 and went on to do a certificate course in marketing. She says she had a hard time finding a job because jobs are hard to find in Malawi, she then decided to start running her own business so that she can help to create more jobs. She is very excited at the prospect of running a business that provides people the ability to move their money when they need to most. 

This is Tabitha’s first loan, she will use the loan as a start-up capital to run her business. She will be able to purchase a small trading trolley and a web-enabled phone so that she can start serving customers. This loan also helps Tabitha with the funds needs for float to serve customers. Float is the money that Tabitha will use to pay customers receiving money as well as customers sending money. 

Tabitha’s dream is to grow her business by adding additional outlets as soon as she is earning good profits. In the first six months of her business, Zoona helps emerging entrepreneurs by providing them a weekly stipend for their daily costs and to support themselves. 

Tabitha will use the profits to assist her aunt provide for basic needs in their household. She thanks the kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a small trading trolley and a web-enabled phone and have the funds need to serve customers so that she can start running her own business as a Zoona Agent.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Sophal’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophal makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller by selling grocery and rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
Santos, de 38 años de edad, trabaja en el campo como agricultor y los fines de semana se dedica a vender pollo por libras, creció junto a sus padres quienes fueron personas muy humildes y trabajadoras, que le formaron y enseñaron a cultivar la tierra; su familia está formada por su esposa y un hijo que se encuentra estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.

Santos, tiene 25 años de experiencia en cultivar granos básicos, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres, porque toda la vida ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos y es la actividad que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su familia y tiene muchas proyecciones ya que también ha comenzado a trabajar con gallinas ponedoras para la comercialización de huevos.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar pollos y gallinas ponedoras, porque se le han agotado las existencias y tendrá que comprar más gallinas y pollos.

Los sueños de Santos, son tener una granja con mejores instalaciones y adquirir un nuevo crédito para comprar una incubadora.
texts.en:
Santos, 38, works in the countryside, in agriculture. On the weekends, he sells chicken meat by the pound. He grew up together with his parents, who were simple and hardworking people and taught him to work the land. His family is composed of his wife and a son that goes to the community school.

Santos has a 25-year experience in growing cereals. He learned this activity from his parents, because it has been their main source of income all their lives. This is the activity that helps him to bring food to his family's table every day. He has a lot of plans, now that he has started to work with laying hens to sell eggs.

He will use the money to buy chickens and laying hens, because he does not have any now and needs to buy more.

Santos dreams of having a better-equipped farm and applying for a new loan to buy an incubator.

loans.use: to buy chickens and laying hens.

loans.name: Monica Jacqueline

texts.es:
Al Noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha se encuentra el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos con un clima cálido húmedo en este Cantón vive la señora Mónica es divorciada y madre de dos hijos, estudiantes, son una familia muy unida que trata de salir adelante. 
La señora Mónica siempre ha querido salir adelante estuvo varios años fuera del país trabajando para buscar un futuro mejor, regresó a nuestro país e inició con el negocio de una sala de belleza aprendió de este  negocio por iniciativa propia y siguiendo cursos ella trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias ya que tiene gran demanda de clientes que la buscan por su amabilidad y buen conocimiento de este negocio.
En este negocio hay que tener mucho conocimiento y experiencia para dejar a los clientes satisfechos, su más grande sueño es tener un local más grande para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, este préstamo ayudara a la Sra. Mónica a mejorar sus ingresos económicos y ampliar su negocio ya que el mismo se invertirá en comprar de una vitrina, tintes y cremas para sus tratamientos de belleza, además  la señora Mónica agradece a Kiva por la oportunidad de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
North West of the Pichincha province, you can find the San Miguel de los Bancos canton, which has warm weather. This is where Mónica lives. She is divorced, and the mother of two children who go to school. They are very close as a family, and are trying to get ahead.

Mónica has always wanted to get ahead. She worked abroad for some years, looking for a better future. She came back to the country and opened a beauty salon. She learned this activity on her own, and took some courses. She works for eight hours every day, on average, since her services are highly demanded. Her customers like her because of her kindness and skills.

One must know a lot about this business and have a lot of experience in order to fulfill the customers' demands. Her biggest dream is to have a bigger salon in order to better fulfill her customers' needs.

This loan will help Mónica to improve her income and expand her business. She will use it to buy a showcase, dyes, and creams for the beauty treatments she offers. She is also grateful to Kiva for the opportunity to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy showcases, and products such as dyes and creams to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rosemarie dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose Antonio es un hombre de 48 años que vive junto a su esposa y su hijo en la localidad rural de Huanca, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él se dedica al cultivo de alfalfa orgánica y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar una vaca orgánica, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Antonio is a 48-year-old man. He lives with his wife and son in a rural village, in Huanca, Arequipa. He grows organic alfalfa, and raises cattle following organic farming standards, taking good care of what he gives them to eat, i.e., the organic alfalfa he grows.

He is requesting this micro loan to be able to buy a cow. He hopes that the milk can be sold at a better price, since it would be organic. In the future, he hopes to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cow and raise it following organic farming standards.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and has three children, ages 7 (twins) and 6 years old. Rhea and her husband are engaged in a fishing business to earn a living. They have been doing this since they started their married life, seven years ago. They work together to provide for the needs of their children and to give them better education.

Thus, Rhea is asking for a bigger loan amount to buy fishing net and fishing knots (this serve as the baseline of the fishing net). She will also buy bamboo for making “bobo” (a kind of fish trap). Rhea wishes in the future to have an additional fishing boat to help them enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing knots and bamboo.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally has been farming for many years and she earns a better income from this. With her previous loan used for buying piglets to raise, she was able to raise more and was financially prepared for the next cropping season.

She has repaid her previous loan successfully and is now taking a new loan to buy feed to boost her pigs. She is now happy to say that she is assured of a productive piggery in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her piglets.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 65 years old and married with six children. For the past fifteen years she has worked hard buying and selling scrap in the Philippines.

Phoebe has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of scrap to sell. In the future, Phoebe would like to expand her business with the money she saves.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of scrap to sell.

loans.name: Lilian Marleni

texts.es:
Lilian, de 39 años de edad, creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a las venta de ropa, ella se movilizaba por los diferentes caseríos de su cantón, para distribuir sus productos; su familia está formada por su esposo y sus dos hijas, que le apoyan en la venta de ropa. 

Lilian, tiene 10 años de experiencia en la venta de ropa, la cual aprendió de su madre, quien durante toda su vida llevo a cabo este negocio y de esta forma pudieron sacar adelante a toda su familia y pudieron satisfacer todas las necesidades de su hogar, ella por la necesidad de generar ganancias se dedicó a la venta de ropa y ha continuado trabajando de esa manera.

Ella, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa y calzado para vender, de esta forma ella podrá tener mejores ganancias y podrá continuar pagando la educación de sus hijos.

Los sueños de Lilian, son tener un local donde pueda establecer un bazar y zapatería.
texts.en:
Lilian, 39, grew up with her parents, who worked selling clothes. She used to visit different neighborhoods, selling her products. Her family is composed of her husband and two daughters; all of them support her activity.

Lilian has been selling clothes for ten years, an activity she learned from her mother, who had this business all her life. This is how the family was able to get ahead and fulfill all their needs. She needed to generate an income, so she started selling clothes, and has continued to work in that way.

She needs a loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell. In this way, she will make better profits and will be able to continue paying her children's education.

Lilian dreams of having a store where she can sell clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto de riesgo, se dedica  a la venta de frutas de manera ambulante por los diferentes mercados y colonias, tiene mucha clientela ya que es un producto muy vendible, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar mas frutas como: jocotes, sandia, piña, mango, etc. todo por mayor ya que le va muy bien en sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: The young woman with the pixelated face in the photo is 29 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She works selling fruit as a mobile vendor in various markets and neighborhoods. She has a lot of customers, since fruit sells very well. Thanks to her work, she has been able to get ahead. She lives in a house of her own with her family group. She is requesting a loan once again to buy more fruits, such as jocotes, watermelon, pineapple, mangos, etc., on a wholesale basis, because her sales are going well, and with this purchase she will be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy more fruits such as jocotes, watermelon, pineapple, mangos, etc., on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Dapacan Bajo, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a farmer who plants and harvests fruit to sell to earn a living. For many years it has been her main source of income. She also has a vegetable garden, which provides weekly earnings.

Her previous loan has been repaid successfully. To improve her production, she has taken a new loan to purchase fertilizers and organic pesticides to have a more productive farm. She wants to expand her farm and to renovate their house for a safe and comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and organic pesticides.

loans.name: Analene

texts.en:
Analene’s husband is a fisherman. With great effort she helps her husband in their financial stability by doing this business with him. They have been doing this for 11 years to provide for the needs of their family. They have two children, ages 11 and 10 years old. She dreams to uplift their livelihood to have a better means of living in the future. She also wants to have enough money to send her children to school to have a finished degree.

Analene is asking for a bigger loan amount to buy fishing net, fishing weights and fishing knots. She will also use the money to pay laborers.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing weights and fishing knots, and also to pay laborers.

loans.name: Sergio Jacobo

texts.es:
Sergio es un apasionado por los números es por esta razón que estudia contabilidad pública y finanzas a sus cuarenta y nueve años de edad ha logrado destacarse en su carrera y demostrarle a sus hijos que las metas se pueden cumplir si realmente se proponen. Es un padre ejemplar porque ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante debido a que su esposa falleció. 
Sergio está a punto de culminar su carrera y coronarse como profesional es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para pagar la cuota de su título y ser un licenciado en Contabilidad pública y finanzas y de esta manera obtener mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Sergio is passionate about numbers, and that is why he is studying public accounting and finance. At the age of forty-nine, he has been able to distinguish himself in his degree program and demonstrate to his children that goals can be achieved if one really sets out to fulfill them. He is an exemplary father, because he has successfully supported his children alone after his wife passed away.

Sergio is about to finish his degree and become certified as a professional. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to pay the fees to complete his university degree in Public Accounting and Finance. In this way he will have access to better opportunities.

loans.use: to pay the fees for his degree.

loans.name: Charkya's Group

texts.en: Charkya’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Charkya makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Kholishon

texts.ru:
Холисхон 49 летняя замужняя женщина. Она  уроженка района Рудаки. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации, по причине что он не нашел себе подходящую работу в стране. Он зарабатывает, и отправить домой деньги. Холисон решила сидя дома зарабатывать на жизнь. По причине, что не ждать отправки денег мужа.  Холисхон старается, чтобы кормить и одевать детей. Она хочет открыть свое ателье по шитье у себя дома. У нее имеется комната где она хочет заниматься шитьем. Эту комнату недавно построили. Она еще не законенная комната. Холисхон хочет завершить ремонт и скорее начать зарабатывать. Она хочет купить стройматериалы для ремонта, но у нее  
нет денежных средств. По этой причине Холисхон обратилась за кредитом. Холисхону очень нужна Ваша поддержка.
texts.en: Kholishon is a 49-year-old married woman. She is a native of the Rudaki district. Her husband works in the Russian Federation because he could not finds suitable work in his country. He earns money and sends it home. Kholishon decided to also earn a living from home, so that she would not have to wait for the money wires from her husband. Kholishon tries hard to feed and clothe her children. She wants to open her own sewing atelier at home. She has a recently built room that she wants to use for this business. The room is not quite finished. Kholishon wants to complete the remodeling and quickly start earning a living. She wants to buy construction materials for the remodeling, but does not have enough money. This is why Kholishon requested a loan. Kholishon really needs Your support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and open her own sewing atelier

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Rema, 36, and her husband have four children aged fifteen, fourteen, ten and eight years old. For the past fifteen years the couple has fished to earn a living in the Philippines. Fishing is their main source of income, and she and her husband use their money to provide for the needs of their family and give their children a good education.

Rema is asking for a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy fishing equipment such as a fishing net; a fishing knot, which serves as the baseline for the net; fishing weights or sinkers that are used in conjunction with a fishing lure or hook to increase the net’s descending rate; and a fishing rod.

Rema dreams of sending all of her children to college so they can earn degrees and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment such as a net, fishing knot, fishing weights and fishing rod.

loans.name: Vevecil

texts.en:
Vevecil is a woman from Bien Unido. She is 31 years old and married to a fisherman; she has learned this livelihood to earn an income. She helps her husband in their fishing business, and she also engages in farming seaweed.

She asking a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy straw, fishing nets, wooden stakes, floaters and fuel, which are necessary for their successful fishing and seaweed farming. Vevecil is determined to make her livelihood thrive so she can support the education of her three children, ages 7, 9 and 11 years.

loans.use: to buy straw, fishing nets, wooden stakes, floaters and fuel.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 59 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. For the past three years she has operated her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines, where she sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, school supplies and other miscellaneous items.

Enriqueta has applied for a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF in order to buy additional groceries to sell. She hopes to save enough money to expand her shop and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru: Токтокан, 52 года, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование - среднее. Уже много лет она занимается швейным делом, а также животноводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Токтокан достигла хороших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 11,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Токтокан имеется 6 коров, 5 овец, лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят. Доходы от кредита Токтокан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Toktokan is 52 years old, married and has five children. She has a secondary education and has been involved in sewing and also animal husbandry for many years. Thanks to her backbreaking labor and sizable work, Toktokan achieved good successes in developing her business and now earns a monthly profit in the amount of 11,000 som (KGS). Today, Toktokan's farm contains 6 cows, 5 sheep and a horse. To continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy calves. Toktokan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy some calves in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Santos Sebastian

texts.es:
Santos, de 32 años de edad, es muy trabajador y luchador, está acompañado, junto con su pareja trabaja todos los días para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos, los cuales están estudiando.

Santos, se dedica a cultivar la tierra desde que su padre le enseño, a la edad de 10 años lo lleva a la parcela y le enseño el trabajo y le aconsejo que con esto se ganara la vida honradamente y podrá mantener a su familia, esto motiva a trabajar duro y aprender muy bien el oficio y luego un tío que tenía un carro le enseñó a manejar.

El dinero será invertido para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, herbicidas, fungicidas entre otros para obtener una mejor cosecha.

Santos, sueña con comprar su propio vehículo para trabajar y con ello tener otra fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 32 years old, a hard worker, and a fighter. He is in a relationship. He works with his life partner every day to improve their and their children's standard of living. Their children are currently in school.

Santos has been earning a living working in the fields since his father taught him the trade. When Santos was 10 years old, his father used to take him to the fields and teach him how to work. His father told him that by following this occupation, he could earn an honest living and be able to provide for his family. His father’s advice motivated him to work hard and learn everything about this trade. Later on, an uncle who had a car taught Santos how to drive.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, fungicides, and the like to obtain a better harvest.

Santos dreams of buying his own vehicle and use it to have another source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, fungicides, and the like to obtain a better harvest.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: Don Jose de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de camarones desde hace 15 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas maricos (camarones) por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas ya que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose, who is fifty-five years old, lives in his own house with his family. His livelihood has been in the sale of shrimp since he was fifteen years old. His business is in his place of residence. He has many clients. With the earnings he gets he has paid off some household expenses.

He is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of shrimp to continue with his sales as they generate good earnings.

loans.use: To purchase shrimp wholesale

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 58-year-old woman, who lives a simple life with her family in the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and a mother of three adult children. Rosie and her husband earn a living by doing a fishing business. They have been doing this for eight years.

Through her loan that will enhance their livelihood, she wishes to have a better means of living in the future. Rosie is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, fishing weights, and fishing floaters and knots. She will also use the money to pay laborers.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing weights, fishing floaters and knots, and also to pay laborers.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 30 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them. Geraldine has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Geraldine has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles and other groceries. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Denise Lina

texts.es:
