Denise es una mujer de 32 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de café y refrescos.
Ella es independiente, constante y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max paredes’ caracterizada por la producción manufacturera en todas las áreas. 
Denise es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al mismo negocio y con su hijo que está comenzando la escuela. Viven en un cuarto en alquiler construido de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la vena de cafés y refrescos, ella reparte café con leche, té y refrescos a los vendedores en su puesto de venta, “realizo mi ruta 2 veces al día, por la mañana desayuno y por la tarde hora del té…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una ruta y clientes fijos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar un horno para incursionar en la venta de pollo al horno. Su sueño es establecer su futuro negocio, ella desea comprar un horno y cocina industrial para ampliar su negocio y vender pollo frito y al horno. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Denise solicita un préstamo para comprar un horno y cocina industrial para vender pollo frito.
texts.en:
Denise is a 32-year-old woman, is married, has a five-year-old son, and her business is the sale of coffee and soft drinks. She is independent, constant and very hard working. Her business is in the 'Max Paredes' area characterized by all kinds of manufacturing production. Denise has a brown complexion, long black hair, and a thin build. Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband, who works in the same business, and with her son, who is starting school. They live in a rented brick room that has all the basic services. 

Denise's business is the sale of coffee and soft drinks; she offers coffee with milk, tea, and soft drinks to salespeople at their posts. “I do my route twice a day, during the morning for breakfast, and in the afternoon at tea time,” she says. The advantage of her business is that she has a route and fixed customers. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy an oven to venture into selling baked chicken. Her dream is to establish her future business; she wants to buy an oven and an industrial stove to expand her business and sell fried and baked chicken. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the four years that she has had this business. This is why Denise is asking for a loan, to buy an oven and an industrial stove to sell fried chicken.

loans.use: to buy an oven and an industrial stove to sell fried chicken.

loans.name: Audecita

texts.es: Doña Audecita de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica desde hace mas de 10 años a la venta de conchas, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas conchas por mayor ya que esa es su unica fuente de tabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Ms. Audecita is forty-seven years old. She lives in her own house with her husband. For more than ten years, her livelihood has come from the sale of shells. Her business is in her home. She has many clients for her sales that help her move forward. She is requesting this loan to buy more shells wholesale as that is her only source of work. That way, she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase shells wholesale

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 37-year-old, resident of Kamaggwa in Rakai district. He is married with three children who all go to school. Stephen deals in growing passion fruit, which he started in 2005; he also he grows coffee. He works 7 days of the week and 12 hours per day and started this business with the aim of supplementing his daily income and to be able to look after his family.

Stephen wants a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy manure. His customers are people from different areas in town and passion fruit traders. However, his challenges are inadequate capital to expand the business and competition. Stephen is a hardworking and focused man.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Ma. Lodena

texts.en:
Ma. Lodena is a 37-year-old woman, who does hog raising to earn a living. In addition to that, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household goods like energy drinks, sugar, toothpaste, eggs, shampoo, edible oil, soft drinks and assorted canned goods. She is married with a two-year old son, who is her greatest joy. It has been two years now that she has catered mostly local customers in her place.

She would like to expand her livelihood by acquiring funds to finance her sources of income. That is why she decided to purchase stock for the store and piglets. This will fill her store with a variety of merchandise and increase the number of pigs she is going to raise. Ma. Lodena hopes that she will become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to purchase stock for the store and piglets.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo es un padre de familia de 58 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de siete hijos de las edades entre 11 y 35 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Santa Cruz La Laguna.
Domingo como todas las personas de su comunidad obtiene sus ingresos labrando los solidados campos de su comunidad, el desde 30 años se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio, afortunadamente ha tenido la dicha de lograr que su familia tenga todo lo necesario con sus dos actividades. Domingo durante este tiempo se ha visto con la necesidad de brindarle mantenimiento a su cultivo de café pero su gran dificultad ha sido  no contar con los recursos necesario, a raíz de esta necesidad  él solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra, este préstamo contribuirá para obtener al final del año una buena cosecha de café. Su esperanza de vida es fortalecer su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Domingo is a 58 year old family father.  He is married with a beautiful family of seven children ranging in age from 11 to 35 years old.  This is a humble family who lives in a community of Santa Cruz La Laguna. 

Domingo, like all the people in his community, gets his income working the consolidated fields of his community.  For 30 years, he has worked in agriculture and commerce.  Fortunately, he has had the pleasure of getting everything that his family needs with his two jobs.

Domingo, during this time, has seen the need to provide maintenance to his coffee crop, but his big difficulty has been not having the necessary resources.  From the root of his need, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and manual labor.  This loan will contribute to a good coffee crop at the end of the year.  His hope in life is to strengthen his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manual labor to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Marady

texts.en:
Marady is 28 years old and single. He is an ATM transfer at a bank, who lives in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. He is a student from the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. He has worked in the province since 2015, earning approximately $10 per day.

He is taking a Management major at a university. Marady is in his fourth year at the university, and since he is lacking finances to pay his first-semester tuition fees for his fourth year, he requested a loan, which will help him finish this semester successfully.

After graduation, he wants to find another better job with a reasonable salary; build a new proper house; and, if he gets children, he wants them to study and to pursue a Bachelor's or Master's if he can support that goal.

loans.use: to pay his first-semester tuition fees for his fourth year.

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en:
Jonaliza lives a simple life with her family in a town of Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and a mother of eight children. Her oldest child is 20 years old, while her youngest child is a one-year-old. Her husband works hard as a carpenter, while Jonaliza is doing the hog raising business to help him financially. They work together to provide for the needs of their big family.

Definitely, Jonaliza is asking a loan to sustain the feed for her pigs. In the future, she wishes for her business to improve, to enhance their earnings and so they can start other business opportunities that will uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a 65-year-old woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She a widow and has seven children that are already grown up. She earns a living by raising livestock. She raised water buffalo that helped them in their farming business.

Currently, Luciana is thinking of other business opportunities that will help her to sustain her day-to- day living. She is starting to raise pigs.

Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy piglets.

In the future, Luciana aims for business improvement to increase her means of living

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Rosa Narcisa

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Que Progresan.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 56 años de edad, está separada, pero  de esa relación tuvo cinco hijos  mayores de edad e independientes.
Doña Rosa es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar muy duro para salir adelante, antes para sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora para ser independiente y no depender de nadie tiene un bar frente a una institución del Estado en la ciudad de Manta, allí ella vende todo tipo de comidas rápidas como  hamburguesas, sanduches, tostadas, papas fritas, batidos de frutas, jugos entre otros, trabaja de 17h00 a 24h00, ya son más de 5 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar pan, frutas, carnes, papas, aceite y muchas otras cosas necesarias en su negocio. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener un local más grande.
texts.en:
In the parish of Eloy Alfaro in the city of Manta - know for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national tourists and foreigners and known for being one of the most important ports of the country and of the Americas and situated on the shores of the Pacific - every fifteen days the Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Que Progresan (Credit Group of Women who progress) meets.

In this place lives la señora Rosa.  She is 56 years old.  She is separated, but from that relationship had five children who are older in age and independent.  Doña Rosa is a woman who has had to work very hard to get ahead: before, to get her children ahead, and now, to be independent and not depend on anyone to have a bar in front of the Institution of the State in the City of Manta.  There she sells all kinds of fast foods like hamburgers, sandwiches, tostadas, french fries, fruit shakes, and juices, among other things.  She works from 5:00pm to midnight.  She has worked this job for more than five years, which has gotten her ahead.

This loan is to buy bread, fruits, meats, potatoes, oil, and many other things necessary in her business.  She has had four cycles in the Grupo De Crédito, and she likes it because the loan help a lot.  Her dreams are to have a bigger location.

loans.use: To buy bread, fruits, meats, potatoes, oil, etc.

loans.name: Katherin

texts.en: Katherin has been running her business for many years.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 32 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

Angelita has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Eulogia Victoria

texts.es: Eulogia es una mujer trabajadora de 60 años que tiene cinco hijos y vive junto a su esposo en la localidad rural de Lluta, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Ella se dedica al cultivo de alfalfa orgánica y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Además de ello, Eulogia tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende abarrotes para generarse ingresos extra. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar dos vacas orgánicas, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, pero sobre todo desea contar con buena salud para ver crecer a sus nietos, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Eulogia is a hardworking 60-year-old woman who has five children and lives with her husband in the rural area of Lluta, which is located in Arequipa. She makes a living by growing organic alfalfa and raising organic cattle, always paying a lot of attention to the care and the food she provides them with, which consists of the organic alfalfa that she grows. In addition, Eulogia has a small store where she sells groceries to earn extra money. 

She is asking for the microloan to buy two organic cows; she hopes that their milk will be sold at a better price because it is organic. In the future she hopes to be able to improve her family's living conditions, but above all she hopes to have good health to see her grandchildren grow up. She is wagering on the organic for this reason.

loans.use: to buy two organic cows

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 42 años de edad, vive al lado de sus hijos. Un hijo de 10 años y una hija de 16 años de edad. Ella es madre soltera y por lo cual es la única persona que aporta para la economía del hogar. Reina es una persona trabajadora, quien se dedica a la venta de mariscos, fruta y bebidas tales como el ponche, actividad que la realiza de forma ambulante en su comunidad y en las comunidades cercanas. Esto le permite solventar sus problemas económicos y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, tiene 2 años de administrar este negocio de ventas.  Las cuales vende de forma rotativa para variar y no ofrecer siempre los tres productos al mismo tiempo, esta técnica la implementa para no disminuir las ventas. Reina desea incrementar las ventas, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: papaya, mango, melón, sandía, camarones, langostas, cangrejos para incrementar sus ventas. De esta manera incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Reina is 42 years old.  She lives with her children: a son who is 10 and a daughter who is 16 years old.  She is a single mother; and, therefore, the only person who supports the economy of the house.  Reina is a hardworking person who makes a living selling seafood, fruits, and drinks such as ponche, a job that she does on the streets of her community and in the surrounding communities.

This allows her to solve her economic problems and cover the basic needs of her family.  She has worked for two years in this sales business.  She does her sales in a rotating form to vary and not always offer the three products at the same time.  She implemented this technique to not loose sales.

Reina wants to increase the sale; and for that, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in papaya, mango, melon, watermelon, shrimp, lobster, and crab to increase her sales.  In this way she will increase her income.

loans.use: To invest in papaya, mango, melon, watermelon, shrimp, lobster, and crabs to increase her sales.

loans.name: Carina Guadalupe

texts.es: Carina de 34 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y de sus hijos de 13 y 14 años de edad. Ella en busca de mantener la economía del hogar presta sus servicios domésticos en un centro educativo que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad, labor que viene realizando desde hace 9 años y la cual le permite cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Además en sus días de descanso se dedica a vender platillos típicos en su comunidad, actividad que realiza para maximizar sus ingresos económicos. Así también su compañero de vida le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. El sueño de Carina es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: papas, yuca, queso, repollo, lechuga  y demás productos necesarios para su negocio de venta de platillos típicos, el cual administra los fines de semana y de esta forma ofrecerle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Thirty-four year old Carina lives with her lifelong partner and her two children who are thirteen and fourteen years old. To support the household finances, she provides domestic services in an educational center near her community. She has been doing this work for the past nine years. It allows her to cover the basic family necessities. In addition, on her days off, she devotes herself to selling local cuisine in her community. She carries out that activity to maximize her earnings. Her partner also helps with the household expenses. 

Carina's dream is to be able to improve the quality of life of her family. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: potatoes, cassava cheese, cabbage, lettuce and other products needed for her business of selling local dishes. She conducts the business on the weekends to offer a better life to  her children.

loans.use: To invest in: potatoes, cassava, cheese, cabbage, lettuce and other products needed for the business of selling typical local dishes

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year old Alice sold clothing like pants, shirts, blouses, jeans and polos. In addition to that, she also sold herbal medicines to the local dwellers in her place.

She is a married woman with seven children. Three of them are still attending school. Her husband has an income that could help defray the family's daily expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy stocks of rtw (ready-to-wear) and to pay for a business permit. In this way, she could able to continue operate her livelihood and also provide variety of stock and cater to more customers.

Slowly, she could able to pay her obligations and handle her finances wisely.

In the future, Alice dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rtw (ready-to-wear) and to pay for a business permit.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is 33 years old, married, and provides for three children. She owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting vegetables to earn a living. For more than five years, she was able to provide for the family.

She joined to gain access from GDMPC. To improve the farm, she took a loan to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings. Genevieve aims to expand her farm to have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has an internet café business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Florida is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy new computer supplies for her internet café business.

Florida has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new computer supplies for her internet café business.

loans.name: Merlin

texts.en:
Merlin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and bamboo for her fishing business.

Merlin has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Merlin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and bamboo for her fishing business

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a 25-year-old married woman living in Tulkarem, Palestine. She has three small children with no one attending school yet.

Suha started the smoke wrapping idea three years ago. The process is done by buying the goods from a supplier and then after finishing the cigarette wrapping, she returns them to the supplier for some returns. She says that lately the main challenges she faces are the low returns and the current competition in the same market.

Suha requested this loan to buy some goods and a smoke machine chop. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business capital and invest in her business by being able to cultivate the raw materials (the smoke) and being able to package it in the final stages, and that will contribute to improving her family's standards of living.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy some goods and a smoke machine chop

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María, es una mujer de cincuenta y tres años de edad, de semblante fuerte y de carácter trabajador. La vida ha hecho de ella una mujer emprendedora para salir adelante con su principal apoyo, que es su hija. Tiene un negocio de pulpería. Poco a poco ha logrado introducir a su negocio una línea de bebidas variadas, los cuales tienen alto consumo, esto fortaleció notablemente su negocio y por eso está muy agradecida.
para seguir abasteciendo su negocio ha tocado las puertas para que se le otorgue un préstamo que le permita comprar aceite, arroz, frijoles, comidas enlatadas, refresco, entre otros. En un futuro planea hacer de su negocio, una distribuirá autorizada de refrescos enlatados y embotellados plásticos.
texts.en:
María, is 53 years old. She has a strong countenance and is a hard worker. Life has made her into an entrepreneur in order to get ahead with her number one priority, her daughter.

She runs a grocery business. Little by little, she has been able to introduce a line of beverages that are in high demand, which notably strengthened her business and for that she is very grateful.

In order to continue stocking up her business, she has knocked on the door to request a loan to buy oil, rice, beans, tinned goods and refreshments, among others.

In the future, she plans to make her business into an authorized distributor of refreshments, canned goods and plastic bottled goods.

loans.use: buy oil, rice, beans, tinned goods and refreshments among others.

loans.name: Arsih

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM Syariah’s clients, Arsih, who is a 36-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter. Arsih is a merchant and her husband is an employee. She has a small shop which sells food like snacks.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at her home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Arsih will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at her home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for her family.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en: Sokun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is a 40 year old resident of Kasambya in Rakai district. He is married with 4 children who all go to school. He carries out a business of retail trade which he started in 2009 with the aim of improving his daily income. He works 7 days a week and 12 hours per day. His clients are residents and people from the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy a piece of land on which he will build his family house. Gerald’s aim is to have a piece of land to have a shop on his land. However his challenges are lack of enough money to buy a larger plot of land and seasonal changes for his business.

He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man, encouraging lenders to always offer him a facility if he needs it.

loans.use: to pay for a piece of land

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Catherine works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen food sales. Catherine is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Catherine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from selling fish.

Lucy dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing net, gasoline and other equipment for her fishing business. She has been in this business for 10 years. Amelia also earns more income from selling fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Amelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net, gasoline and other equipment.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Gina works hard to support her family. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing and her tricycle passengers.

Gina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Luisa Emilia

texts.es:
Luisa, es una señora que a sus cincuenta y ocho años de edad, no se cansa de trabajar duro todos los días. Ella es un ejemplo de superación y perseverancia. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, su principal apoyo es su hija. Ella está muy agradecida con Kiva junto a MiCrédito porque estas organizaciones le abrieron las puertas mediante un financiamiento para que ella creciera como comerciante. 
Confía ciegamente en las oportunidades que MiCrédito y Kiva brindan, por eso ha vuelto a recurrir a un préstamo que planea invertir en la compra de aceite, arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar entre otros insumos que utiliza día a día. En un futuro planea mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, para así abrir un pequeño comedor que se especialice en servir desayunos, almuerzos y cenas buffet.
texts.en:
Luisa is a 58-year-old woman, who does not tire of working hard every day. She is an example of excellence and perseverance. She has a food sales business. Her principal supporter is her daughter.

She is very grateful for Kiva together with MiCrédito because these organizations opened doors for financing her growth as a merchant. She relies heavily in the opportunities that MiCrédito and Kiva provide. So, she has returned to appeal for a loan that she plans to invest in the purchase of oil, rice, beans, corn, and sugar, among other supplies, for day to day use.

In the future, she plans to improve the infrastructure of her home, in order to open a small eatery that specializes in serving breakfast, lunch, and dinner buffets.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, beans, corn, and sugar, among other supplies.

loans.name: Karen Yessenia

texts.es: Karen de 19 años de edad que habita en vivienda familiar junto a su madre y hermana. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos de forma ambulante y con la que adquirido un gran número de clientes, de esa manera genera sus ingresos económicos con los que proporciona los insumos necesarios para su familia. Karen desea construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda para brindarles mayor seguridad a su familia, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, mano de obra, para la construcción del muro de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Karen, 19 years old, lives in a family home together with her mother and sister. She is a hardworking woman who works as a street vendor selling dairy products. She has acquired a great number of customers, and in this way, she generates the economic income with which she provides the necessary supplies for her family. 

Karen wants to build a perimeter wall around her home to provide better safety for her family. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in the purchase of: bricks, cement, sand, iron, and labor for the construction of the wall at her home.

loans.use: to invest in: bricks, cement, sand, iron, and labor for the construction of the wall at her home.

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Que Progresan.
En este lugar vive la señora Maria, tiene  35  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 16, 12 y 9 años de edad, todos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es ebanista.
Doña María es una mujer muy trabajadora que realiza lo necesario para contribuir con los gastos que generan el hogar y la crianza de sus pequeños, para esto ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y  productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), ella también realiza recargas telefónicas en su casa con lo cual se gana algo extra, su mercadería vende  puerta a puerta o en su casa al mismo tiempo que realiza sus recargas, lleva más de 10 años en este negocio con el cual se gana sus recursos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa, perfumes, bisutería, cosméticos, cremas y  recargas telefonicas.  Es fundadora en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the parish of Eloy Alfaro in the city of Manta - know for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round by national tourists and foreigners and known for being one of the most important ports of the country and of the Americas and situated on the shores of the Pacific - every fifteen days the Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Que Progresan (Credit Group of Women who progress) meets.

In this place lives la señora María.  She is 35 years old.  She is married and from this relationship has three children, 16, 12, and 9 years old.  They all go to school.  Her husband is a cabinet maker.

Doña María is a very hardworking person who does what it takes to contribute to the costs that the home generates and to raise her young ones.  Therefore, she works selling clothing of all types and Avon products (beauty articles, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women).  She also does phone recharges in her homes which earns her extra.  She sells door to door or in her home while she recharges phones.  She has worked this business for more than ten years with which she has earned her income.

She is going to use this loan to buy clothing, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and cellphone chargers.  She is a member of the Grupo de Crédito, and she likes it for the help that she gets from the loans.  Her dreams are to give her family the best.

loans.use: To buy clothing, perfumes, costume jewelry, cosmetics, creams, and cellphone chargers.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a hardworking, woman entrepreneur with three children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She supplements this income with earnings from selling fish and a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Alona dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 63 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, etc.

Sally has not borrowed loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Sally aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Las Samayaqueras Group

texts.es:
Orfa es una mujer de 23 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia  de dos hijas de las edades entre 1 y 5 años, esta querida familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Orfa (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica desde hace tres años a la compra y venta de  pollos, este negocio lo realiza ella como ambulante en su mercado regional. Pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica también a la compra y venta de abarrotes.
Orfa para poder satisfacer mejor a sus clientes ha considerado necesario solicitar un préstamo para la compra de pollos para su respectiva venta. Con esta inversión Orfa espera llamar la atención de más clientes. Su esperanza de vida es contar algún día con su depósito de pollo
texts.en:
Orfa is a 23 year old woman.  She is single with a beautiful family of two children who are 1 and 5 years old.  This dear family lives in a community of Suchitepéquez.  

Orfa (the first one on the right side of the photograph), in order to get an income and get her family ahead, has worked fro three years buying and selling chickens.  She does this job in the streets of the regional market.  But in order to improve her income, she also works buying and selling groceries.

Orfa, in order be able to better satisfy her customers, has found it necessary to request a loan to buy chickens for her respective sales.  With this investment, Orfa hopes to get more customers.  Her hopes in life are to one day have many chickens.

loans.use: To buy and sell chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy photographic paper, ink, and frames among other items.

loans.name: Celva

texts.en:
Celva and her husband are engaged in a farming business to earn a living, and it is their main source of income. They have been doing this for three years. Aside from farming, Celva also raises pigs. They work hard together to raise their two children, ages 5 and 2 years old.

She is asking for loan to buy fertilizer to enhance the growth of their farm and to buy piglets and feed as well. In the future, she wants the business to improve to increase their earnings, so they can have enough money to send their children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and also piglets and feed.

loans.name: Mireya Irene

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Que Progresan.
En este lugar vive la señora Mireya, tiene  44 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 20  y 18 años de edad, ambos estudian en universidad y aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es maestro.
Doña Mireya es una mujer muy trabajadora que realiza lo necesario para ganar algo por su cuenta y así contribuir con los gastos que generan el hogar y los estudios  de sus hijos, para esto ella se dedica a la venta de productos Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas),  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella visita a sus clientes ya sea para cobrar lo que antes ha dejado o vender nuevamente, también vende en su casa, ella siempre aprovecha los créditos para comprar productos de oferta los mismos que luego vende al precio normal y esto le deja más ganancias que los invierte en gastos de los estudios de sus hijos lo cual es lo más importante para ella. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, cosméticos, cremas y bisuterías.  Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución. Sus sueños es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: In the Parrish of Eloy Alfaro of the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are well visited at all times in the year by national and international tourists and for being one of the most important ports of the country and of America, located on the shores of the Pacific Ocean, the L Group Mujeres Que Progresan (Women who progress) meet up every two weeks. Forty-four year old Mireya lives in this place. She is married and has two children, 20 and 18 years old. Both are going to college and still live at home. Her husband is a teacher. Mireya is a very hardworking woman who does all she can to earn something of her own, and in this way to help with household expenses and her children's education. For this, she works selling Belcorp products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). Her way of work is door to door. She visits her customers, either to collect the money of what she has left or to sell again. She also sells in her house. She always takes advantage of the loans to buy products on sale which she later sells at normal price, and this lets her have more earnings which she invests in her children's education expenses, which is what matters most to her. She will use this loan to buy perfumes, cosmetics, creams and custom jewelry. She has been since the beginning in the Credit Group, and she likes it because of the benefits received from the institution. Her dream is that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics, creams and custom jewelry.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de   33 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 6 y 14 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Manuel es agricultor que ama y cuida la naturaleza, el desde 15 años lleva labrando la tierra, con la visión de superación hoy busca un préstamo para la inversión en su negocio de compra y venta de jocotes, pues la época ya se está acercando y necesita aprovechar esta demanda que existe por esta fruta.  Este crédito lo ayudara a él para mejorar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia en mejores  condiciones.
texts.en:
Manuel is a thirty-three year old man who is married and has a beautiful family with four children between six and fourteen years old. The humble family lives in the community of Solola. Manuel is a farmer who loves and cares for nature. Since he was fifteen years old, he has been laboring on the land. 

With the vision of improving his situation, he requests a loan to invest in his business of buying and selling plums. Since the season is already approaching,  he needs to take advantage of the existing demand for the fruit. This loan will help him to improve his earnings and maintain his family in better conditions.

loans.use: Buying and selling plums.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 24 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Glenda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles, sugar and other groceries. In the future, Glenda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jarington Javier

texts.es:
Jarington, es un hombre muy trabajador de treinta años de edad, quien comenzó su negocio vendiendo ropa y sandalias de forma ambulante en el transporte público. Luego junto con el apoyo de su esposa pudo tener su propio puesto en una zona periférica de su ciudad, poco a poco logro surtirse de nuevos productos, lo que le llevo a crecer como comerciante. 
El confía mucho en Kiva junto a MiCrédito, que quiere ser beneficiado con un préstamo que le dé la oportunidad de comprar mercadería como ropa interior, camisolas, calcetines y otros. Ahora más que nunca necesita solidificar su negocio, dado que su familia espera un nuevo integrante.
texts.en: Jarington is a very hardworking 30 year old man who started his business selling clothes and sandals as a street vendor in public transportation. Later, with his wife's support, he was able to have his own stall in an area around the city. Little by little he was able to stock up with new products and grow as a merchant. He trusts Kiva and MiCredito and wants to get the benefits of a loan so he has the opportunity to buy merchandise such as underwear, pajamas, socks and other things. Now more than ever, he needs to strengthen his business because his family is expecting a new member.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as underwear, pajamas, socks and other things.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es: Ana de 34 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y de sus 5 hijos. Un hijo de 19 años y sus hijas de 6, 7, 13 y 16 años de edad. Ella vive en un humilde hogar, en el cual ha habitado desde hace 8 años. Ana en busca de una manera para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de mariscos en su comunidad y en las comunidades cercanas. De esta forma ella logra obtener los ingresos necesarios para la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. Así también su esposo ayuda con la economía del hogar. Ana tiene 3 años de administrar su negocio de ventas de mariscos, y es por lo que la cantidad de clientes ha aumentado y con ello la demanda. Por eso solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camarones, langostas, cangrejos y todo tipo de mariscos con los que comercializa en su negocio, aumentando así sus ventas para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana who is thirty-four years old, lives with her life partner and their five children. They include one nineteen-year old son and their daughters who are six, seven, thirteen and sixteen years old. She lives in a modest home where she has resided for the past eight years. 

Ana, searching for a way to help her family progress, devotes herself to the sale of shellfish in her community and the nearby communities. In this manner, she succeeds in having the necessary income for the education and feeding of their children. Her husband also helps with the household finances.

For three years, Ana has been running her business of selling seafood; the number of clients has increased along with the demand. For this reason, she requests a loan from Fusai to invest in: shrimp, lobster, crab and all type of seafood that she sells in her business, to increase her sales and her earnings.

loans.use: To invest in: shrimp, lobster, crab and all types of seafood

loans.name: A.p.p. V.e.s Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 5 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “A.P.P VES” una de ellas es la Srta. Esther de 22 años soltera, se dedica a la venta de chocolates todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante. Con su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a su familia. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es tener un local donde pueda vender más de sus productos, Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más mercadería (chocolatería)  y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez  la Srta. Esther se encuentra sentada a la mano derecha y se le distingue con una chompa crema. Se despide con un abrazo a Kiva y Edaprospo. Agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
This group has five members who are responsible for different commercial activities. These are the members of the communal group "A.P.P. VES". 

One of these members is Esther, a single woman aged 22 years. She works selling chocolate every day, which lets her make a living. These efforts have allowed her to improve her home and support her family. To keep improving her business, her greatest wish is to have a shop where she can sell more of her products. She will use the loan offered to invest in purchase of more merchandise (chocolate) so that she can increase her income. 

Esther is sitting on the right-hand side of the photo and is wearing a cream-coloured top. She says goodbye to Kiva and Edaprospo with a hug. She is grateful for the loan she has been given, as it is making it possible for her to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase food products.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 62 years old and a mother of one child. She owns and manages a vegetable garden in their backyard, planting and harvesting vegetables for sale and for family consumption. In order to buy seedlings and fertilizer, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC where she recently became a member.

She hopes to have an abundant harvest in order to generate additional income for the purpose improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a single woman. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent. For the past two years, she has owned a food stall business for neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 25,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding the business to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Noemie Jane

texts.en:
Noemie has been making woven nipa panels, which are used as roofing material. For many years, she has been able to sustain their daily household expenses. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for buying raw materials.

To fulfill orders from her customers, she took a new loan to buy the materials needed to make more nipa panels. She will also buy products woven by other people. She will sell the products in bulk, in town. She hopes to improve and expand her business with the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy materials need for making nipa roof panels

location.town: SAPANG AMA, SAPANG DALAGA, MISAMIS OCCIDENTAL

loans.name: Janeth Dioselina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Que Progresan.
En este lugar vive la señora Janeth, tiene  41  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 18, 14 y 12 años de edad, los dos menores estudian en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica local.
Doña Janeth es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y así ganar sus propios ingresos para salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, zapatos y productos Avon (perfumes, cremas, bisutería, etc.), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa, deja sus productos a  crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva más de 2 años dedicada a esta actividad  la cual le deja muy buenos ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y bisuterías. Lleva más de 5 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido. Sus sueños es seguir adelante esperando un mejor porvenir para sus hijos.
texts.en: In the Parrish of Eloy Alfaro of the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches which are well visited at all times in the year by national and international tourists and for being one of the most important ports of the country and of America, located on the shores of the Pacific Ocean, the Credit Group Mujeres Que Progresan (Women who progress) meet up every two weeks. Forty-one year old Janeth lives in this place. She is married and has three children, ages 18, 14 and 12. The two young ones attend school. Her husband works at a local factory. Janeth is a woman who likes to work and in this way to earn her own income to move ahead. She works in commerce. She sells clothes, shoes and Avon products (perfumes, creams, custom jewelry, etc.). Her way of sale is door to door, and she also sells in her house. She leaves her products on a loan basis and gets paid every week. She has been working in this activity for more than 2 years and it gives her good earnings. This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, creams and custom jewelry. She has been for more than 5 years in this Credit Group, and she likes it because the group is very close. Her dream is to keep on moving forward and hopes for a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, perfumes, creams and custom jewelry.

loans.name: Gancys Elodio

texts.es:
Gancys, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, no pudo seguir estudiando porque su familia era de bajos recursos económicos y no podían cubrir los gastos de su estudio, se dedicó a trabajar junto a su padre, luego se acompañó, pero su pareja lo abandono, pero eso no fue obstáculo para seguir adelante con sus sueños.

Gancys, desde muy pequeño le ha gustado trabajar para ganarse su propio dinero, su padre le enseño a trabajar la tierra, pero además de eso le gusta el comercio, actualmente se dedica al comercio de papaya, la cual con su trabajo ha cultivado 7,000 metros cuadrados en la comunidad y además tiene una pequeña tienda, la cual descuido un poco por que recién ha construido su casa y dejo de vender mientras la construía. 

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para comprar productos para surtir su tienda y poder cubrir la demanda que tiene de productos.

Gancys, sueña con ampliar más su negocio y tener una tienda bien surtida y cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados más de papayas, porque es un negocio muy rentable.
texts.en:
Gancys is 30-years-old. He studied until 4th grade, but could not continue studying because his family was low income and they could not cover the expenses of his studies. He made a living working together with his father, then he married, but his partner left him, but that did not stop him from continuing to move forward with his dreams.

Since Gancys was very little, he has enjoyed working to earn his own money. His father taught him to work the land, but besides that, he liked sales. Currently, he makes a living as a papaya seller, which through his work, he has cultivated 7,000 square meters in the community and also he has a small shop. He neglected it a little, because he has just recently constructed his house and he stopped selling during the construction.

The loan funds will be destined for purchasing products in order to supply his shop and to be able to meet the demand for products.

Gancys dreams of expanding his business more and having a well-stocked shop and cultivating 14,000 square meters more of papayas, because it is a very profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase products for supplying his store and to be able to meet demand.

loans.name: Hipolito Hermes

texts.es: Hipolito es un hombre trabajador de 53 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos en la localidad rural de Huanca, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él se dedica a trabajos múltiples como peonaje agrícola, cultivo de alfalfa orgánica y cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar dos vacas orgánicas, espera poder vender su leche a un mejor precio por ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y brindarles estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Hipolito is a hardworking 53-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in the rural area of Huanca, which is located in Arequipa. He does several kinds of work such as agricultural labor, growing organic alfalfa, and raising organic cattle. He devotes a lot of attention to the care of the cattle and to feeding them the organic alfalfa that he grows.

He is requesting this microloan to be able to buy two organic cows. He hopes to be able to sell their milk at a higher price because it will be organic. In the future, he hopes to be able to improve his family's quality of life and give them financial stability.

loans.use: to buy two organic cows.

loans.name: Futuras Empresarias Group

texts.es: Gladys de 47 años es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos menores. Al ver que el dinero no alcanzaba para hacer frente a los gastos de su hogar decidió poner una pequeña tiendita en un espacio de su casa. Su deseo mas grande es tener una tienda mas grande y bien surtida de productos.El crédito lo invirtió en la compra de mercadería de abarrotes al por mayor. Pertenecer al banquito "Futuras Empresaria" le ha ayudado a tener una mejor calidad de vida. Se siente muy agradecida con las personas de Kiva por ayudar a cumplir sus metas.El joven Jesus no esta en la fotografía ya que no asistió el día de la reunión porque tenia clases en su universidad. Gladys es la segunda que esta a la mano izquierda con una chompa de color negro y esta agarrado un cuaderno azul.
texts.en:
Gladys is 47 years old, lives with her partner and has 4 young children. Seeing that there was not enough money to face the household expenses, she decided to place a small store in a space in her house.

Her biggest wish is to have a store that is bigger and well stocked with products. She invested the loan in the purchase of wholesale grocery merchandise. Being a part of the small bank "Futuras Empresarias" has helped her have a better quality of life. She is very grateful to Kiva for helping accomplish her goals.

The young man Jesus is not in the photograph since he did not attend the day of the reunion because he had classes at the university. Gladys is the second one on the right hand side with a black sweater on and holding a blue notebook.

loans.use: to buy wholesale grocery merchandise.

loans.name: Marta Liliam

texts.es: Marta de 37 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a sus padres y sus 3 hijos de 13, 19 y 20 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que posee una tienda la cual atiende con mucha amabilidad y que gracias a eso cuenta con un numero grande de clientes que la visitan, además de ser su fuente de ingresos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos brindándoles todos los insumos básicos, así como llevar lo necesario para su hogar. Marta desea adquirir más variedad de productos para poder ofrecerles más opciones de compra a sus clientes, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: vasos, platos, juguetes, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, etc., para surtir más su tienda y poderles ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marta is 37 and lives in her own home with her parents and her 3 children who are 13, 19 and 20 years old.

She is a hard-working woman who owns a shop which she runs in a very friendly manner and thanks to that she has a large number of customers who visit. Besides being a source of income with which she has provided the basic necessities for her children, it also lets her buy household necessities.

Marta wants to have a wider variety of products so she can offer her customers more options. This is why she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy: glasses, plates, toys, sugar, rice, and beans in order to stock her store and be able to offer wider range of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy: glasses, plates, toys, sugar, rice, and beans in order to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in corn, cabbage, beans, cheese and other ingredients necessary to make and sell pupusas (corn tortilla stuffed with meat, veggies or cheese) and french fries.

loans.name: Alba Rosa

texts.es:
Alba es una mujer esforzada de cuarenta y un años de edad, todos los días ella se pone metas para seguir adelante y crecer como comerciante. Ella vende mercadería de forma ambulante, el apoyo de su familia ha sido primordial para ella. Gracias a un primer préstamo ella logro captar nuevos clientes, con las ganancias que obtuvo logro comprar una camioneta y así movilizarse sin problemas para ofrecer sus productos.
Habiendo tenido tan buena experiencia, ella además de estar agradecida, cree fielmente en MiCrédito y Kiva, por eso ha vuelto a solicitar un préstamo que planea invertir en la compra de uniformes escolares, zapatos y artículos que se usan en la temporada de fiestas patrias de Nicaragua. Ella está comenzando a conquistar nuevas zonas y nuevos clientes, sabe que es una mujer muy emprendedora y llegara lejos.
texts.en:
Alba is a strong forty-one year old woman. Every day she sets goals to get ahead and to grow as a vendor. She’s a street vendor, and the support of her family has been essential to her. Thanks to her first loan, she managed to get new customers. With the profits she earned, she was able to buy a van and travel without any problems to offer her products.

She has had such a good experience, and she also is thankful. She faithfully believes in MiCrédito and Kiva, which is why she has come back to ask for a loan that she plans to invest in buying school uniforms, shoes, and other items that are used for seasonal holidays in Nicaragua. She is beginning to conquer new areas and new customers; she’s a very enterprising woman and will go far.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: Darwin Yonis

texts.es:
Darwin, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, los cuales están estudiando, mientras que su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Darwin, se dedica a hacer viajes con su microbus desde hace 5 años, el compró su vehículo con la idea de trabaja transportando personas y así lo ha hecho, pero además de eso también trabaja en la agricultura, todos los años cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y su hijo mayor es el único que le ayuda.		

Darwin, necesita el préstamo para reparar su microbus, porque tiene problemas mecánicos y así no puede trabajar, ya que esa es su fuente de trabajo principal y sera de mucha ayuda tener su vehículo en buen estado.

Darwin, sueña con poder seguir trabajando y que Dios le de siempre buena salud a él y al resto de su familia.
texts.en:
Darwin, who is 32 years old, studied through ninth grade. He is married and lives with his wife and their three children. His children study while his wife takes care of the household chores. For the past 5 years, Darwin has made a living by making trips with his van. He bought his vehicle with the idea of working by providing transportation to people, and this is what he has done. However, he also works in agriculture. Every year he cultivates 7,000 square meters of corn and his older son is the only one that helps him.

Darwin needs the loan to repair his van because it has mechanical problems and he is not able to work. It is his main source of income and it will be a big help to have his vehicle in good condition. Darwin dreams of being able to continue to work and that God will always provide good health to him and the rest of his family.

loans.use: to repair his van.

loans.name: Lilian Sarai

texts.es:
Lilian, de 36 años de edad, solo estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada y vive con sus dos hijos, uno estudia tercer grado y el otro primer grado.

Lilian, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace seis años, fue idea de ella comenzar un negocio y decidió vender ropa porque es un negocio muy bueno; anteriormente trabajaba vendiendo pescado, ella sale a vender todos los días por las tardes.

Lilian, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería para la venta, porque le quedan pocos estilos de ropa y con una mayor variedad tendrá mejores ventas y eso significa mejores ganancias.

Lilian, sueña con tener un puesto propio en el mercado y también sueña con ver crecer sus hijos y que sigan estudiando y lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Lilian, who is 36 years old, only studied through high school. She is married and lives with her two children. One of her children is in third grade and the other is in first grade. For the past two years, Lilian has made a living by selling clothing. It was her idea to start a business, and she decided to sell clothes because it is a very good business. Previously, she worked by selling fish. She goes out to sell every day in the afternoon.

Lilian needs the loan to buy more merchandise to sell, because she has very few clothing styles left. With a greater variety of clothing she will have greater sales, and this will mean greater earnings. Lilian dreams of having her own spot in the market. She also dreams of seeing her children grow and that they will continue studying and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Nebojsa

texts.en:
Nebojsa comes from one of the minority communities and is involved in agriculture in addition to working his regular job with an electrical company. His wife stays home to care for their house and four children between the ages of 2 and 13 years old.

Nebojsa plants wheat that he uses and sells or a profit and also has a green house where he plants different vegetables such as peppers, tomatoes, etc. At this time he is in need of a loan in order purchase seeds and artificial guano. This loan will help him to be able to produce a larger and more successful harvest and will help him to then generate a higher income.

He hopes that he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family and he promises to pay on time. He is grateful to the lenders for the help.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and artificial guano.

loans.name: Sokorn's Group

texts.en: Sokorn’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng= province in Cambodia. Sokorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 43 years old, married, and has six children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, etc.

She has been running the general store for seven months and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Mary Jane aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Aloysious

texts.en:
Aloysious is 27 years and a  resident of Kalisizo in Rakai district.  He is married, with two children, one of them in school. 

He is a third-time borrower who owns a retail shop, which he started in 2013 with the aim of improving his daily income.

He works six days a week and 12 hours a day. He started this business to supplement his family income. 

Now he is asking a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy more stocks of rice, sugar, corn flour, beverages, cutlery, and toiletries to sell.  His clients are residents and people from the surrounding area.

Aloysius' aim is to have a bigger stock after acquiring more income.  His challenges are lack of enough capital to expand the business and seasonal changes.  These will soon be history after his getting this financial boost.

He describes himself as honest and hardworking, a businessman encouraging lenders to offer him a facility if he needs it.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of retail items to sell

loans.name: Dharitri

texts.en:
Dharitri 42 years old, and she is married. She has had a poultry business for the last seven years. She lives in Bolangir district, a rural town in Odisha, India. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, her family is at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month.

She is requesting a loan of 15,000 INR to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

With her business profit, Dharitri hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and she also earns income from selling dried coconut meat.  She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business.

Helen has sustained her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Franky

texts.en: Franky is a man with determination. In spite of the obstacles he encountered in his life, he was able to get up and continue dreaming for his family. He is 29 years old and a father of two children ages ten and five years. Franky is engaged in raising pigs. Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and support for feed. Franky is still thinking of other business opportunities that will help him enhance his family's livelihood.  He wants to improve the business to sustain their every day living.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Lourdes Pamela

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Que Progresan.
En este lugar vive la señora Lourdes, tiene 35  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, el cual  estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una universidad.
Doña Lourdes es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y así ganar sus propios ingresos para salir adelante, ella trabaja en una empresa de la localidad y también se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos, ropa y cosméticos ella aprovecha sus ratos libres para visitar a sus clientes aunque sus mejores clientes son las compañeras de trabajo, lleva un año en esta actividad la misma que comenzó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas y bisutería. Lleva más de 1 año  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
Eloy Alfaro parish in the city of Manta is known for its beautiful beaches visited year-round by national and foreign tourists, and for being one of the most important ports in the country and the Americas, located on the Pacific coast. There, the Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Que Progresan [Women Making Progress Credit Group] meets every fifteen days.

This is where Lourdes lives. She is 35 and married, and from this relationship she has one five-year-old son who is in school. Her husband works at a university.

Lourdes is a woman who likes to work and thus make her own income to get ahead. She works at a local business and also works in sales. She sells shoes, clothing, and cosmetics. She visits her customers in her free time, but her best customers are the women she works with. She has been doing this work for one year. She started it up with the first loan that she received through the group.

This loan is for buying clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, and fashion jewelry. She has been in the Credit Group for more than one year, and she likes it because the loans are fast and do not have too many requirements. Her dream is to give her son the best.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, and fashion jewelry.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 22 years old and single with one child. Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, etc.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 2 months.

In the future Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, etc

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married and 60 years old, with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Fe has a business preparing and selling food in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, rice, and other materials for her food business.

Fe has been in this business for a year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, spices, rice and other materials for her food business

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
Fali is 28 years old and married. She is the one standing to the left hand side in the photograph. She has had a sewing business for the last five years.

Fali lives in Bolangir district, a semi-urban town in Odisha, India. The family earns a low income from their business, and it is not enough to provide basic living comforts. For example, one of the most critical needs is to have a hygienic latrine to use by the family.

For this reason, Fali, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new latrine. She hopes that this loan could fulfill her family's need to have their own latrine.

In the future, Fali hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new latrine.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
RAZIA is a 34 year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He also assists his younger brother by purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of one child and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health expenses.
RAZIA wants to grow the business of her husband so she requested a loan from Kiva's field partner's BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is expecting to boost the earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to kiva field partner's BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits, etc for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Maa Sarala Shg Group

texts.en:
Supriya is a 32-year-old woman who is very hardworking and patient. She has been an elementary school teacher for three years. She taught her three children the best values. She hails from Bolangir district of Odisha, India and is the one standing to the left hand side in the photograph.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 30,000 INR. Supriya will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

loans.use: to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Alyn

texts.en:
Alyn, who is 55 years old, has been a long-time member of CCT, a Christian organization that aims to alleviate poverty and social injustice.  She is thankful that KIVA helps to raise funds for small-business people like her. She is an independent, single woman who has her own business to support herself and some of her siblings.

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan that she will use to buy more quantities of school/office supplies and photo-copying supplies, such as toner cartridges, ink cartridges, and paper, to meet the needs of her photo-copying business.  For additional income, she also has an electronic prepaid loading business for various mobile service network providers. She trusts that you will consider her request to finance her livelihood.

Being a loving woman, Alyn prays only for good health and for her business to grow so she can help support the needs of her family. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for school supplies and photo-copying supplies, such as toner cartridges, ink cartridges, and paper, to meet the needs of her photo-copying business.

loans.name: Sheila Mae

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Sheila Mae works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Sheila Mae is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy additional fruits and vegetables such as radishes, bananas, citrus, carrots, potatoes, sweet potatoes, tomatoes, garlic, onions, etc. to sell at her local market.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables such as radishes, bananas, citrus, carrots, potatoes, sweet potatoes, tomatoes, garlic, onions, etc. to sell at her local market.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 41 years old and a married woman with four children all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Fely has a buy and sell slippers business in the Philippines. Fely requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy slippers to sell at her stall.

Fely has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy slippers to sell at her stall

loans.name: Julio Enrique

texts.es:
Julio es hombre muy optimista, él tiene  58 años de edad, cuenta que su vida se a visto muy beneficiada por el préstamo pues gracias a ello pudo realizar la remodelación de su casa y ahora ya cuenta con un mejor aspecto, por lo que agradece profundamente a los inversionistas de kiva por el apoyo. Julio nuevamente tiene la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para  la compra de puertas de metal para su casa, pues con estas puertas su casa tendrá mayor seguridad, porque la delincuencia ha afectado mucho a su comunidad.
Su esperanza de vida es seguir mejorando su vivienda, para que su familia tenga una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julio is a very optimistic man. He is 58-years old and says that his life has been greatly benefited from the loan. Thanks to the loan, he was able to renovate his house and now it has a better appearance. He profoundly thanks the Kiva loaners for the support.

Julio needs to ask for a loan again to buy metal doors for his house. With these doors, his house will have better security because crime has really affected his community. His life goal is to continue improving his home so that his family has a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metal doors for his house.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
