Rona is 33 years old and married with one child.

Rona works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, and snack food, etc.

She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from tricycle transportation.

Rona aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, and snack foods, etc

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling dried fish.

Elvira dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en: Conchita is a 49 year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married to a farmer and blessed with nine children. Having to raise that number of children Conchita learned to work hard. For the last fifteen years she has operated a Sari-sari store and has been selling vegetables like squash, eggplant, cabbage, okra, tomatoes and ginger. She is asking a loan to buy more vegetables like okra, bitter-gourd, tomatoes and eggplants. She will also use the loan to buy fertilizer for their farm. As a mother she dreams of seeing her children graduate from college and becoming professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, vegetables like okra, cabbage,  bitter-gourd, tomatoes and eggplant

loans.name: Ana Zenobia

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Que Progresan.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4  hijos, tres mayores de edad y una niña de 9 años que estudia en escuela. El marido es maestro albañil. 
Doña Ana es una  mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale tres o cuatro días por semana ya sea en la mañanas o tardes y no tiene horarios fijo, también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando quieren alguna prenda, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 o 15 días, tiene más de 7 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo que les ayuda mucho y más cuando su marido no tiene trabajo, ya que el trabajo de albañil no es seguro y en ocasiones escasea.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas y camisas. Lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
In the Eloy Alfaro parish in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are very popular all year round for national and international tourists and for being one of the most important ports of the country and of America, situated on the banks of the Pacific, every fortnight the "Mujeres Que Progresan" loan group gets together.

Ana lives in this place. She is 42-years old and in a common-law marriage with 4 children. Three are younger and one 9-year old girl goes to school. Her partner is a master mason. Ana is a woman who likes to work to help her partner to get ahead. She works in business and sells all types of clothing door-to-door. She goes out three to four days a week in the morning or afternoons, as she doesn't have a fixed schedule. She also sells in her house as her customers come to her when they need some clothing. She leaves her customers with a credit and collects it every 8 or 15 days. She has been doing this work for more than 7 years, with which she makes a living that helps a lot, even more when her partner is without work. Masonry work is not secure and at times scarce.

This loan will be used to buy pants, blouses and shirts. She has been in the loan group for 3 years and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dreams are to give her daughter the best.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 39 and a married woman with three children still in school.

Elna has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Elna requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Elna has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 66 years old and married with two children. Amalia works very hard to provide for them.

Amalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, etc.

Amalia has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Amalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, etc

loans.name: Mary Chris

texts.en:
Mary Chris is 29 years old and married, with three children.

Mary Chris works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, and snack foods.

She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from direct selling.

Mary Chris aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, and snack foods.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 42 years old, and married with four children.

Amy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, bread, noodles, etc.

She has been running a general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Amy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, bread, noodles, etc

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing it for the past four years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. She sews the garments of ladies from her neighborhood or her hometown. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine because her previous sewing machine has broken due to continuous work.

Naseem thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to provide tailoring services.

loans.name: Esabel

texts.en:
Esabel is a mother to three young children from Bien Unido.

As the wife of a fisherman, she helps her husband with fishing. This has been their source of income for their three children ages 2, 4 and 6. In addition to helping prepare his fishing equipment, she also use her time to farm seaweed and even cook snacks to sell in their community.

She is asking a loan to buy straw and wooden stakes.

In the future, she hope to send her children to school for a better chance in life.

loans.use: to buy straw and wooden stakes

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa used her previous loans for farm inputs and improvement. She is a successful farmer who works tirelessly to improve her family's living standards.

She is able to cultivate the adjacent farm land and she needs money for fertilizer such as manure and plowing labor costs for her fruit trees. She took a loan recently and made her plan a reality.

In the future, she hopes to be able to expand her business and continue improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her fruits in order to sell them in the market.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Anita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana works hard to support three children. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Bibiana requested a PHP 6750 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Bibiana is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a single woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cheryl is 31 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Cheryl has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices and other materials for her business.

Cheryl has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn works hard to support eight children. She is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Emelyn requested a PHP 6750 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lighting systems.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright lights when they study at night. Emelyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light system.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto a pesar de ser muy joven tiene la visión de superación, cuenta que gracias al crédito pudo realizar su inversión en su negocio de compra y venta de papa por cuerda, afortunadamente  le fue muy bien y con sus ganancias apoyo a su familia a sufragar algunos gastos, él agradece profundamente a los inversionistas de kiva. Rigoberto tiene las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente su crédito y lo invertirá en su negocio de compra y venta de papa pues él ha considerado ahora inclinarse por otras verduras para satisfacer mejor a sus clientes.
Su gran esperanza de vida es contar con su vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, despite being very young, has a vision of overcoming. He says that thanks to the loan he could make an investment in his business buying and selling plots of potatoes. Fortunately, it went really well for him and with his earnings he supported his family to pay for some expenses. He profoundly thanks the Kiva investors.

Rigoberto has hopes of getting another loan to invest in his business buying and selling potatoes because he has now considered leaning towards other vegetables to better satisfy his customers. His great life hope is to have his own home.

loans.use: to buy and sell plots of vegetables.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Marta es una persona muy dedicada a sus estudios, esta poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder conseguir sus metas, y por medio de ellas poder ofrecer un servicio profesional a sus pacientes ya que ella esta estudiando la carrera de enfermería.Ella comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar la matricula de su carrera, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo ya que quiere volver a pagar su matricula, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marta is a person very dedicated to her studies. She is putting in her greatest effort in order to be able to pursue her goals, and by virtue of this to be able to offer a professional service to her patients since she is studying for a career in nursing. She says that she used her previous loan to be able to pay the tuition for her course which helped her a lot.

Today she is requesting a new loan since she wants to go back to pay her tuition again, and in this way to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Inas

texts.en:
Inas is a 22 year old married woman living with her husband. She has two children attending school. Her husband is the main income provider and works in a local hospital. He is a hard worker in order to collect enough money to be able to pay their high living expenses.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to pay her children’s registration fees at school. She said that she is very happy and willing to always benefit from Kiva’s loan to continue her education costs.

loans.use: to pay her children’s registration fees at school

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique con 53 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos, vive en casa propia de material rústico.Luis Enrique cuenta con muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Luis Enrique se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café,cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años.El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna,y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Luis Enrique es socio recurrente para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Luis Enrique firma sólo.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique is 53-years old. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his partner and their four young children. They live in their own home made of rustic material. Luis Enrique has very good personal and work references from the residents in the area. The people who live here work mainly in agriculture, business and livestock.

Luis Enrique works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has 4 years of experience in this field. The loan that he is asking for will be used for agricultural jobs; applications and incorporations of plant protection products, fertilizers, and labor for his crops. This will help with the physiological, morphological and productivity improvements of his crops. Also, it will help him to have a convenient harvest which will lead to a better production and better product quality, and he will not have problems selling his product. Luis Enrique is a recurrent member in the Edpyme Alternativa institution.

loans.use: with agricultural jobs; applications and incorporations of plant protection products, fertilizers, and labor for his crops.

loans.name: Helcher Esmith

texts.es:
Helcher con 30 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y su hijo de 5 años de edad, vive en casa familiar de material rústico,en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Helcher se dedica a la venta de animales menores, dicha actividad la realiza en su propio domicilio. Adicionalmente cultiva café variedad catimor; a la fecha tiene 0.5 hectáreas, plantación tiene 4 años de edad, este cultivo lo desarrolla en terreno se su Padre. Producto vende a compradores mayoristas de la zona. Helcher para incrementar su inventario de animales menores y sanidad de los mismos, con la finalidad de obtener mas ingresos para beneficio propio y de su familia.

Helcher es socio recurrente es nuestra institución financiera, Edpyme Alternativa. Helcher firma solo.
texts.en:
Helcher is 30-years old and lives with his partner and 5-year old son. He lives in a family house made of rustic material, in the district of Santo Tomás, Cutervo province and department of Cajamarca in Peru, in a rural area. He has very good personal references. The people that live in this area mainly work in agriculture, business and livestock.

Helcher works in selling small animals. He does this job in his own home. Additionally, he grows catimor coffee. At the moment he has .5 hectares and the plantation is 4 years old. He develops these crops on his father's land and sells the product to wholesale buyers in the area.

To increase his small animal inventory and their health, Helcher is asking for a loan to get more income for his and his family's benefit. Helcher is a recurrent member in the loan institution, Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to increase his small animal inventory and their health.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy materials for her boat.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her boat for her fishing business.

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children, three of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from selling charcoal.

Ma. Corazon dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support five children. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Edna requested a PHP 6750 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with a bright light when they study at night.

Edna is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 34 years old, married, and the mother of one child.

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw, which always remains in bad condition. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, Rani has contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan so that her husband can repair his rickshaw. He wants to maintain the engine’s piston, one wheel and wants to pay the labor costs. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

Rani is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Rani thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Samera

texts.en:
Samera is a 40-year-old, Lebanese, married woman who lives with her husband and their three children, all of whom are still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source to help her family to meet the needs of life and to be able to enhance their way of living.

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the first installment of her children’s educational fees.

In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman from Bien Unido. She is 42 years old. With a happy countenance, Alma shared that she has been farming rice for three years. She also raise hogs for additional income.

She tried to keep expanding her businesses and she now sell rice and she is also a retailer of prepaid top-up for mobile subscribers. She is asking a loan to buy two piglets, feed, more rice to sell and top-up loads.

Through her hard work, she hope to successfully send her two children, ages 8 and 13 to school so they can find a good job and hopefully help manage their business well.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, more rice to sell, and pre-paid mobile phone top-up loads.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, se desempeña como secretaria en una empresa de ingeniería, actualmente se encuentra cursando la carrera de Ingeniería informática, su sueño es contar con su propia empresa.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo y agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer.
texts.en:
Rocio is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She studies and works at the same time. She makes a living working as a secretary for an engineering company. Currently, she is pursuing a degree in computer engineering. Her dream is to have her own business.

She is requesting a loan to pay her university tuition so that she can continue with her studies. She gives thanks for this opportunity that she is receiving, which will allow her to grow.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hard wood for house repair.

loans.name: Jenebeb

texts.en:
Jenebeb is 40 years old, and single with one child. Jenebeb works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs and etc.

She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns income from selling rice.

Jenebeb aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs and etc

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is 26 years old and single with one child, who is still in school. Jenefer works very hard to provide for them.

Jenefer runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs and etc.

Jenefer has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Jenefer would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs and etc

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es estudiante de la carrera de enfermería, por medio de sus estudios quiere poder abrirse camino al mundo laboral, ella está en su cuarto año de la carrera.
Comenta que su tía la ayuda con los gastos de la universidad, y que con su esfuerzo también lo está logrando.
Su meta es poder terminar su carrera para así tener su título y conseguir un trabajo digno. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Luz is studying nursing. Through her studies, she hopes to make a path for herself in the workforce. She is in her fourth year of school. She states that her aunt helps her with university expenses. With great effort, she is also able to help. Her goal is to finish her studies so that she can obtain her degree as well as a decent job.

She is requesting this loan to pay her university tuition in order to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition.

loans.name: Thairy Guillermina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros y por  ser uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Que Progresan.
En este lugar vive la señora Thairy, tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 13, 9 y 7   años de edad, uno estudia en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el municipio local.
Doña Thairy es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así generar sus propios ingresos que les ayuden a salir adelante junto a su familia, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres, pollo, carnes, granos, embutidos, legumbres, confitería, artículos de bazar, helados, aguas y muchos otros productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes   que a diario acuden a su local, sus hijos le ayudan cuando están desocupados, aunque siempre es ella que está en su local, lleva más de 10 años con este negocio el cual es parte de su vida.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos aumenta su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejora  su familia.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the communal group "Mujeres Que Progresan" (Women Who Progress), meet in the parish of Eloy Alfaro of the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all year long by national and international tourists and for being one of the most important ports in all of the country, and throughout America, and is situated on the banks of the Pacific.

This is where Thairy lives. She is 35 years old and with her partner has 3 children, 13, 9 and 7; one is in highschool and the others are in elementary school. Her partner works at the local municipality.

Thairy is a woman who enjoys fending for herself and as such, generating her own income that helps her and her family get ahead. She runs a small grocery store in her home. There, she sells all kinds of groceries, like chicken, meats, grains, charcuterie, vegetables, pastries, bazar items, ice cream, water and other products to satisfy her clients' needs and whom visit her store on a daily basis. Her children help her when they are available, although she is always the one at the store. She's been running this business for more than ten years and it's part of her life.

She is requesting a loan to buy groceries. She's been in this group for 7 years and she likes it because her business grows with each loan.

Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: buy groceries.

loans.name: Petero

texts.en:
Petero is 54 years old and is a resident of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is married with four children.

He deals in cattle sales, supplemented by local brew sales and crop farming for additional income. He hopes to have as many cattle as possible for fattening so that they can mature and earn attractive prices at market. His hardships are prolonged drought and poor roads from rural areas to the markets.

He is requesting a loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Gerrylyn

texts.en:
Gerrylyn works hard to support her family. She is married with one child and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Gerrylyn requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more clothes, pants, slippers, shorts, etc.

Gerrylyn has been in this business for 1 year now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and selling slippers.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, pants, slippers, and shorts, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 59 year old married man with three children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda.

He has been a cattle keeper for more than five years along side crop farming where he sells the surplus for additional income. He dreams of expanding his business to other busy places and increase his sales. He is a hardworking man, only challenged by the high transportation costs and drought which affects his returns.

John is requesting a loan to buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 40 years old, a resident of Kasasa B in Rakai district and is married with 4 children, all of whom go to school.

Stephen deals in cattle fattening which he started in 2005. He also grows Matooke. He works 7 days a week, 12 hours a day and started this business with the aim of supplementing his daily income to be able to look after his family.

Stephen wants a loan of ugx3,000,000 to buy cattle and feed so that they can grow fast and produce high yields.

His customers are people from different areas in town, especially butchers. However, his challenges are inadequate capital to expand the business and competition.

Stephen is a hard working and focused man.

loans.use: to buy cattle and feed for fattening.

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Liduvina con 58 años de edad, de estado civil casada,vive junto a su esposo e hijos,en casa propia, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Liduvina cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Liduvina se dedica a la actividad de la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos,patos y cuyes, desde hace más de 5 años de actividad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento para la crianza de los mismos,de esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Liduvina a tenido 3 préstamos en nuestra institución. El último fue de S/.4,000.00 y lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
Liduvina, 58 years old, married, lives with her husband and children, in her own home, in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, in the department of Lambayeque, Peru. Liduvina has very good personal as well as work references from area residents.

Liduvina has been in business for more than 5 years raising and selling small animals such as pigs, ducks, and guinea pigs out of her own home. She is applying for a loan to buy animals and feed to raise them, and in this manner make her business grow more, obtain more income and be able to improve her quality of life.

Liduvina has had three loans with our institution. The last one was for S/.4000.00 [approx. USD$1,243] and she repaid it promptly.

loans.use: buy animals and feed to raise them.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
Apolinar con 72 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Apolinar se dedica al cultivo de café,desde hace 20 años. El presente crédito será destinado para la compra de abonos e invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca, de esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Apolinar es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.Apolinar a manejado cuatro créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Apolinar is 72 years old, he is married, and he lives with his wife and children in the district of Callacyuc, province of Cutervo, area of Cajamarca, in the country of Peru. The citizens of this place work mostly in agriculture, commerce, and breeding livestock.
Apolinar has worked farming coffee for 20 years. The current loan will be used for the purchase of manure and investment in the maintenance of his farm. In this way, he will obtain a higher yield.
Apolinar is a recurring member in our institution, Edpyme Alternativa. He has taken out four loans, all of which he has paid back on time.

loans.use: to purchase manure and invest in the maintenance of his farm.

loans.name: Erwina

texts.en:
Erwina is a 28-year-old single woman with two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Erwina has a food vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 1 year. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, cooking oil, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food production business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, cooking oil, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina works hard to support her family. Marcelina is married and has a rice farming business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marcelina has been in this business for 7 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Frezel

texts.en:
Frezel works hard to support three children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Frezel requested a PHP 6750 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with a bright light when they study at night.

Frezel is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es de la ciudad de coronel Oviedo, él es una persona que se esfuerza por poder ser un profesional útil a la sociedad. Comenta que trabaja en su propio negocio de bebidas, y a la vez estudia la carrera de contabilidad, en una universidad de renombre.
Su sueño es llegar a ser un profesional independiente, que pueda ser útil, no solo a sí mismo, sino también a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juan is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. He is a person who is making an effort to become a professional that is helpful to his community. He states that he works on his own beverage business and, at the same time, studies accounting at a renowned university. His dream is to become an independent professional who is of use not only to himself, but also to society.

He is requesting this loan to pay his university tuition so that he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition.

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is the age of 30, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a weaver and knots blankets at home. For knotting blankets, wool is used. There is no better kind of blankets than blankets made by hand, though this is far from implying that all hand-tufted blankets are superior to all machine-made ones.

Her husband is very expert and knots very fine blankets. This is a very slow and time-consuming procedure; he knots blankets over nights. This is the reason her husband sells them at a high price, but the problem is the customers do not agree upon the demanded cost. The demand for fine blankets has been increasing from time to time.

However, her husband wants to buy more raw materials for knotting blankets, but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible. Therefore, Mehwish requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy wool for knotting blankets. This could become the cause of an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's blanket-knotting business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old, and her three children are currently in school.

Josephine has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables such as carrots, cabbage, onions, garlic, spices, and other vegetables for her local market.

Josephine has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as carrots, cabbage, onions, garlic, spices, and other vegetables for her local market.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos con 26 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive junto a sus padres, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona urbana.

Juan Carlos se dedica a la actividad de servicio de transporte público en mototaxi, desde hace más de 5 años de antigüedad en el negocio. Solicita préstamo para el mantenimiento de su vehículo.De esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Juan Carlos a tenido 4 préstamos en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.El último fué de S/.1,000.00 y lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 26 years old and single. He lives with his parents in an urban area of the Cayaltí district, which is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque department of the country of Peru.

Juan Carlos makes a living providing public transportation services in his mototaxi. He has been in this business for over 5 years. He is requesting a loan to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle. This way, he hopes to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

Juan Carlos has received 4 loans from Edpyme Alternativa. The last one was for 1000 PEN, and he repaid it on time.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Digna Eloisa

texts.es: Digna tiene cincuenta y siete de edad, de estado civil casada, vive en el sector rural, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de chanchos, compra las crías y con dedicación los alimenta y cuida de ellos para cuando salgan al mercado tengan un mayor costo, solicita el crédito para comprar más chanchos e incrementar sus ganancias para el sustento diario de ella y de su familia.
texts.en: Digna is 57 years old, she is married, and she lives in a rural area. She works breeding and selling pigs. She buys the piglets and with a lot of work she feeds them and takes care of them, so that when they go to the market they will have a higher price. She is asking for the loan to buy more pigs and increase her profit for the daily sustenance of herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Marcial Humberto

texts.es:
Marcial Humberto con 66 años de edad, de estado civil padre soltero,vive junto a sus dos hijos, vive en casa propia de material rústico,en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. marcial Humberto cuenta con muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su localidad.

Marcial Humberto se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz,con una experiencia en el rubro de 30 años.El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarias, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha . De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Marcial Humberto es socio recurrente para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Marcial Humberto firma solo.
texts.en:
Marcial Humberto, 66 years of age, a single father, lives with his two children. He lives in his own house of rustic materials, in the district of Pucara, province of Jaen, department of Cajamarca, Peru. Marcial Humberto has very good personal and work references in his area.

Marcial Humberto works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of rice, with 30 years’ experience in this line of work. He will use the loan he is granted for farming tasks, to pay for the application of pesticides and fertilizers, and to pay for labor for his harvest.

This will help to improve the crops physiologically, morphologically, and productively, and will also ensure a timely harvest, resulting in better yield and increased product quality. He will therefore have no trouble selling his product.

Marcial Humberto is a recurring client with our institution, Edpyme Alternativa. Marcial Humberto is sole signer.

loans.use: pay for the application of pesticides and fertilizers, and for labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix con 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Querecotillo,provincia Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Felix cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de su calidad.

Felix se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de café,hace más de 10 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en compra de abonos, con la compra de abonos realizará mejoras en su cultivo y con eso incrementará los rendimientos de su cultivo.

Felix es socio nuevo para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Felix no se encuentra bancarizado.
texts.en:
The civil status of Felix, 39, is attached. He lives with his wife and children in the district of Querecotillo, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca, in the country of Peru. Felix has very good references both personal and occupational from his local peers.

Felix has been making a living from agriculture growing coffee for ten years. He is requesting a loan in order to invest in manure. With the purchase of manure, he will realize improvements in his crop and with this he will increase the output of his crop.

Felix is a new member of our institution Edpyme Alternativa. Felix is not currently financed.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of manure.  With the purchase of manure, he will realize improvements in his crop.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
Felicidad es una mujer joven de 26 años, es una persona responsable, amable con las iniciativas de superarse y mejor la  situación económica de su familia. Felicidad tiene un deseo para salir adelante, gracias a la capacitación a nivel técnico básico de confección de ropa deportiva y ropa casual, estos cursos se realizaron bajo el convenio de la institución Fautapo, que son instituciones que brindan capacitaciones y apoyo a emprendimientos en la región. Por las características mencionadas en  la formación de Felicidad invertirá en la compra de máquinas para iniciar su actividad de confección de ropas y así ofrecer al mercado sus productos.
Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura produce cebolla, zanahoria, tomate, aprendió desde su niñez sobre la agricultura por la afluencia de sus padres en este rubro.
texts.en:
Felicidad is a young 26 year old woman. She is a responsible and friendly person with the initiative to better herself and improve the economic situation of her family. Felicidad has the desire to get ahead thanks to her training at a basic technical level sewing sport and casual clothing. These courses are given under the Fautapo Foundation agreement by institutions that provide training and support to undertakings in the region.

For characteristics covered in Felicidad's training she will invest in the purchase of sewing machines to start her activity sewing clothing and then offer her product on the market.

She currently works in agriculture producing onion, carrots and tomato. She learned about agriculture since she was a child due to her parents' s involvement in this field.

loans.use: to buy machines for her business sewing clothing, offer her products on the market and generate greater income.

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene cincuenta y tres años de edad, vive con sus tres hijos, Carlos es uno de ellos tiene, diecisiete  años, Desde hace veinte años ella se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, un trabajo muy duro pues la alimentación y el cuidado no es nada fácil, este negocio le ha permitido mantener a su familia. Solicita el crédito para la compra de mas chanchos así podría aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Martha is 53 years old. She lives with her three children. Carlos is one of them and is 17 years old. For 20 years she has raised pigs, which is very hard work, since the feeding and the care are not easy. This business has allowed her to maintain her family.

She is applying for the loan to purchase more pigs, so that in this way she will be able to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Alexandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Alexandra es una joven de diecinueve años, de estado civil soltera, a pesar de su corta edad trabaja muy duro para poder satisfacer sus necesidades básicas, se dedica a la costura y elaboración de ropa, uniformes para niños, jóvenes y adultos, es un trabajo de mucho sacrificio, pues armar las prendas requiere de concentración y esfuerzo, solicita el crédito para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Alexandra, 19, is a young, single woman. Despite her young age, she works very hard to satisfy her basic needs. She makes a living from sewing and creating clothing, uniforms for children, young people and adults. It is a labor of much sacrifice, since to put together articles of clothing requires concentration and effort.

She is requesting a loan in order to improve her business and thus her earnings.

loans.use: to implement her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BUENOS AMIGOS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Yaneth continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta laboratorio fotográfico, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con todas sus cuotas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de nuevas cámaras.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the communal bank "Buenos Amigos". The bank is located in the district of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The partner Yaneth continues to make a living from photographic laboratory sales. She feels grateful for the loan offered and promises to make all her payments. The partner is a responsible and enterprising person, since in this way she moves her family forward.

The partner is requesting the loan to buy new cameras.

loans.use: to buy new cameras.

loans.name: Lidnys Yaneth

texts.es: Lidnys es una joven estudiante que desea culminar sus estudios en medicina. Para esto solicita un préstamo de dos mil dólares ($2,000), dinero que usará para la conclusión de sus estudios. De esta forma Lidnys logrará salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lidnys is a young student who wishes to complete her medical studies. For this she is applying for a loan of two thousand dollars ($2,000), money that she will use for the completion of her studies. In this way Lidnys will succeed in getting ahead and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: pay for educational expenses to finish medical studies.

loans.name: Lolis

texts.es:
Lolis con 24 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive junto a su esposo y menor hijo, en el distrito de Colasay,provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Lolis se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, desde hace 6 años. Solicita préstamo para invertir en las labores de mantenimiento de su cultivo de café, compra de abonos para incrementar sus rendimientos, de esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Lolis es socio recurrente para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Lolis, who is 24 years old and married, lives with her husband and child (a minor) in the district of Colasay, which is in the province of Jaén and the department of Cajamarca, in Perú. The inhabitants of this community work mostly in the fields of agriculture, commerce, and livestock farming.

Lolis has been working in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of coffee, for the past 6 years. She is requesting a loan to invest in maintenance work for the cultivation of her coffee, and the purchase of organic fertilizers to increase yield. This way, she will have a higher output.

Lolis is a returning member of our institution, Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance work for the cultivation of her coffee, and to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 72 years old and widowed with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 2,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

Lydia has been in this business for six years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Donneua Group

texts.en:
Kiksana understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. He knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Kiksana purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Kiksana is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Dina Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BUENOS AMIGOS, la socia sigue  ejerciendo su carrera de contadora, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una laptop.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Buenos Amigos (Good Friends). The member continues practicing her career as an accountant. She is doing well with her work, thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She is a responsible person, and she wishes to be able to continue working and in this way keep supporting her family.
She is grateful for the given loan and she is committed to meeting the established payments.
The member asks for a loan for the purchase of a laptop.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Ma. Jocelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Jocelyn lives in Merida, Leyte. With limited resources and opportunity to earn a living, she raises hogs to support her family. She has been in the business for four years to earn an income.

She is asking for a loan to buy feed and supplement for her hogs. This way, she can support the education of her nineteen-year-old son.

In the future, she hope to make repairs and renovation on her barn and to eventually build a concrete one.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements

loans.name: Lonie

texts.en:
Lonie is 56 years old and married with six children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lonie has been in this business for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es: María creció en medio del negocio familiar de las confecciones y mientras su madre realizaba esta labor, ella aprendía, pues sentía inclinación por este arte y no podía pasar desapercibido. Con el paso del tiempo su madre la motivo para que se dedicara a esta actividad consejo que decidió seguir y hoy en día cuenta con cinco años de experiencia con excelentes resultados. Ella es madre de dos hijos y reside con su cónyuge en un barrio de Barranquilla, cuenta con una amplia clientela a quienes confecciona todo tipo de prendas y sus clientes se han mantenido fieles con el pasar del tiempo, pues brinda un excelente servicio y elabora sus prendas con diseños exclusivos a la medida. María necesita aprovisionarse de insumos y materias primas porque se avecina la temporada más alta del año y los costos se incrementan, es por ello que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Con esta inversión contará con un stock determinante para la agilidad en las entregas de sus productos y sus clientes estarán más satisfechos.  Su meta a futuro es adquirir más máquinas que respalden su producción.
texts.en:
Maria grew up in the midst of her family's dressmaking business, and while her mother did this work she learned the trade.  She felt an inclination toward this art which she could not ignore.  Over time, her mother motivated her to devote herself to this activity, advice that she decided to follow.  Today, she has 5 years of experience in this line of work, with excellent results.

Maria is the mother of 2 children, and she lives with her husband in a neighborhood of Barranquilla.  She has many customers for whom she makes all types of garments, and her customers have remained loyal over time, as she provides excellent service and makes her garments to measure in exclusive designs.

Maria needs to stock up on supplies and materials, because the high season for sales is approaching and her costs are rising.  This is why she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing she has done through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  With this investment she will be able to have the supplies she needs to deliver her products more quickly, and her customers will be more satisfied.  In the future, her goal is to acquire more sewing machines to support her production.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert used the previous loan to buy ground nuts, soap, maize flour (posho), beans, and sugar for for resale.

He has been operating a retail shop for the last four years, alongside working as a surveyor where he gets more income. He is faced with the challenge of limited capital that hinders expansion of his business to new areas.

However, he is looking forward to educating his children to higher levels of learning and serving his customers better in order to maintain them. Albert needs a loan to buy sugar, soap, cooking oil, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, cooking oil, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in basic grains, bleach, soap, eggs, etc with the aim of diversifying his business to serve other needs of his clients.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, se dedica a sembrar maíz y maicillo, con las cosechas alimenta a su familia y comercializa otra parte para generar ingresos, además es empleado en un canal de televisión local, su negocio propio lo tiene desde hace tres años, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive solo con su esposa, sus hijos ya son independientes y profesionales, le apoyan un poco económicamente.
Solicita ayuda con un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar obreros que le ayuden para darle un mejor trato a dos manzanas de tierra cultivadas con maíz y maicillo, le será de utilidad para que su cultivo, que ya inició a germinar, produzca cosechas abundantes y sin plagas, espera recuperar la inversión y cancelar la deuda.
Sus proyectos son almacenar granos para la alimentación familiar y para vender a mejores precios.
texts.en:
Jorge makes his living growing corn and sorghum. He uses the harvest to feed his family and sells a portion to generate income. In addition, Jorge is employed at a local television station. He has had farming business for three years. Jorge is married and has two children. He lives with his wife; his children are grown, live on their own and have careers. They do help Jorge a little financially.

Jorge is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies and to pay the laborers who help him to improve the two blocks of land he has planted with corn and sorghum. This will be helpful to him in that his crop, which has already started to germinate, will produce abundant harvests free from disease. Jorge hopes to recuperate his investment and pay off his debt.

Jorge's plans are to store grains to feed his family and to sell at better prices.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and to pay the laborers who help him to improve two blocks of land planted with corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito para continuar trabajando en la agricultura, podrá comprar abono, insecticidas, y herbicidas, dará un mejor trato a sus cultivos de maíz y frijol, su esperanza es que las cosechas sean abundantes para alimentar a su familia y generar ingresos.
El crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda para seguir trabajando en el campo, sus condiciones económicas son casi las mismas debido a que no tuvo las cosechas esperadas por la falta de lluvia, su familia se mantiene.
texts.en:
Maria finds herself needing to request a new loan in order to continue working in agriculture. She will be able to buy manure and insecticides. She will give better care to her corn and bean crops. Her hope is that the harvests will be abundant in order to feed her family and generate income.

The previous loan was a great help to continue working in the field. Her economic condition is about the same since she did not have the anticipated harvests due to the lack of rain. Her family is holding together.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticides.  She will give better care to her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is the age of 40; she is mother of one son and two daughters and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc.

He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others.

Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very a good relation with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business is running well.

Due to his good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Kubra requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc.

Kubra hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the needs of her family. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc., for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema, who is in her late 40's, is married with four kids, two of whom are in school, and others of whom are grown up. She has been running a gengeduka business for six years now. She works from 9AM to 9 PM daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Neema's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the gengeduka and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.

She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, to buy a plot of land, to save some in her bank account, to reinvest in business, and to cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the gengeduka store. She dreams of owning a retail shop.

Neema will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the gengeduka store.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is from Merida, Leyte. A married woman at 30, Divina works hard to help provide for her children ages 4, 7 and 8.

She has engaged in selling gasoline for six years now. Since the gasoline store is quite far, people will prefer buying gasoline in the neighborhood stall that sells gasoline using empty soft drink bottles.

Divina is asking for a loan to buy more gasoline that she can resell. The income will help her pay the school fees of her children and buy a healthy meal for her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to resell.

loans.name: Bonefance

texts.en:
Bonefance used the previous loan to buy trees for splitting firewood to sell. He owns a butcher shop, sells cows to other butcher owners, sells firewood, and is a farmer. He started all these activities ten years back with an aim of rising money to cater for his family's needs.

He is faced with hardships of weather changes that disturb proper drying of firewood, poor roads that make it very costly to transport cows to his butcher. However, he is looking forward to constructing rentals where he can earn more money and educate all his children up to the university. He has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Amanda Bety

texts.es:
Amanda comenta que el resultado de haber invertido el crédito anterior en la sastrería ha sido positivo, ya que mejoro mucho su negocio, cuenta con más clientes satisfechos y genera los ingresos con los que está cumpliendo con sus diferentes compromisos, su núcleo familiar se mantiene.
Requiere de un crédito para continuar mejorando su negocio, le servirá para comprar una máquina de coser usada y materiales de costura como telas, hilos, broches, etc., podrá tener mejores herramientas para trabajar.
texts.en:
Amanda says that she has had positive results from having invested her previous loan in tailoring. Her business improved quite a lot, she has more satisfied customers, and she is earning an income with which she is fulfilling her various commitments and supporting her nuclear family.

Amanda needs a loan to continue improving her business. It will help her to purchase a second-hand sewing machine and sewing materials, such as fabric, thread fasteners etc. so she can have better tools with which to do her work.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand sewing machine and sewing materials, such as fabric, thread, fasteners etc., so she can have better tools with which to do her work.

loans.name: Diego Andres

texts.es: Diego persistente, trabajador tiene 26 años,  un hijo de ocho años  viven los dos,  la madre del pequeño los abandono, a pesar del duro desempeño como madre y padre, se dedica a la crianza de ganado todos los días a las cuatro de la mañana se levanta a llevarlos  al campo para que ceben, luego regresa  realiza el desayuno para su hijo, le va a dejar a la escuela gratuita del sector y  se va a buscar trabajo como jornalero .Diego necesita el dinero  quiere comprar tres terneros criarlos, obtener mayor ganancia para alimentarlo y educarlo a su hijo.
texts.en:
Diego, persistent and hard-working, is 26 years old, and lives with his eight-year-old son, just the two of them. The mother of his son left them. In spite of how hard it is to be both a mother and a father, Diego works at raising cattle everyday. He gets up at 4 o'clock in the morning to take them out to pasture so they can fatten up, and then he comes back to fix breakfast for his son. He drops his son off at the free school in their community, then goes to look for work as a day laborer.

Diego needs the money to purchase three calves to raise, in order to earn a higher profit, and feed and educate his son.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Ponciano

texts.en:
Ponciano is from Merida, Leyte. He has been living alone since his partner passed away. To support himself, he has raised hogs for 15 years. This is his source of income.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and additional piglets to raise. Each month Ponciano earns an average income of PHP 2,200 by doing the hog raising business.

In the future, he plans to make his business bigger and more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Plasida

texts.es: La señora Placida es originaria de la provincia Capinota migro hacia el trópico con la finalidad de buscar un mejor futuro, en la actualidad vive en Entre Rios, en su humilde vivienda de madera que lo construyo en su lote urbano que lo adquirió con mucho sacrificio, desde el momento que llego a este lugar se dedicó a trabajar en la agricultura, en principio trabajo en la parcela de sus vecinos y conocidos luego de muchos años de sacrificio logro comprar su propio lote agrícola el cual le permitió progresar ya que todos los ingresos generados fueron para su beneficio, actualmente trabaja en este lote agrícola dedicándose a la producción de yuca, la superficie cultivada de este productos en la actualidad es muy pequeña por eso quiere ampliar más su producción y así poder mejorar sus ingresos para que estos le permitan tener una vida más digna así mismo en el futuro tiene planificado construir una vivienda más digan el cual será posible si sigue mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Placida is a native of Capinota Province. She migrated to the tropics in search of a better future. She currently lives in Entre Rios in a humble, wood home, which she built on her urban lot. The lot was acquired through much sacrifice.
From the moment señora Placida arrived in Entre Rios, she dedicated herself to working in agriculture. At first, she worked on neighbors' and acquaintances' plots of land. After many years of sacrifices, señora Placida was able to purchase her own agricultural lot, which allowed her to move forward. Then, all the income generated went to her.
Currently, señora Placida works this same agricultural lot and makes her living producing yucca. The area she has planted with yucca right now is very small, which is why she wants to further expand her production. This will improve her income so that she can have a more dignified life. In addition, in the future she plans to build a more dignified home, which will be possible if she continues improving her income.

loans.use: to expand her production and improve the produce that she sells so she can generate a larger income for her family.

loans.name: Ma. Grecian

texts.en:
Ma. Grecian is 28 years old and single with five children. Three children are currently in school, Ma. Grecian works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

Ma. Grecian has been in this business for two years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 37 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

Julie has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Omar Alfredo

texts.es: Omar es un microempresario de 46 años de edad que se encuentra domiciliado un barrio de soledad un municipio del departamento del Atlántico. Él estudió en una institución del estado soldadura y con este arte inició su taller de ornamentaciones y trabajos en hierro, hoy en día cuenta con una amplia experiencia de 22 años en el oficio que le permite fabricar productos de protección para viviendas como cerramientos en hierro para terrazas, ventanas y puertas.  La gran mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran en este municipio a quienes les diseña sus productos y de acuerdo a las especificaciones realiza cotizaciones para estipular el contrato que generalmente incluye un pago de contado. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en mantenimiento de máquinas y compra de herramientas que le permitan dar mejores acabados a sus productos que además de ser para seguridad, es importante que sean estéticos y agradables. Su meta a futuro es mejorar la imagen del negocio y la calidad de vida de su familia conformada por su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
Omar is a 46-year-old micro-entrepreneur who lives in a neighborhood of Soledad, a township in the department of El Atlántico. He studied welding in a state institution, and with this ability he set up his workshop for ornamentation and [other] works in iron. Now he has the extensive experience of 22 years in this work, which allows him to make products for the protection of houses, such as enclosures for terraces, windows, and doors. The great majority of his customers are from this township. He designs his products for them, and according to the specifications, he gives them estimates to stipulate the contract, which generally includes a cash payment.

He is now applying for his first Kiva loan through Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in order to invest in maintaining his machines and buying tools that will allow him to give better finishes to his products, because in addition to being for security, it is important that they be aesthetic and pleasing.

His goal for the future is to improve the appearance of his business and the quality of life of his family, which consists of his wife and his four children.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of his machines and the purchase of tools.

loans.name: Qemal

texts.en:
Qemal is 51 years old. He lives with his wife, sister, and mother in Batumi district. Qemal is involved in the fish breeding business. His wife works at a local hospital as a nurse and gets a small monthly income. Qemal needs money to purchase feed for fish and requested a loan.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,000 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase a stock of food for fish. Qemal awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for fish

loans.name: Tarynda Shamelly

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BUENOS AMIGOS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Tarynda  sigue ejerciendo  su carrera de contadora, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la materiales de escritorio para su oficina.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Buenos Amigos" (Good Friends) communal bank. The communal bank is located in Cusco District, Cusco Department.

The member, Tarynda, is still working as an accountant. She feels grateful about the loan she has been granted and promises to comply with the established repayment plan. Tarynda is a responsible and diligent person, which is how she is able to get her family ahead.

Tarynda is requesting the loan to purchase office supplies for her office.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies for her office.

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Fifty nine year Leocadia old owns a "carenderia" (restaurant) and a Sari-sari (general store) business in Ormoc City, Leyte. For two decades this has been her main source of income. 

Leocadia has requested a loan to buy chips, seasoning, fruits, vegetables and meat for her store. Through these additional funds, she can buy ahead of time and maximize her productivity.
Leocadia hopes to increase her customer base for a more sustainable business.

loans.use: to buy chips, seasoning, fruits, vegetables and meat

loans.name: Florentino

texts.en:
Florentino is a 53 year-old married man who lives in the rural town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol. He engages in vegetable gardening. He grows tomatoes, eggplant and spring onions.  
He is married with four children. Three of his children are still attending school.
He has been farming  for 2 years.

He needs the loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizer to improve the yield of his farm and to make more profit. In this way he can start to manage his income wisely and start to pay his obligations.

For the future, Florentino  hopes to expand his business by growing more vegetables.

Florentino thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 46 years old and married with eight children. Four of her children are in school.

Josie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josie has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from frozen food.

Josie aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lyslee

texts.en:
Lyslee is 29 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Lyslee works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

Lyslee has been in this business for two years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Nenia

texts.en:
Ma. Nenia is 36 years old and married with four children.

Ma. Nenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

Ma. Nenia has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from selling school supplies and slippers.

Ma. Nenia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc

loans.name: Rigoberto Alfredo

texts.es:
Rigoberto, vive con su esposa y dos hijos que tienen las edades de 7 y 10 años de edad, se encuentran estudiando, él administra un taller de motocicletas desde hace varios años, utilizo capital propio para fundarlo, trabaja de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar llantas, grasa, focos para luces, cadenas, etc., pretende tener todo lo necesario a su alcance para realizar su trabajo en menor tiempo, considera que así mejorara el servicio y atenderá a nuevos clientes, espera tener más ingresos.
Su visión es tener un negocio más popular en la zona.
texts.en:
Rigoberto lives with his wife and two children, who are aged 7 and 10 years old and attend school. He has run a motorcycle shop for several years; he used his own capital to establish it; he works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm.

He will use the loan to buy tires, grease, bulbs for headlights, chains, etc.; he aims to have everything he needs on hand in order to perform his work in less time. He considers that in this way he will improve service and serve new customers; he hopes to have more income. His vision is to have a more popular business in the area.

loans.use: buy tires, grease, bulbs for headlights, chains, etc.; he aims to have everything he needs on hand in order to perform his work in less time.

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carolina, se siente satisfecha porque gracias a los créditos está progresando y mantiene en el mercado la venta de frutas y verduras, además tiene oportunidad de darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
Nuevamente requiere de un crédito para poder comprar tomates, repollos, papas, cebollas, pipianes, etc., mantendrá su inventario surtido para atender mejor a sus clientes, espera que las ventas se mantengan.
texts.en:
Carolina is satisfied because thanks to the loans she is progressing and maintaining her sale of fruits and vegetables in the marketplace. Additionally, she has the opportunity to give her family a better way of life.

She is again in need of a loan in order to buy tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes, onions, squash, etc. to keep her inventory stocked in order to better tend to her customers. She hopes to maintain sales.
