loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes, onions, squash, etc. to keep her inventory stocked in order to better tend to her customers.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Theresa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell coconut lumber business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Ma. Theresa is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy more coconut wood lumber to sell.

Ma. Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wood lumber to sell

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia, de 45 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos, todos están estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad, ella trabaja en su propio negocio de tortillería, también tiene una pequeña tienda que es administrada con ayuda de su esposo y él se dedica a trabajar estructuras metálicas, de esta manera ambos aportan para solventar las necesidades de su hogar. 

Eusebia, se dedica a vender tortillas y a vender en la tienda, porque es una actividad que aprendió de su madre, quien era una persona muy dedicada y muy reconocida en la comunidad por su alto compromiso y buena disposición de ayudar a las personas de su comunidad. 

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo de maíz y comprar semilla de frijol, para tener una mejor producción de maíz y frijol, de la cual podrá garantizar una mejor alimentación para su familia. 

Eusebia, sueña con colocar una granja de gallinas ponedoras y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, hasta que sean profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Eusebia, who is 45 years old, is a single mother with 3 children. They are all attending the school in their community. She works in her own business making tortillas. She also has a small shop that she runs with the help of her husband. He works in the construction of metallic structures. In this way they both contribute to settle their household needs.
Eusebia works selling tortillas and selling in the store, because this is an activity that she learned from her mother, who was a dedicated person and very known in the community for her high level of commitment and her good disposition to help the people in the community.
She needs the loan money to buy fertilizers for her maize crop and to buy bean seeds, to have a better production of maize and beans, from which she will be able to guarantee better food for her family.
Eusebia dreams of having a farm of laying hens and to help in the education of her children, until they are successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her maize crop and to buy bean seeds.

loans.name: Jesus David

texts.es:
Jesús, de 32 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes principios, trabaja en la agricultura, creció junto a sus padres quienes fueron personas muy humildes y trabajadoras, que le formaron y enseñaron a cultivar la tierra, su familia está formada por su esposa y sus dos hijos y estudio hasta tercer grado. 

Jesús, cultiva granos básicos desde pequeño, este oficio se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos y es la actividad que le permite llevar el sustento diario a su familia. 

Jesús, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes, abono y pesticidas para aplicarlo a sus cultivos de maíz y frijol, pero también comprará ropa para vender, porque su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa y de esta manera tendrán un mejor ingreso.

Los sueños de Jesús, son tener un negocio de venta de granos básicos., que le permita dar servicio a los habitantes de su comunidad y apoyar en la educación de su hijo, hasta que sea un profesionales.
texts.en:
Jesús, who is 32 years old, is a person with excellent principles. He works in agriculture. He grew up with his parents, who were very humble and hard-working people who trained him and taught him to cultivate the land. His family is formed by his wife and his two children. He went to school through third grade.

Jesús has raised basic grains since he was young. This work has become his principal source of income, and it is the activity that allows him to bring daily sustenance to his family.

Jesús needs the loan to purchase fertilizers, compost, and pesticides to apply to his plantings of corn and beans, but he also will buy clothing to sell, because his wife sells clothing and in this way they will have better income.

Jesús' dreams are to have a business of selling basic grains, which would allow him to serve the residents of his community and support the education of his son until he becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and pesticides to apply to his plantings of corn and beans.

loans.name: Ross' Group

texts.en:
Ross, aged 38, is a local farmer living in Battambang province. She has seven dependent children to take care of, three of whom attend school and another one is too young to attend school. She earns a living through growing rice, while her husband is a fisherman. Ross raises pigs and works for others for a fee to earn supplemental income. Together, they earn about USD18 per day and manage to save about USD13 per day. Drought is the main challenge to the rice growing business. 
This will be the second loan for her with VisionFund. The last loan, which was completely paid back, has helped her upgrade the standard of living for her family. In this group of three members, Ross is the leader and she will use some of her loan to pay for plowing and harvesting fees. The rest of money will be used to buy pig feed and fishing gear. She hopes to generate more income in order to improve living conditions and support her school-aged children’s studying.

loans.use: To support rice growing business through paying for plowing and harvesting fees so that she can improve living conditions and support  her school-aged children’s studying.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BUENOS AMIGOS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Rosa María continua con su  negocio de venta de ropa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, , la socia es una persona responsable, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas, panatalones entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Buenos Amigos" (Good Friends) communal bank. The communal bank is located in Cusco District, Cusco Department.

The member, Rosa María, still has her business selling clothing. She feels grateful about the loan she has been granted and promises to comply with the established repayment plan. Rosa María is a responsible person. She still sells her merchandise to the customers who come to her, which is how she gets her family ahead.

Rosa María is requesting the loan to purchase sweaters, pants and other items.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, pants and other items.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia lives in Ormoc City, Leyte Philippines together with her husband and two children ages 15 and 17. She is in the business of hog raising for the last five years. 
Letecia gives her best to earn a living in order to provide support for the needs of the family. Her business provides her the income that she needs.
Letecia wants to expand her business to generate more income, but she needs additional capital to make it happenj. She is requesting a loan to buy piglets, feed and supplements. With the loan, Letecia will be able to make her business sustainable and productive.
Letecia wants to earn more so that she will have the financial capacity to send her children to school for better learning. She believes that education is the key for a good life.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 36 years old and married with three children.  With all three children in school, Ma. Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Fe has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles, spices and other gorceries. 

In the future Ma. Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 46 and a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Maribel has a buy and sell fruit business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bananas and fruits to sell in her food stall.

Maribel has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and fruits to sell in her food stall

loans.name: John

texts.en: John used his previous loan to  pay school fees. He is a farmer who grows food crops like bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes for commercial purposes and at the same time sells charcoal that provides him an extra income for his family. He is grateful to Kiva and the lenders that gave him support to successfully develop his businesses for his family. He was able to profit from his business to pay his loan, pay medical bills and also reinvest it. He is facing hardships of weather change, especially heavy rains that rain on his charcoal stock and high transportation costs from distant places where charcoal is sold. However, John hopes to educate all his children and expand his business to other places. John has asked for a loan to  pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five kids, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .
Fatuma operates a grocery-vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge in the of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel con 44 años de edad, de estado civil soltera,vive junto a sus dos hijos, vive en casa familiar,en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Maribel cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Maribel se dedica a la venta de atahúdes trabaja con la municipalidad de Pucará y Posta Medica,cuenta con 26 años de experiencia en el rubro, las compras lo realiza en Jaén y la venta en Pucará. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de salchipollos, y a brindar servicios de costura, trabajos en casa , así como también al lavado de de ropa. Ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el crédito sin ningún problema.El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con nuevos productos con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.

Maribel es socio recurrente para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Maribel, 44 years old and single, lives with her two children in their family home in the district of Pucará, province of Jaén and department of Cajamarca in the country of Perú. She has very good personal references as a laborer from residents in the area.

Maribel makes a living selling caskets. She works in the municipality of Pucará and Posta Medica and has 26 years of experience in the business. She makes her purchases in Jaén and sells them in Pucará. 

Additionally, she makes a living selling “salchipollos” [a Peruvian chicken dish] and providing sewing services, household jobs and laundry services. These additional incomes allow her to pay off her loan without any issues. 

The loan will be used to invest in her business to supply new products, with which she’ll generate better profits and therefore be able to improve her quality of life. In this business, there is no other major competition in the area, which allows her to have better prices. 

Maribel is a recurring member of the Edpyme Alternativa institution.

loans.use: to invest in her business to supply new products.

loans.name: Para Vivir Mejor Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad mexiquense bordeada por enormes y frondosos árboles, se encuentra una riqueza natural importante para al medio ambiente. Cuenta con vistas excelentes hacia los cerros y campos tapizados por flores de hermosos colores. Las temporadas de lluvia son muy apreciadas por los habitantes ya que esto les ayuda en el cultivo de distintos alimentos. No obstante, la falta de transporte público hace difícil el acceso para las personas que desean visitar la comunidad y, sobre todo, para los lugareños.
    Martha es una de las integrantes del grupo Para Vivir Mejor y se caracteriza por su amabilidad y buen humor. Desde hace seis años se ha dedicado a la cría de cerdos dentro de su comunidad. Inició con dicha actividad con el firme propósito de solventar los gastos de su hogar y costear la educación de cuatro de sus hijos ya que los siete restantes actualmente son independientes. "De alguna manera necesitaba ayudar y por eso me quité el miedo e inicié con la cría de estos animales" comentó muy contenta.  
    Para ella esta actividad resulta muy estimulante ya que pone el mayor cuidado para que cada uno de los animales se desarrolle de forma oportuna; posteriormente vende los ejemplares con clientes de su propia comunidad. 
   En esta ocasión y con el apoyo del crédito compraría alimento, medicamento y material de construcción para poder remodelar los corrales que tiene en su casa.  Actualmente cuenta con veinte cerdos asignados en distintos corrales para su mejor cuidado. Las ganancias que ha obtenido siempre la motivan más y más para cumplir sus metas. Huelga decir que está muy agradecida con los préstamos ya que han sido de gran ayuda para aumentar su producción. 
    El único reto que tiene es cuando sus animales llegan a enfermar por eso trata de tener siempre fondos en caso de recurrir al veterinario. Uno de sus sueños es hacer que sus hijos puedan terminar la carrera universitaria que deseen.
   Las otras integrantes del grupo son Juana y María del Carmen quienes invertirán en la compra de ovejas; Berenice, en cerdos y Lorena, en ropa.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio, Doña Martha es quien viste el suéter negro.
texts.en:
In a Mexican community bordered by enormous and lush trees, a natural wealth important for the environment can be found. It has excellent views of the hills and fields covered in beautifully colored flowers. The residents are very appreciative of the rainy seasons since this helps in cultivating different foods. Nonetheless, the lack of public transportation makes access difficult for people wanting to visit the community and above all, for the residents.

Martha is one of the members of the Para Vivir Mejor [To Live Better] group and is characterized by her friendliness and good humor. She has worked raising pigs in the community for six years. She started said work with the firm goal of covering her household costs and funding the education of four of her children since the remaining seven are now independent. “I needed to help out in some way and that is why I shed my fear and started raising these animals” she comments happily.

This work is very stimulating for her since she takes the upmost care so that each of her animals develops in a timely manner. She then sells the specimens to customers from her own community.

On this occasion, and with support from the loan, she will buy food, medicine and building material in order to remodel the corrals she has at her house. She currently has twenty pigs assigned to separate corrals for better care. The earnings she has obtained keep motivating her more and more to fulfill her goals. It goes without saying that she is very thankful for the loans since they have been of great assistance in increasing her production.

The only challenge she has is when the animals get sick. This is why she tries to always have funds to draw on for the veterinarian. One of her dreams is for her children to be able to complete the university degree that they desire.

The other members of the group are Juana and Maria del Carmen who will invest in buying sheep; Berenice in pigs and Lorena in clothing.

*The photograph was taken in the city garden, Martha is wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to buy food, medicine and material for building a pen for her little pigs.

location.town: Yondece del Cedro, San Jose del Rincon.

loans.name: Dora Esmeralda

texts.es:
Dora  utilizo el crédito anterior para surtir la tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, con ello tuvo estabilidad económica y emprendió un nuevo rubro que es la venta de hot dogs, hamburguesas, tacos, etc., en vista de tener mejores ingresos con la venta de comida rápida cerro la tienda.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar pan, tortillas, carnes, embutidos, tomates, aceite, etc., para elaborar hamburguesas, tacos, etc., tendrá lo necesario para fortalecer su nuevo negocio y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dora used her previous loan to stock her store with basic need items. With this she achieved economic stability and started in a new area which is the sale of hot dogs, hamburgers, tacos, etc. In light of having a better income with the sale of fast food, she closed the store.
She needs a new loan to buy bread, tortillas, meat, cold cuts, tomatoes, oil, etc. to make hamburgers, tacos, etc. She will have what she needs to strengthen her new business and to give good service to her clients.

loans.use: to buy bread, tortillas, meat, cold cuts, tomatoes, oil, etc., to make hamburgers, tacos, etc., to have what she needs to strengthen her new business.

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miriam, es una mujer de cincuenta años de edad, muy carismática y entusiasta, ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y calzado. En el cual, trabaja duro día a día, para hacerlo cada vez mas prospero.  Poco a poco con las ganancias obtenidas ha logrado construir su casa.
Miriam confia fielmente en ambas organizaciones, es por esta razon que ha solicitado un préstamo que le permita comprar ropa y calzado para mujeres y hombres, dado que se aproximan las fiestas de navidad, los clientes comienzan a consumir mucho estos productos. En un futuro espera poder hacer su negocio una tienda con una bonita infraestructura y donde ofrezca artículos de marca.
texts.en:
Miriam is a woman of fifty years of age, very charismatic and enthusiastic. She has a business selling clothing and footwear in which she works hard every day to make it more and more prosperous. Little by little with the profits obtained she has succeeded in building her house.

Miriam faithfully trusts in the two organizations, it is for this reason that she has applied for a loan that will permit her to buy clothes and shoes for women and men. Since the Christmas holidays are approaching, customers are starting to buy a lot of these products. In the future she hopes to make her business a store with a nice infrastructure and where she can offer items of excellent quality.

loans.use: buy clothes and shoes for women and men.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es: La Sra. Ayda y su esposo Freddy, viven en Cochabamba provincia Tiraque; tienen 35 y 31 años de edad respectivamente, casados por más de 6 años, con un nivel de instrucción de nivel primario, económicamente son independientes, ambos se dedican a la actividad de agricultura siembran papa y haba en vaina verde en una superficie de 2 hectáreas de terreno propio. para la venta de sus productos cuenta con un mercado consolidado en la feria semanal de Colomi como también de Tiraque, Los solicitantes requieren un préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico, compra semilla de papa, ya que sus ahorros lo invirtieron en la compra de un lote de terreno.                                                                                                                                                                       Por último, Doña Ayda y su esposo se sintieron contentos al tener la oportunidad de acceder al préstamo, además de poder porque con la compra de abono orgánico, semilla poder tener mejores ingresos e incrementará su patrimonio familiar y de esa manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia hacia futuro.
texts.en:
Ayda and her husband Freddy live in Cochabamba, province of Tiraque. They are 35 and 31 years old respectively. They have been married for more than 6 years. They have a primary level of education. They are economically independent, and they both work in the occupation of agriculture. They farm potatoes and broad beans in 2 hectares area of land that they own. For the sale of their products they have an established market at the weekly fair in Colomi, as well as Tiraque. The members need a loan for the purchase of organic manure and to buy potato seeds, as they invested their savings in the purchase of a plot of land.
Lastly, Ayda and her husband feel happy at having the opportunity of accessing the loan, because with the purchase of organic manure and potato seeds, they will have a better income and their family patrimony will increase. In this way they will be able to improve their living standards in benefit of their family into the future.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and potato seeds, to increase her production and improve her quality of life with the income that is generated through her product sales.

loans.name: Harivola

texts.fr:
36 ans, Harivola est mariée et mère de deux enfants de 7 et 3 ans. L'ainé seulement est scolarisé actuellement. 
La fabrication de brique est l'activité, source de revenu, secondaire de Harivola car c'est une activité saisonnière. Son activité principale est le magasin général. Le prêt va financer la fabrication de briques. C'est une femme débrouillarde et travailleuse. Elle est diplômée (licence en communication), elle travaillait dans une entreprise mais pour mieux s'occuper de ses enfants, elle décidait de changer d'activité, en plus la fabrication des briques est une activité de ses parents.
Actuellement, la famille habite encore dans une maison appartenant à ses parents, et elle voudrait son indépendance et envisage de construire la sienne.
texts.en:
36 years old, Harivola is married and the mother of two children - aged seven and three. Currently only the elder one attends school. Brick manufacture is Harivola's secondary income generating activity, because it is seasonal. Her main business is a general store.
The loan will finance brick making. She is a resourceful and hard working woman. She has a degree (in communication); she used to work in a business, but in order to be able to better look after her children she decided to change tack, and in any case her parents are also brick makers.
At the moment the family still lives in a house belonging to her parents, and she would like her independence so plans to build her own.

loans.use: to buy a lorry of bales and to pay the workers' salaries.

loans.name: Prorm's Group

texts.en:
Prorm is 32 years old and married. She is blessed with two dependent children, one of whom is in school while the other one is under the age of school. She resides in Battambang province, where she supports her family’s living by raising pigs and growing rice. She also works for others for a fee to supplement their income. Prorm has been involved in the farming business for ten years. Earning around USD 11 per day, she can save around USD 6 each day for future needs. Pigs getting ill, which costs her a lot to cure, is the main challenge to her pig-raising business.


Prorm is leading a group whose members applied for loans from VisionFund. This is the second loan cycle for her. Her past loan has helped her improve the living conditions for her family. She will use this new loan to buy feed to nourish pigs. She hopes to increase more income so that she can expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy feed to nourish pigs so that she can send her children to school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two lorryloads of bales and to pay the two workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a group of pregnant sows.

loans.name: Fara Nirina Vololona

texts.fr:
44 ans, Fara est mariée et le couple a cinq enfants dont trois déjà mariés et deux encore à leur charge, scolarisés dans des écoles publiques.
Le principal activité de l'époux est qu'il est aide chauffeur et celle de Fara est le commerce des poissons frais d'eau douce. Le couple exploite aussi un élevage de porc et pendant l'hiver et le printemps, la fabrication des briques est une activité en vogue. Mais le problème est l'insuffisance de fonds à utiliser. C'est une activité dont les recettes serviront à un grand investissement: cette fois la priorité c'est la réhabilitation de la maison d'habitation et l'amélioration de l'élevage.
texts.en:
Fara is 44 years old and married. The couple have five children, three of whom are already married - the other two are still living at home, attending public school. The husband's main activity is as a driver's assistant, and Fara principally sells freshwater fish. Together they also run a piggery, and during the winter and spring, brick making is currently very popular.
The problem is a lack of funding to use. It is a business whose income will be used for a major investment - this time the priority is the repairing of the family home, and improvement of the farm.

loans.use: to buy a van load of bales and to pay a worker.

loans.name: Tacko's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis Mai 2010,rassemble des membres qui habitent le même quartier et ont comme activité l'agriculture et l'élevage.

Louise qui se trouve à droite de la photo,levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 56 ans,est mariée et mére de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons.

Son activité est l'élevage,elle achéte des brebis qu'elle va engraisser pendant au moins 06 à 8 mois avant de les revendre.

Ainsi avec le crédit,elle va acheter 04 moutons au prix unitaire de 50000f.

le bénéfice sera utilisé comme épargne.
texts.en:
This group, created in May 2010, groups members living in the same area who are farmers and livestock rearers.
Louise - on the right in the photo with her arm raised - is the group's representative. She is 56 years old, married and the mother of four children, two of whom are boys.
Her business is rearing livestock - she buys sheep which she fattens for at least six to eight months before reselling them.
With this loan she will buy four sheep, for 50,000f each. The profit will go into her savings.

loans.use: to buy four sheep.

loans.name: Charies

texts.en:
Charies is 26 years old, married with two children.

Charies works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Charies has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Charies aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 62 years old, married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Denia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Denia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more sea foods to sell.

Denia has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Denia would like to save enough money to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a farming rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming rice business.

Editha has been in this business for 9 years. Editha earns more income from selling vegetable.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.ru: Матьлюба, 61 год, вдова, мать 3 детей. У Матьлюбы среднее образование, она в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Матьлюбы на сегодняшний день имеется 2,0 Га земли, где она выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку скота и обработку почвы. Матьлюба планирует увеличить доходы от бизнеса и направить прибыль на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Matlyuba is 61 years old, widow, a mother of three. She has completed secondary education and she is involved in agriculture for a living. Thanks to her hard work, she now owns 2.0 ha land lot where she cultivates potatoes. Her monthly income is about 10,000 som (KGS) which is not enough for a decent standard of living. Matlyuba turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock and fertilize the soil. She is going to increase her business's income and reinvest it in house renovations.

loans.use: to cultivate her land and to buy some livestock in order to bolster her income

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en: Sovann’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sovann makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en: Enkhbold, 35 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been driving his minivan for transportation since 2005. His wife stays at home, looking after their one-year-old daughter. Their elder daughter goes to high school and at the same time helps her father in his business. He is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to buy land in order to build a house next summer. By doing so his family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutant into air.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: San Juan Cote Group

texts.es:
Dentro del Estado de México hay una comunidad con origen mazahua en la cual algunas personas aún conservan su lengua materna y muchas tradiciones llegadas después del encuentro con Europa como la celebración de su santo patrono: San Juan. Una noche antes de dicho festejo realizan la “quema de castillos”  hechos con fuegos artificiales, al día siguiente demuestran su devoción por medio de danzas típicas de la región y bailes abiertos a todo el público. 
   Doña Cecilia es una persona muy trabajadora quien tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante con su gran espíritu emprendedor que contagia al resto de los integrantes de su grupo.  Ella y el grupo son originarios de la comunidad antes descrita y están dispuestos a trabajar arduamente por enriquecer sus negocios.
   Ceci, como le dicen de cariño, se encuentra muy agradecida con el préstamo adquirido porque pudo iniciar con la de aves de corral. Recuerda que una vecina le hablo de los servicios de VF México e inmediatamente se aprestó para comenzar con su actividad, actualmente lleva tres años con ella. Ha llegado a criar hasta setenta ejemplares de diversos tamaños, "por un pollo puedo llegar a obtener 130 pesos eso es realmente bueno, pero si llego a vender 10 pollos reúno las ganancias necesarias que me ayudan a solventar los gastos de la educación de mis hijos; eso es lo más importante" comentó. Cuenta con un gallinero sin embargo piensa trabajar arduamente para que, con sus ganancias, pueda construir un gallinero más. Además de las ventas de pollo también aprovecha los huevos que producen y los vende con sus vecinos quienes prefieren el producto fresco.
   Gracias a su experiencia ha logrado vencer los posibles inconvenientes que representa la cría del cualquier animal como las enfermedades. Su sueño más grande es poder terminar de construir su casa y, desde luego, que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera profesional.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Abigayl, Angela, Hortensia, Ana Bibiana y Gregoria quienes planean invertir en ovejas mientras que Ma. Felipa, en su tiendita de abarrotes.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio, Ceci es quien viste el suéter color verde.
texts.en:
In the state of Mexico there is a community of Mazahua origen where some people still speak their native tongue and maintain many traditions that arrived after the European encounter such as the celebration of the patron saint: Saint John.  The night before the festivities there are bonfires and fireworks.  The following day typical dances from the region and public celebrations are held to show the people's devotion.

Cecilia is a very hard worker who is determined to get ahead with an enterprising spirit that encourages the rest of the members of the group.  She and the others are from the community mentioned above and they are willing to work hard to grow their businesses.

Ceci, as she is called affectionately, is very grateful for the loan because she was able to start her chicken business.  She remembers a neighbor talking to her about the services of VF Mexico and she immediately signed up and started the activity she has been involved in now for three years.  She has raised as many as 70 chickens of diverse sizes.  "For a chicken I can earn 130 pesos which is really good, but if I can sell ten chickens I can earn enough to cover my children's education costs, which is important," she says.  She has a chicken coop but hopes to work hard to build another one.  Apart from selling chickens she also sells the eggs they produce to neighbors who prefer fresh products.

Thanks to her experience she has been able to overcome inconveniences that may arise such as animal disease.  Her dream is to build a house and see her children finish their professional training.

The other members of the group are Abigayl, Angela, Hortensia, Ana Bibiana and Gregoria who plan to invest in sheep while Maria Felipa will open a grocery store.

*The photo was taken at the municipal garden.  Ceci is the one wearing a green sweater.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and feed.

location.town: San Juan Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Angelina works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. Angelina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials needed for her pottery business.

Angelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Janet works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish. Janet is borrowing PHP 11500 through NWTF to  purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell for her buy and sell dried fish business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 46 years old,  with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a restaurant in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, egg, etc.

Maria Elena has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the restaurant for 1 year and also earns an income from general store.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of six children, Ana works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Ana is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида, 49 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У Фариды среднее образование. Она занимается сельским хозяйством. У Фариды есть дойная корова и 3 овцы, также на 0,25 ГА собственной земельной доли, Фарида выращивает картофель, кукурузу и лук. Дополнительно она занимается заготовкой хурмы и яблок для реализации и торгует зеленью и фруктами на рынке. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Фариды составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS). Фарида обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля и удобрений с целью выращивания органической продукции, также на приобретение овец. Доходы от ведения бизнеса Фарида планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее дела.
texts.en:
Farida is 49 years old, married, with three kids. She has completed secondary education. She is making her living from agriculture. Farida owns a dairy cow, three sheep, and a land lot of 0.25 ha. Farida cultivates potatoes, corn and onion. She also grows persimmon, apples, and potherb for sale on the local market. Her monthly income is about 9,000 som (KGS). 

Farida requested a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) from Bai Tushum Bank to buy seeds of potato and fertilizers for land and organic product cultivation, as well as to purchase several sheep. She is going to reinvest the income gained from the loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds of potato and fertilizers for land and organic product cultivation, as well as for purchasing several sheep

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 53 years old, married with seven children. Two of whom are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Fely has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Fely requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to resell.

Fely has been in this business for four years. In the future, Fely would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to resell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lorna is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to  purchase additional fishing net  for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Malis's Group

texts.en: Malis’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Malis makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Narhanym

texts.ru: Нарханым, 54 года, замужем, есть дочь. У нее среднее образование, работает уборщицей в сельской управе, получая 2,000 сом (KGS). В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день есть одна дойная корова с теленком. Ежемесячная прибыль 4,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нарханым обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота на зиму. Кредитные средства помогут Нарханым инвестировать в бизнес, сохранив поголовье скота. Доходы от кредита Нарханым планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее дела и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Narhanym is 54 years old, married, with a daughter. She has completed secondary education, now working as a janitor in the village council earning 2,000 som (KGS) per month. To have an additional income, she is involved in agriculture. She now owns one dairy cow and a calf. Her monthly income is 4,800 som (KGS). To further develop her agricultural business, she turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy feed for livestock for the winter. The borrowed money will help Narhanym make an investment in her business maintaining the current livestock headcount. The gained income will be reinvested to further develop the business and renovate the house.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock in order to invest in her business and maintain the livestock headcount

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 57 years old, married and has three children.

Nancy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nancy has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed 0 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sokaem's Group

texts.en: Sokaem’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokaem makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jose Federico

texts.es: José de 65 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañera de vida y de sus 2 hijos una hija de 28 años y un hijo de 20 años de edad a los que ha logrado sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo. José para mantener la economía del hogar se dedica a administrar un pequeño negocio que tiene de venta de artículos varios para el hogar. Cada día se dirige al mercado, en donde realiza las ventas de sus productos, ya que es muy reconocido por las personas que caminan por el lugar, además mantiene un pequeño negocio en su vivienda de papelería que administra su compañera de vida. José con el deseo de mejorar su calidad de vida, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, lámina galvanizada  y grava para encementar el piso y cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía el piso de su vivienda es de tierra.
texts.en:
Jose, 65, lives with his life partner and their two children, a daughter, 28, and a son, 20, who they have raised through much effort.  Jose supports the household economy by running a small business selling household products.

Every day he goes to the market to sell his goods since he is very well known by the local people.  He also has a small stationery business set up at home which is run by his partner.

In order to improve his quality of life, Jose is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand, corrugated metal and gravel to install a concrete floor and change the roof of his house.  As seen in the photo the house currently has a dirt floor.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, corrugated metal and gravel to put down a concrete floor and change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Together with her husband Gina raised their three children for more than five years through buying and selling “Taho”, (a Philippine street food sold by peddlers known as “magtataho”. It is a soft gelatin-like snack made from processed soybeans topped with caramel and tapioca pearls (locally called sago). She buys and then sells it to the community of Baybay, Leyte. In the future, she wishes to make her own “Taho” for sell. As of now, she is asking for a loan to buy “Taho” for selling to enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy "taho"

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.en: Cecilio lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental and supports his family through his farming activities. He wants to support his children by building houses from the ground up. He applied for a loan to buy building material and paints, and to pay his workers. He wants his children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work he has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material and paint and pay his workers.

loans.name: Vima

texts.en:
Vima is 50 years old and married with five children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Vima is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Vima has been in this business for 25 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is 55 years old, married with eight children. Three of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ana Mae has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ana Mae requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Ana Mae has been in this business for six years. In the future, Ana Mae would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Cecile has been in this business for 3 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 56 years old and married with four children. Veronica works very hard to provide for them.

Veronica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care.

Veronica has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Veronica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods, shampoo, soap and other personal care

loans.name: Margarita Cristina

texts.es:
Margarita, es casada, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, su pareja trabaja como agente de seguridad y ella es propietaria de una tienda en la que ofrece a sus clientes artículos de primera necesidad, ambos se apoyan para cubrir los gastos familiares, Margarita inicio su negocio por cuenta propia, lo atiende sola y sus hijos le ayudan en su tiempo libre.
Para mejorar la competitividad de su negocio solicita un crédito con el que comprara granos básicos, cereales, detergentes, azúcar, sal, bebidas, etc., ofrecerá a sus clientes nueva mercadería, el propósito es tener mejores ventas e ingresos.
Sus sueños son fortalecer más su negocio y cubrir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Margarita is married and lives with her husband and two children.  Her husband works as a security agent and she owns a store where she sells essential items to customers.  They support each other in covering the household expenses.  Margarita started the business on her own and works alone.  Her children help out in their free time.

To improve the competitiveness of her business, Margarita is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, cereals, detergents, sugar, salt, beverages, etc. to offer new merchandise to her customers.  She aims to improve sales and income.

Her dream is to strengthen her business even more to the cover household needs.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, cereals, detergents, sugar, salt, beverages, etc. to stock new merchandise for her customers.

loans.name: Yorng's Group

texts.en: Yorng’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yorng makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda has been running her business for many years. She grows and harvests vegetables, work that she has done since she was married. She gets up early and has to go to the fields where she oversees her crops.She earns a lot from this activity and was able to pay her previous loan. Luzviminda is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer, since her garden needs improvement. In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to give her children the education she did not have. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to improve her vegetable garden

loans.name: José María

texts.es:
José, de 34 años de edad, está acompañado y su pareja se encarga de las actividades domésticas en su lugar de habitación, los dos se apoyan en las decisiones tomadas para su bienestar, se caracterizan con la gente como una pareja amigable y con mucho deseos de superación y aún no tienen hijos.

José, se dedica a hacer viajes en su vehículo desde hace 3 años, es muy conocido por mucha gente por la actividad que realiza, él trasporta pasajeros de su municipio a otros municipios y de esa manera obtiene ingresos y beneficia a muchas personas que solicitan sus servicios. 
 
El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para reparar su vehículo, ya que por el arduo trabajo se ha deteriorado y le ha afectado su trabajo. 

José, sueña con obtener un mejor equipo de trabajo para la comodidad de todos sus clientes y de igual manera obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose, 34, lives with his partner who is a homemaker.  They support each other and share in the decisions made about their well-being.  They are known as a friendly couple who want to get ahead and do not have children yet.

For three years Jose has been working in passenger transportation.  He is well known by many people for his work.  By transporting people from one municipality to another he earns a living and benefits many people who require his services.

The loan money will be used to repair his vehicle since the hard work has deteriorated it and affected his work.

Jose dreams of having a better vehicle for the comfort of his customers and to earn more income.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Proyecto Productivo El Mirador Group

texts.es:
Proyecto Productivo es el nombre que le dieron los integrantes del grupo que planea obtener los beneficios con VF México. El nombre hace referencia a la meta que tienen trazada para hacer crecer sus actividades.  La mayoría planea crear un restaurante en donde gente local y foránea pueda degustar su especialidad que son los peces trucha.
   Antonia es una integrante que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a quien lo necesite, ella se encarga de comprar todos los insumos requeridos en la preparación del pez trucha. De igual forma se encarga tanto de mantener limpias las instalaciones como de cobrar y llevar toda la contabilidad, sonriente comento “me gusta mucho cocinar pero la verdad  lo mío, lo mío, es cobrar”. 
   Por otra parte, Norma comenta “para mí es un placer trabajar al lado de mi papá y mis hermanas” ya que el negocio de cría y venta de pescado es una actividad familiar iniciada por su padre Esteban. Ella  planea comprar más animales con el objetivo de aumentar las ganancias obtenidas.
   De esta forma, gradualmente el negocio de Don Esteban está mejorando y ahora ya cuenta con seis estanques criaderos pero su meta es poder construir uno más. “Afortunadamente tenemos mucho trabajo y las personas se han interesado demasiado en la comida” comento entusiasmado. Otra de sus metas es construir cisternas amplias para tener suficiente agua una vez que termine la temporada de lluvias.
   Para dar una idea del éxito que han conseguido con su negocio se puede notar que venden 400 kilos de pescado al mes que no es poco si contamos que iniciaron sin la ayuda de nadie. No obstante,  en sus planes está el incrementar su producción a 800 kilos de producto por mes. Cabe destacar que todas las personas que participan en este proyecto perciben un ingreso para solventar los gastos de su hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida y las de sus familias inmediatas. Los otros integrantes del grupo son Don Ismael y Emelia quienes invertirán en ovejas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en los arcos del centro del municipio, Don Esteban es quien viste la chamarra gris mientras Norma viste chamarra café.
texts.en:
Proyecto Productivo is the name of a group whose members plan to benefit through VF Mexico.  The name makes reference to the goal they have set to grow their businesses.  Most of the members plan to set up a restaurant where locals and visitors can taste the delicious trout that is their specialty.

Antonia is a member who always has been willing to help anyone in need.  She handles the purchasing of the supplies needed to prepare the trout.  She also handles the cleaning of the facilities and the accounting.  She says "I love to cook but it is not my thing.  My job is the accounting".

Then there is Norma who says "It is a pleasure for me to work alongside my father and sisters" since the business of raising and selling fish is a family business that was started by her father, Esteban.  She plans to buy more animals to increase their earnings.

This is how Esteban's business will grow gradually and improve.  Now it has six hatcheries but the goal is to build more.  "Fortunately, we have a lot of work and people are interested in this food", he says enthusiastically.  Another goal is to build tanks to have enough water when the rainy season ends.

To give an idea of the success achieved through the business, around 400 kilos of fish are sold every month, which is not a small amount considering that they started without anyone's help.  However, there are plans to increase production to 800 kilos a month.  All the people participating in the project earn an income to cover household expenses and improve their lifestyles and those of their immediate families.  The other members of the group are Ismael and Emelia who will invest in sheep.

*The photo was taken under the arches of the municipal center.  Esteban is the one in a gray jacket and Normal is in a brown jacket.

loans.use: To buy trout and feed.

location.town: Yondece del Cedro, San Jose del Rincon.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en: Pha’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.  Pha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is into farming to support her family. She and her family live in Kananga, a town in Leyte. She and her husband help each other in tilling the land, hoping for a good harvest. This has been their source of income for 15 years now. She applied for a loan knowing that this could help them. The money that they will get will be used to acquire fertilizer. They are anticipating a better yield from their crops by having the means now to buy the needed farming maintenance. Any income derived from this business will be spent on her family’s daily consumption and school fees for her children ages 10 and 14.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ninda

texts.en:
Ninda is 45 years old and married with four children, one child still in school, Ninda works very hard to provide for them.

Ninda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

Ninda has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Ninda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, and eggs.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en: Hillary is a 30-year-old married man with three children and among them, only two are attending school. He is living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer dealing in selling cows to butchers and he too owns a butchery plus he grows vegetables that add extra income for him. He started these businesses with the hope of earning an income. He is faced with the challenges of inadequate capital that limits him when he wants to buy many cows to sell. However, he is looking forward to constructing a big house for his family. Hillary needs a loan to buy cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María percibe más ingresos y atiende a nuevos clientes por el buen servicio y calidad de su trabajo, esto es posible por haber invertido el crédito anterior en la sastrería y saberlo administrar, la familia se mantiene y ella se mantiene trabajando para tener oportunidad de mejorar su equipo de trabajo en el futuro.
Tiene muchos encargos de prendas de vestir, ella solicita más capital para poder comprar botones, telas, hilos, blondas, etc., surtirá el inventario para cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes, espera continuar su buen desarrollo.
texts.en:
María receives more income and serves new customers due to the good service and quality of her work. This is possible because she made an investment of the previous loan in her tailoring and knows how to manage it. Her family is supported and she keeps working to have the opportunity of improving their future.

She has many orders for clothing. She is requesting more capital so that she can purchase buttons, fabric, thread, lace, etc. to stock her inventory and meet the demands of her customers. She wants to continue her successful growth.

loans.use: to buy buttons, fabric, thread, lace, etc. so that she will have the inventory to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Pedro Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador, de 23 años de edad, es un hombre  muy luchador, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tienen un hijo de 3 años de edad.

Salvador,  es comerciante muy conocido en el pueblo, porque tiene más de 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de accesorios para el hogar y aparatos de primera necesidad como linternas y radio caseteras.

Salvador, necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio, porque pronto se acercan las fiestas patronales  de su pueblo y necesita capital para invertir en su negocio.

Sus sueños son, poder  hacer crecer  su negocio  y  tener  un  local  propio, porque  actualmente se  desplaza por  los  puntos más céntricos  del pueblo para  poder  vender sus artículos.
texts.en:
Salvador is 23 years old and is a very determined man. He studied until the ninth grade, is married, and his spouse is engaged in household responsibilities. They have a son of 3 years old.

Salvador is a very well known merchant in the area, because he has more than 5 years working in the sale of accessories for the home and necessary appliances such as flashlights and cassette radios.

Salvador needs a loan to purchase merchandise for his business, because the holidays are coming soon and he needs capital to invest in his business.

His dreams are to grow his business and have his own location, because currently he walks through the most central parts of the village to sell his items.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his business such as flashlights, key chains, radios, etc

loans.name: Plaza De Gallos Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy tranquila del Estado de México viven los integrantes del grupo Plaza de Gallos. La región está rodeada de mucha vegetación, y los campos donde se lleva a cabo el cultivo de maíz muestran la riqueza de su tierra. 
   Viviana es una mujer muy alegre y entusiasta, como cualquier madre está dispuesta a trabajar arduamente para cuidar de sus dos hijas, y ella más que tiene que ser madre y padre a la vez. Vivi, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica desde hace varios años a la cría de aves de corral y para ello los compra desde muy pequeños y una vez que alcanzan su desarrollo ideal los vende en su misma comunidad. De igual forma aprovecha el producto para su uso personal sobre todo los huevos que ponen las gallinas diariamente. Actualmente cuenta con 55 ejemplares los cuales cuida sin ningún inconveniente; “los mantengo siempre encerrados para que no dañen el cultivo de maíz de los vecinos o se pierdan, así crecen con mayor facilidad” comentó muy contenta. Cuando comenzó con la actividad no tenía ningún gallinero, mas con el trabajo arduo logró comprar material para construir el que ahora considera la fuente de sus ganancias. 
   Por otro lado, está muy agradecida con el apoyo de VF México porque con él podrá comprar más ejemplares pequeños. También comprará alimento para sus animalitos, y prevendrá con vacunas contra enfermedades comunes.  Una de las metas de Vivi es mejorar la producción en su negocio para que pueda obtener mejores ganancias; con esto podrá construir una casa de concreto ya que actualmente vive en una de madera. No obstante la principal motivación es brindar estudios a sus hijas que confían en ella. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Andrés, Isabel y Angélica quienes invertirán en la compra de ovejas; Francisco, en cerdos; Saraí, en pollos y pavos y Verónica, en ovejas y pavos.
*La fotografía fue tomada enfrente de los arcos del municipio, Vivi es quien viste el suéter color verde.
texts.en:
The members of the group Plaza de Gallos live in a tranquil community in Mexico State. The region is surrounded by vegetation and the fields that produce the crops of corn demonstrate how rich the land is.

Viviana is a lively and enthusiastic woman who, just like any mother, works hard to take care of her two daughters, but she has to fill the roles of both mother and father at the same time.

Vivi, as her friends call her, has worked for several years in raising poultry. She buys the birds when they are very small and once they have reached their ideal developmental stage, she sells them in her community. She also uses the product herself, especially the eggs that the hens produce daily. She currently has 55 specimens, which she cares for without any problems. "I always keep them locked up so they don't damage my neighbor's corn crops or get lost. It's easier to raise them this way," she tells us with satisfaction. When she began working in this trade, she didn't have a hen house, but with hard work she was able to buy the material to build the one that she now considers the source of her income.

She is very grateful for the support of VF Mexico because she will be able to buy more small specimens. She will also buy food for her animals and have them vaccinated against common illnesses. One of Vivi's goals is to improve production in her business so she'll be able to earn a higher income. With this she will be able to build a house out of concrete; she is currently living in a house made of wood. However, her main goal is to provide an education for her daughters, who rely on her.

The other members of the group, Andrés, Isabel, and Angélica, will use the loan to buy sheep. Francisco will buy pigs, Saraí will buy chickens and turkeys, and Verónica will buy sheep and turkeys.

*The picture was taken in front of the arches of the city. Vivi is the one wearing the green sweater.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 74 years old and a widow with adult children, who are now professionals.

She is known in Ospital, Aloran, for her farming activities. Her business is supported by Paglaum MPC where she maintains her membership in good standing.

Recently she has asked for a loan from the Coop to pay for her medical check-up and to purchase maintenance medication. She is glad that she is supported for her financial needs, whether it is for her business or personal needs.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up and to purchase maintenance medication.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She takes pleasure in doing her gardening activities and in earning aswell for her family.

As a microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

In the future, Shirley wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Mazera

texts.en:
Mazera is a 29-year-old motorcycle transporter in Kilifi, Kenya. He is a father of two who has been in this business for the last four years, and he is doing well.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to service his motorcycle, and the anticipated profit to educate his children.

He hopes to own several motorcycles in the future.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Donna Fete

texts.en:
Donna Fete operates a motor transport business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

In order to continue her business, she has taken out a loan to pay for motor spare parts and repairs.

She dreams of owning more motor units and of being able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for motor spare parts and repairs.

loans.name: Medine

texts.en:
Medine is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Medine is 40 years old and three of her children are still in school.

Medine has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more meat and chicken meat to sell in her food stall.

Medine has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more meat and chicken meat to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling beauty products in the Philippines and earns additional income from clothing retail. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more beauty products to sell to her customers.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Josephine operates a vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.



With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Cherry has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner.

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feed, animal vitamins, fertilizers and other farming supplies for her chosen business. Cherry wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds, animal vitamins, fertilizers and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia is a mother of two adult-age children and has worked as a motor operator with her husband as one of the drivers for the past nine years. Her business involves a motor for hire or public transport. She does this work to support her children. She asked for a loan to purchase another motor unit. Owning another one will increase her income and she will be able to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase another motor unit.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 59 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers

loans.name: Claudia Beatriz

texts.es: Claudia es una mujer tenaz que hace 5 años logro obtener su vivienda, la cual compro con mucho esfuerzo, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con un lugar en el cual descansar después de sus días de trabajo. Claudia se dedica a prestar sus servicios de seguridad en el municipio aledaño, actividad que lleva realizando 5 años, por lo que es reconocida en toda la zona. La vivienda de Claudia colinda en la parte de atrás con la calle principal de la comunidad, por lo que en época de lluvia el agua se filtra a su vivienda que queda un nivel más abajo, por lo que al no contar con la liquide económica necesaria solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro de contención atrás de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Claudia is a tenacious woman who five years ago managed to obtain her home which she bought with lots of effort, reason why she feels happy to have a place in which to rest after her working days. Claudia makes a living providing her security services in the neighboring municipality, an occupation that she has been doing for five years now and by which she is known throughout the area.

Claudia's home adjoins on the back the main street of the community, reason why in the rainy season the water seeps into her home which is one level down. Since she doesn't have the necessary economic liquidity, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a retaining wall behind her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a retaining wall behind her home.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday, she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 68 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Melita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

Melita has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Melita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, and eggs.

loans.name: Kyeicumu Twekambe Group

texts.en: Mary, age 42, is a resident of Kagadi, Uganda who trades in pancakes, operating in mobile markets and supplements her income with farming. Mary is a single mother of seven and very hardworking. She started her business in 2005 in order to earn a living. However, she is faced with a problem of little working capital; she is, therefore, going to use the loan to increase her working capital. In the future, she plans to start a retail shop and educate her children. She is a member of Kyeicumu Twekambe group where members have to guarantee one another in order to access a loan as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy cassava for making pancakes.

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
Chhoem is 36 years old and a married mother of five dependent children, two of whom are in school. The others are too young for schooling.

She and her husband are farmers, growing rice in Battambang province. To make more income, Chhoem sells grocery items and works for others for a fee. They have been involved in the farming business for ten years. Lack of working capital is the main challenge to their rice-growing business.

She decided to request a loan from VisionFund and this is the first-cycle loan for her. She will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and rice seeds and to pay for plowing fees. The part of the loan that remains will be used to renovate her house.

She wants to increase her income to keep sending her children to school and renovate her house to be in good condition.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer to boost crop yields so as to keep sending her children to school and renovate her house.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a government employee at Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 60 years old, married, and has three adult children. She is an active member of Paglaum MPC and nurtures her membership without records of default payments.

Recently, she took a loan to pay for a medical check up.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check up.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 55 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Merlina has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from raising chickens.

Merlina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Muhammad Shafique

texts.en:
Shafique belongs to Karachi. He is 43, married and the father of three daughters. He is a decent person and respected by all in his community. He is educating all his daughters.

He has owned a storage drum-selling business for the past 16 years and has gained valuable experience. He has managed to grow and develop his business well over the years and plans to increase it.

His business has been expanding over time and he now wants to buy a godown or warehouse for storing the drums so that he has enough space and is prepared for an increase in demand for storage drums.

He dreams to give his daughters a higher education and make them valuable citizen of the society. He is happy to have a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a godown (warehouse) for storing storage drums for reselling.

loans.name: Sona Group

texts.en:
Sona is 30 years old, a married man with no child, and he resides in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. He has been involved in animal husbandry for more than three years, has extensive experience, and is successful in his career. He is involved in feeding pigs and poultry. His wife is a 33-year-old rice farmer and animal raiser as well. Sona and his wife can earn approximately USD 3 per day.

Sona is pictured first from the right. He is a group leader, and he would like to request a loan for his group members. He will use his portion to buy pig feed for his pigs. This loan will help him have enough funds to buy pig feed and improve his family’s finances from selling those pigs.

In the future, he is going to buy more pigs and cows and save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for his pigs.

loans.name: La Parada De Los Lobos Group

texts.es:
Esta comunidad mexiquense es caracterizada por el extenso cultivo de papas, no es raro que personas de otras comunidades conozcan que la región es rica en nutrientes.
