Gracias al tipo de suelo los cultivos y la vegetación en general gozan de una belleza y frondosidad únicas. Cabe destacar que la comunidad tiene orígenes en la cultura mazahua y sus habitantes son portadores de la lengua que se ha hablado en este suelo durante muchos siglos por lo que es importante que ésta se transmita de generación en generación. 
   Adrián vive en dicha comunidad y es parte de un grupo llamado La Parada de los Lobos, es una persona muy amable y siempre está sonriendo. Su objetivo es muy claro: tener una actividad que le permita brindar la mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y su pequeña hija quien aún no asiste a la escuela. De esta manera se dedica a trabajar en el campo la mayoría del tiempo pues, también, en ciertas ocasiones es contratado para trabajar en la construcción. Mientras tanto, Matilde, su esposa, es criadora de distintos animales; para lo cual adquiere desde pequeños hasta su entero desarrollo. Uno de principales objetivos es hacer crecer su negocio y que los animales tengan un crecimiento óptimo para que así tengan crías sanas.
Para mejorar estas actividades planean utilizar la oportunidad del préstamo para comprar 10 ovejas que podrá alimentar gracias a la extensión de hierba que crece en los campos de su comunidad. 
   Asimismo ayudará a su comunidad ya que los ejemplares serán comprados con personas autóctonas. “Ya tengo el corral que está destinado para mis borregos, yo sé que estarán muy cómodos y así crecerán sin ninguna dificultad” comentó Adrián quien está muy contento porque sin el crédito nunca hubiera podido reunir los fondos para mejorar su negocio.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Cristina quien invertirá el préstamo en una tienda de abarrotes; Damián, en su taxi y Maurilio, en ovejas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del centro del municipio, Adrián es quien viste la playera blanca y gorra roja.
texts.en:
This Mexican community is characterized by the extensive cultivation of potatoes. It is not unusual for people in other communities to know that the region is rich in nutrients. Thanks to the type of soil, the crops and vegetation in general enjoy a special beauty and leafiness. It is worth noting that the community has origins in the Mazahua culture and its inhabitants are carriers of the language that has been spoken in this area for many centuries so that it is important that it is transmitted from generation to generation.

Adrián lives in this community and is part of a group called La Parada de los Lobos. He is a very friendly person and is always smiling. His goal is very clear: to have a job that allows him to offer the best quality of life to his wife and young daughter who doesn't go to school yet. In this way, he works in the fields the majority of the time and, also, sometimes is contracted to work in construction. Meanwhile, Matilde, his wife, raises different animals, which she gets when they are very young and has them for their whole development. One of the principal objectives is to grow her business and that the animals have an optimal growth so that they, in this way, have healthy babies.

To improve these businesses, they plan to use the opportunity of the loan to purchase 10 sheep that the will be able to feed thanks to the extensive grass that grows in the community's fields.

It will also help the community since the animals will be purchased from indigenous people. "I already have the corral that will be used for my sheep, I know that they will be very comfortable and, so, will grow without problems," said Adrián, who is very happy because without the loan, he never would have been able to get the funds to improve his business.

The other members of the group are Cristina, who will invest the loan in a grocery store; Damián, in his taxi; and Maurilio in sheep.

*The photo was taken on the stairs in the center of the municipality. Adrián is the one wearing a white t-shirt and a red hat.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

location.town: SAN JOAQUIN LAMILLAS, SAN JOSE DEL RINCON

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is engaged in running a grocery store. She has been operating her business for five years and earns a monthly net income of 3,200 PHP.

Rowena is 38 years old, married and has one school-aged child. She is from the village of Dipolog City.

In 2010, Rowena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid previous loans, most recently a loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes.

Rowena is requesting her eighth loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her existing business. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Adriana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Adriana, es una mujer de cincuenta y siete años de edad, de carácter jovial y sonrisa sincera, es madre de ocho hijos, los cuales junto a su esposo ha logrado sacar adelante, hace un tiempo decidió emprender desde su hogar la venta de comida y batidos naturales. Gracias a un primer préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, ella logro fortalecer su negocio y producir más. 
Ha regresado a tocar las puertas de Kiva y MiCrédito, porque sabe que ambas organizaciones brindan grandes oportunidades para crecer como comerciante, ella ha solitado esta vez un financiamiento que le permita comprar frutas, verduras, saborizantes, azúcar, miel, arroz, frijoles, entre otros. En un futuro desea poder convertir su negocio en un restaurante.
texts.en:
Adriana is a 57 year old woman with a jovial character and sincere smile. She is mother to eight children who has managed to progress along with her husband. Some time ago, she decided to start a business from her home selling food and natural smoothies. Thanks to her first loan from Kiva and MiCredito, she managed to establish her business and produce more.

She has come back to knock on the doors of Kiva and MiCredito because she knows both organizations provide great opportunities to grow as a businesswoman. This time, she has requested a loan that allows her to buy fruit, vegetables, flavorings, sugar, honey, rice, beans, among other items. In the future, she wishes to be able to turn her business into a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, flavorings, sugar, honey, rice, beans, among other items.

loans.name: Maria Evelia

texts.es:
María, de 46 años de edad, es una  mujer muy trabajadora, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltera y no tiene hijos, sus  sobrinos la visitan bien seguido porque vive sola, la mayor parte de su tiempo lo pasa en su negocio.

María, tiene más de ocho años de dedicarse a la venta de panes con pollo en un punto céntrico de  su pueblo y ha logrado tener una buena cantidad de clientes; esta actividad le ayuda a generar los ingresos necesarios para salir  adelante, este negocio lo aprendió de su madre y viaja en microbús hasta para llegar a su negocio porque está aproximadamente a 3 kilómetros de su casa.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio y para comprar bebidas como sodas y refrescos  naturales, con esto lograra  aumentar su inventario y sus ingresos.

Sus sueños son hacer que  su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Maria, 46, is a very hard working woman. She finished sixth grade. She is single and does not have any children. Her nephews visit her often because she lives alone. She spends most of her time at her business.

Maria has dedicated herself for more than 8 years to selling breads with chicken from a central spot in her town and she has managed to have a good quantity of customers. This work helps her to earn the income necessary to get ahead. She learned this business from her mother and travels on a minibus to get to work because it is approximately 3 km from her house.

Maria needs the loan to buy merchandise for her business and to buy drinks like sodas and natural beverages. With this, she will manage to expand her inventory and her income.

Her dream is to see her business continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business and to buy drinks like sodas and natural beverages.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is 48 years old and resides at Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Mis.Occ. She is married and blessed with school age children.

She joined PMPC on April 17, 2011 in order to access the programs and services of the co-op. Recently, she accessed her fifth loan in the amount of PHP 4,000 for additional working capital for her existing business, which is selling a variety of consumable products in the local community. She will use the loan to buy a variety of commodities.

loans.use: to buy variety of commodities.

loans.name: Michell

texts.en:
Michell works hard to support six children. She is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Michell requested a PHP 6,750 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Michell is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is 58 years old, married, and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Leonita has a making and selling buko juice (juice of young coconuts) business in the Philippines. Leonita has been in this business for seven years.

Leonita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her buko juice business.

In the future, Leonita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her buko juice business.

loans.name: Ma. Sonia

texts.en:
Ma. Sonia landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC to Ma. Sonia came as a rescue for lending her money when she needed it the most.

Now, she has availed herself of another loan for the next cropping season. She borrowed an amount to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Ma. Sonia perseveres and always works to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Integrantes De La Manzana Group

texts.es:
Integrantes de la Manzana es el nombre que lleva un grupo integrado por personas trabajadoras cuyo objetivo es mejorar sus actividades económicas. Todos viven en una comunidad pequeña pero llena de gente muy amigable quienes no dudan en brindar la mejor sonrisa a las personas que van de visita.
   Javier es uno de los miembros que se caracteriza por siempre brindar un trato amable y alegre a todo el que conoce. Vive casado con Araceli desde hace seis años y juntos han formado una familia con dos hijos los cuales se encuentra estudiando la educación primaria. Desde hace 14 años Javier se ha dedicado a la compra y venta de productos plásticos para el hogar, por ejemplo, cubetas, pinzas, lazos para tender ropa, jícaras, etc. Del mismo modo es encargado de vender juguetes, ropa y línea blanca; para él cualquier esfuerzo es importante si se trata de  sacar avante a su familia. “Pero también porque yo desde pequeño veía como mis padres salían a vender en otras comunidades” agregó. Actualmente trabaja todos los días de la semana excepto los miércoles ya que ese día dedica todo su tiempo a su familia. 
   Por otro lado está muy agradecido con el préstamo que VF México le otorgó porque gracias a ello puede su negocio ha prosperado y con sus ganancias pudo abrir un local fijo amen de las ventas que realiza de forma ambulante. Actualmente Javier presenta una significativa mejora que beneficia a toda su familia. Así, con la oportunidad de este nuevo préstamo comprará más productos para hacer frente a la demanda que sus clientes le hacen día con día. Uno de sus sueños más grandes es ser el mejor comerciante de su localidad para que sus hijos puedan estar orgullosos de él.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Itzayana y Catalina quienes invertirán en una bonetería y Oscar, en vasos de licuadora.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, Javier es quien porta la chamarra color roja.
texts.en:
Integrantes de la Manzana is the name that this group has, made up of hard-working people whose objective is to improve their businesses. They all live in a small community which is full of friendly people who never hesitate to offer the best smile to people who come to visit.

Javier is one of the members who is characterized by always bringing friendly treatment and cheerfulness to everyone who knows him. He has been married to Araceli for six years and together they have made a family with two children who are students in the primary school. For 14 years, Javier has worked buying and selling plastic household products, for example buckets, clothespins, cords to hang clothing, cups, etc. In the same way, he is in charge of selling toys, clothing and linens. For him, any type of effort is important if it has to do with getting his family ahead. "But also because since I was little I saw how my parents went out to sell in other communities," he added. Currently, he works every day of the week except Wednesdays since on this day he spends all his time with his family.

On the other hand, he is very grateful for the loan that VF México granted him because thanks to it, his business has been able to prosper and with the earnings he was able to open a permanent sales space in addition to the sales that he does as a street vendor. Currently, Javier shows a significant improvement that benefits the whole family. So, with the opportunity of this new loan, he will purchase more products to meet the orders that his customers make day by day. One of his greatest dreams is to be the best salesman in his area so that his children can be proud of him.

The other members of the group are Itzayana and Catalina who will invest in a variety store, and Oscar in blender cups.

*The photo was taken on the steps of the municipal kiosk. Javier is the one wearing a red shirt.

loans.use: to purchase plastic products to sell.

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a 32-year-old food kiosk owner at Kilifi Kenya. She is a mother of four who has been doing well in this business for the last eleven years.

This is her fourth term from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business, she will use the money to purchase sugar, milk, wheat and maize flour, cooking fat, and milk and the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to own a big hotel in future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, wheat and maize flour, cooking fat, and milk.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support nine children. She is married and has a fishing business.

Norma requests 6,750 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Norma is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
Saturnino, de 44 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, reconocido en su comunidad por ser un hombre   responsable, está acompañado, tiene 4 hijos, 2 de ellos todavía viven con ellos y las mayores viven aparte con sus familias.

Saturnino, se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre y sus hijos  también le apoyan en esta actividad.

Saturnino, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abono y pesticidas para asegurar una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Saturnino, 44 years old, is a very hard-working man, known in his community as a responsible man. He is partnered and has 4 children; 2 of them still live with them and the older ones live on their own with their families.

Saturnino has worked in agriculture for a long time, he learned this profession from his father, and his children also support him in this work.

Saturnino needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure and pesticides to assure a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure and pesticides to assure a good harvest.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a 30 year old quarry worker at Kilifi Kenya. She is a mother of two who has been doing well in this business for the last three years.

This is her second term with VisionFund Kenya after paying the first loan successfully. She will use the loan to purchase drilling and stone cutting tools and the anticipated profit to repay her loan.

She hopes to own a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase drilling and stone cutting tools

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: La Señora Nicolasa es una persona trabajadora de 55 años de edad de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar hasta la primaria, cuenta con un dependiente económico a su cargo, vive en casa propia, es de construcción rustica con material local, ubicado en la comunidad de Pucara Chico - Tiraque, su actividad económica es la agrícola en tal sentido produce;  papa, haba en vaina verde y arveja en vaina verde, todos los productos mencionados son cultivados aproximadamente en una superficie de 3 has. Los cuales cuentan con riego, ya que es aplicado por aspersión tecnificada. El dinero que tenía anteriormente fue destinado para la compra de dos toros para utilizar como yunta, en ese sentido la señora Nicolasa se ve con una necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza), con la producción en el futuro, con la intención de mejorar  sus ingresos y al mismo tiempo mejorara la calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nicolasa is a hard-working person, 55 years old, and married, who achieved a primary school education. She has one economic dependent in her care, she lives in her own house, which is of rustic construction from local material located in the community of Pucara Chico - Tiraque. Her work is agriculture where she produces potatoes, broad beans and peas, all of these products mentioned are grown in an area of approximately 3 hectares, which has irrigation which is applied through technical spraying. The money that she had previously was used to purchase two bulls to use with a yoke. In this way, Nicolasa sees a need to ask for a loan to be able to purchase organic chicken manure, for future production with the intention of improving her income and at the same time her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure to improve her production with the intention of increasing her income and at the same time improving her quality of life.

loans.name: Samuel David

texts.es:
Samuel tiene una bella familia formada por su esposa y su hija de cuatro años de edad, su fuente de ingresos es una venta de ropa para ambos sexos, negocio que nació hace 5 años, su jornada de trabajo es de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Para tener mayor capacidad de venta solicita un crédito piensa comprar ropa surtida con nuevos estilos, colores y tallas para damas y caballeros, considera que así tendrá oportunidad de atraer a más clientes y aumentar sus ganancias.
Sus aspiraciones son tener un negocio potencial en la zona y tener una mejor situación financiera.
texts.en:
Samuel has a lovely family made up of his wife and four-year-old daughter, his source of income is selling clothing for both sexes, a business which was born 5 years ago, his work day is from seven in the morning until five in the afternoon.

To have a larger sales capacity, he asks for a loan thinking to purchase an assortment of clothing in new styles, colors and sizes for women and men. He believes that in this way he will have the opportunity to attract more customers and increase his earnings.

His aspirations are to have business potential in the area and have a better financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of clothing in new styles, colors and sizes for women and men.

loans.name: Khen Group

texts.en:
Khen is a 59-year-old married rice farmer with a dependent child, and he lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. His only child works as a construction worker. Khen is pictured 1st from the right, has cultivated rice since 1979. His wife is a 59-year-old rice farmer as well. Together, they can earn approximately USD 5 per day.

Khen, a group leader, would like to request a loan as part of a group of five members, and he will use his portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming in the dry season. This loan helps him to increase his income as well as her family's standard of living. In the future, Khen hopes that he can do farming both in dry and rainy seasons more than two times per year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming in the dry season

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en: Calixta is a 40-year-old woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and has five children. Her oldest child is 21 years old while her youngest child is four years old. Her husband works hard as a farmer while Calixta is engaged in livestock business. She raised cow and pigs as well. She is asking for a loan to buy feed and piglets. 40 years old Calixta wants to enhance their livelihood to have better means of living and to be able to give good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Ma. Eva

texts.en:
Ma. Eva is a resident of Ormoc, Leyte. She is 34 years old, a married woman with two children. Last year she started selling barbecue to earn an income. She usually starts late in the afternoon until evening to cater to the customers in her place. Ma. Eva is asking for a loan to buy seasoning, meat, cooking oil and spices.

Ma. Eva is excited that she has the means to help her husband, who is a driver, and at the same time apply for a loan that will help her expand her business. Her income will be used to buy food for the family and pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy seasoning, meat, cooking oil and spices

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita heads up for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer of which she applied a loan from the Cooperative. She hopes to save enough for family emergencies.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer for more produce

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is 39 years old and married with two children, two children are still in school, Ruby works very hard to provide for them.

Ruby runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods and etc.

Ruby has been in this business for 2 year.

In the future Ruby would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, bread, snack foods and etc

loans.name: Chuchi

texts.en:
Chuchi is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a footwear retailing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy more footwear to resell. Chuchi successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Chuchi's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more footwear to resell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 63 years old, married and has five children.

Remedios is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Remedios requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Remedios has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Remedios would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Kimete

texts.en:
Kimete is 30 years old and the mother of two children. Together, with her husband, they own a kitchen and furniture business, building and creating items for the home based on the client request and needs. They have been in business or approximately eleven years now and her husband is very talented and well know in the area for his quality of work. Kimete helps him to find clients and takes orders for the business, working hard to contribute to their business as it is their main source of income.

At this time she is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to produce better quality work and more items as needed. She is grateful to the lenders for the opportunity to improve her family's living conditions and status.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to produce better quality work for their kitchen renovation business.

loans.name: Malk

texts.en: Malk is 29, single and is financially responsible for his mother and siblings the only source of income to the family is seeds and nuts shop. Malk is requesting 3000 EGP loan to buy seeds and nuts to increase his income and guarantee better living conditions to his mother and siblings.

loans.use: to buy seeds and nuts for grinding.

loans.name: In's Group

texts.en: In’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. In makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jenniffer is a 34-year-old woman who lives in Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has three children ages nine, eight and one year old. Her husband works hard as a construction worker while Jennifer is engaged in raising pigs business. Aside from this, she also sells food to the community. Thus, she is asking to buy feed for her pigs and a new gas range. Maybe it could help her a lot  in cooking her food for selling. In the future, she wishes to have a stable business that helps them enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and a new gas range for food production.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa has always enjoyed farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting. Elisa knew that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like internet cafe.

Arsenia dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Neama

texts.en: Neama is 45, a widow and has two daughters. The only source of income is a small sewing project. She is requesting 5000 EGP loan to buy a modern sewing machine to expand her project and generate more income for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy a modern sewing machine.

loans.name: Vevilyn

texts.en:
Vevilyn is 39 years old and married. She has seven children, five of whom are still in school. Vevilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Vevilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

Vevilyn has been in this business for one year.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, bread, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en: Cerelyn is 31 years old. She is known in the Ozamiz City area for her sari-sari store (variety store). She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She hopes to live comfortably, in a decent house. She applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to repair her house. She hopes to maintain her membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). She is thankful that her financing needs for her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to repair her house.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 49 years old and married. She has seven children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Nida has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for four years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don Manuel 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee un taller de calzado, repara y elabora calzado desde hace 23 años, su taller lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de cuero, hilo, pega, tela, etc. para seguir con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 51 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife.

Manuel has a cobbler's workshop where he has been producing and repairing shoes for 23 years. The workshop is in his home. Manuel has many customers owing to the quality of his product.

Manuel is able to pay household costs using income from sales.

Manuel is applying for another loan in order to buy leather, thread, glue, material and more, and to continue with his work and thus earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread, glue, material and more.

loans.name: Rosa Marìa

texts.es: Rosa,  tiene 31 años está casada su esposo es jornalero tiene 2 hijas Paola de 8 años estudia en una  escuela gratuita del sector, Belén de 3 años permanece con su madre que se dedica a la crianza de ganado hace diez años todos los días a partir de las cuatro de la mañana se levanta a alimentar a sus terneras para luego salir a buscar trabajo como jornalera tratando de aportar en el hogar ya que con los ingresos de su esposo no les alcanza. Rosa necesita el dinero para comprar dos terneras, cuidarlas para que lleguen a ser vacas, ella aspira  vender leche conseguir un ingreso adicional para ayudar en los gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijas permaneciendo junto a ellas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 31 years old. She is married. Her husband is a labourer. The couple has two daughters - eight-year-old Paola, who is studying at a local free school, and Belen, who is three years old, and stays at home with her mother.

Rosa has been working raising cattle for ten years. Every day she gets up at 4am in order to feed her calves. She then goes out to look for work as a labourer in order to try to bring home an income. The income that Rosa's husband earns is not enough to support the household.

Rosa needs this loan in order to buy two calves and look after them until they grow up to be cows.

Rosa wants to sell milk and earn an additional income to help pay for food and education for her children and to remain by their sides.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron, in order to build a sink and washing area in his home.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es: María es habitante de Galapa un municipio del Atlántico en donde se encuentra ubicada su vivienda, ella es una comerciante que encontró en esta actividad la oportunidad de progresar y beneficiar a su familia y aunque durante años estuvo empleada en una empresa privada,  al quedar cesante, tomó sus ahorros y decidió invertirlos en su proyecto de negocio en el que hasta el momento ha obtenido excelentes resultados. Con sus dotes culinarios no dudó en ofertar almuerzos todos los medios días a sus vecinos y transeúntes del sector, así como helados.  Esta encantadora mujer es madre de tres hijos y no cuenta con el apoyo de su cónyuge, porque se encuentra separada de él, así que el único sustento de su hogar ha sido por años su trabajo, sin embargo su emblemática personalidad ha permitido que a pesar de los obstáculos ella continúe buscando nuevos horizontes que le ofrezcan nuevas y mejores posibilidades.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar prendas de vestir y aprovechar la temporada de fin de año.  Su meta de negocio es tener un local comercial. En lo personal desearía realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda para mejorar las condiciones de habitabilidad.
texts.en:
Maria lives in Galapa, a municipality in Atlantica department.

Maria is a trader. Her work allows her to move forward and help her family. Although for many years she worked for a private business, when Maria was made redundant, she took her savings and decided to invest them in a business. So far, she has had great results with the business.

With her culinary skills, Maria did not doubt for a second that she should begin to sell lunches and ice creams every afternoon to neighbours and those passing through the local area.

Maria, an enchanting woman, is mother to three children. She is separated and receives no support from her ex-partner. The only way to sustain her household is her work.

Nonetheless, Maria's sparkling personality has allowed her, in spite of all obstacles, to continue looking for new horizons where there will be new and better opportunities.

Maria is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy clothing items and take advantage of the end-of-year holiday season.

Maria's goal for her business is to have premises for it. On a personal level, she would like to make improvements to her home in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing items.

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es:
Leonel, de 31 años de edad, es un líder comunidad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen dos hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad y también tienen  un hijo de crianza que adoptaron desde que tenía 19 días de nacido y ahora ya tiene 7 años.

Leonel, es agricultor desde su adolescencia y fue su padre quien le enseño a cultivar la  tierra y le enseño valores que  le han servido para ser un hombre de bien y luchar por  su familia.

Leonel, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abono para sus cultivos y lograr así cubrir esta necesidad.

El sueño de Leonel, es darle lo necesario a su familia y en el futuro poder cultivar más.
texts.en:
Leonel is 31 years old and a community leader. He has a sixth-grade education. He is married; his wife does the household chores. The couple has two children, ages five and three years old. The couple also adopted a boy when he was nineteen days old and he is now seven years old.

Leonel has been a farmer since he was a teen. His father taught him to grow crops on the land, and taught him the values that make him a good man and help him to work hard for his family.

Leonel needs this loan in order to buy fertilisers and manure for his crops. This loan will cover the necessary cost of these items.

Leonel's dreams are to give his family what they need and, in the future, to be able to grow more crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and manure for his crops.

loans.name: Cristine Joy

texts.en:
Cristine Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc., for her general store business.

Cristine Joy has been in this business for four years. Cristine Joy earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Cristine Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Ramazani

texts.en:
Ramazani is a married man aged 36. He is living in Hoima, Uganda. He operates a retail shop, mostly selling cooking oil, salt, soap, and general merchandise, among other items, on a retail basis.

In order to supplement his income, he ventured into the farming of beans and maize so as to raise more income for his family and to have more food security in his village and the areas surrounding him. He started business in 2000 on realizing a need to supplement his income.

His dream is to develop and expand his business so as to improve the standards of living of his family. He is seeking a loan to buy more soap, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es:
Evelio, de 49 años de edad, es un hombre muy reconocido en su comunidad, por ser un hombre trabajador y responsable, está acompañado y se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 6 hijos pero  solo tres viven aún con ellos y estudian.

Evelio, es agricultor desde su adolescencia y fue su padre quien le enseño a trabajar la tierra y él  le da el mismo ejemplo a sus hijos para que aprendan a ser independientes.

El necesita del préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos, porque tiene sus milpas  necesitan el abono para asegurar una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Evelio is 49 years old. He is very well-known in his local community for being hard-working and responsible. He has a partner, who does the household chores. The coupe has six children. Only three still live at home; they attend school.

Evelio has been a farmer since he was a teen. His father taught him to work the land. Evelio is now teaching the same thing to his children so that they may learn to be independent.

Evelio needs this loan in order to buy farming supplies for his crops. He grows corn and needs manure to ensure a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Ana Josefa

texts.es: Ana cuenta con 35 años de edad de los cuales tiene 4 de dedicarse a la panadería, actividad que le permite salir adelante y sostener a su familia. Ella vive desde hace 20 años en vivienda propia en la cual vive actualmente junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos un varón de 17 años y una niña de 11 años de edad a los que apoya en sus estudios. La vivienda de Ana carece de un lugar adecuado para el almacenamiento de agua de uso diario, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir una pila y lavadero en su vivienda que le permita mantener la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years old, and for four of those years she has run a bakery. The job gives her the chance to get ahead and support her family. For 20 years she has lived in her own house where she still lives with her husband and two children, her son aged 17 and her daughter aged 11. She supports them while they attend school..

Ana's house does not have an adequate place to store the water she uses on a daily basis so she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and rebar to build a sink and laundry area in her home. Then she will be able to keep her home healthy.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and rebar to build a sink and laundry area in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the transportation of stones.

loans.name: Perlie

texts.en:
Perlie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Perlie's business profile for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.en:
Inocenta signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start a sari-sari (variety) store business in the rural barrio of Ozamiz. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Inocenta was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Fatou Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé en Mai 2010,rassemble des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité l'élevage.*

Marie qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 38 ans,est mariée et mére de 10 enfants dont 05 filles.

Son activité est l'élevage de bœufs.

Elle compte acheter avec le crédit 03 bœufs à 150000f l'unité.

Son objectif est de pouvoir constituer un fonds important afin de faire du commerce.
texts.en:
This group was created in May of 2010 and brings together members who live in the same village and who raise livestock.

Marie, who is on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is the group representative. She is 38 years old, married and the mother of 10 children, 5 of whom are girls. She raises cattle.

She plans to use her loan to buy 3 head of cattle at 150 000 francs per head. Her goal is to be able to build a significant cash reserve so that she can continue doing business.

loans.use: to buy 3 head of cattle.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn has always had a lot of enthusiasm for farming. She has cultivated their rice land in Ozamiz City and has yielded good earnings doing this type of work.

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations. This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting.

Jocelyn knows that she has to get things right to yield more income for this cropping season.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations

loans.name: Renel

texts.en:
Renel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Renel's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina, es una mujer de trabajo está acompañada y vive con su pareja que trabaja la agricultura y sus dos hijos de 21 y 14 años de edad.

Evangelina, dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo a los quehaceres de la casa y a veces en las labores agrícolas con su pareja y también hace tamales, enchiladas y paletas para vender y genera un ingreso adicional para la familia.

Evangelina, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, porque necesitan aplicarle estos productos en el tiempo correcto para asegurar una buena cosecha.

Evangelina, sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y también sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Evangelina is a hardworking woman. She is married and lives with her partner who works in agriculture and her two children aged 21 and 14. The majority of her time Evangelina devotes to household duties and sometimes to helping her partner in the fields. She also makes tamales, enchiladas, and popsicles to sell and generate additional income for the family.

Evangelina needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, pesticides, and fertiliser for their land. These products have to be applied at the correct time to ensure a good harvest.

Her dream is to see her children get good jobs and also to see the standard of living of her family improve.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies such as manure, pesticides, and fertiliser

loans.name: Moris

texts.en:
Moris lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 26 and married with one child who attends school. He started the business of riding a motorcycle for transport, commonly known as boda boda, to raise income to support his family. He supplements his income by selling various items like salt, sugar, cooking oil among other items on a retail basis.

In order to earn more income to support his family, he has always wanted to diversify his business as well as to develop and grow that business, however, inadequate working capital hinders his desire. He is seeking credit to buy more items like salt, sugar, and soap to stock and sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like salt, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 61 years old. She is a widow with one adult-age child from Pagadian City. She is a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC and maintains membership without records of default.

This time she needs an amount to purchase maintenance medicines, for which she asks for a loan from the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Marilyn's business profile for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Araceli Del Socorro

texts.es:
Araceli, es una mujer luchadora de cuarenta y dos años de edad, que además de cuidar de sus dos hijos pequeños y de su hogar, tiene una tienda donde vende productos de belleza, ropa y calzado. Lo que empezó como una idea de emprendimiento, se ha vuelto un negocio solido que le genera un buen ingreso al hogar de Araceli. Ella gracias a un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, logro incluir en su inventario productos que antes no tenía, lo que hizo que su clientela aumentara. 
En estos momentos ella ha requerido, a otro préstamo de ambas organizaciones, porque desea fortalecer su tienda y comprar productos de belleza, cosméticos y ropa de acuerdo a la temporada. En un futuro planea mejorar la infraestructura de su local y incursionar en la venta de nuevos artículos como accesorios y joyería.
texts.en:
Araceli, age 42, is a tenacious woman. In addition to caring for her two small children and her home, she has a store where she sells beauty products, clothes, and shoes. What started as an enterprising idea has turned into a solid business that generates a good income for Araceli's household.

Thanks to a loan from Kiva together with MiCrédito, Araceli manged to add to her inventory products that she did not previously have. This increased her clientele. She now needs another loan from both organizations because she wishes to strengthen her store. She will buy beauty products, cosmetics, and seasonal clothing.

In the future she plans to improve the infrastructure of her place and become involved in selling new items like accessories and jewelry.

loans.use: to buy beauty products, cosmetics, and seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo es optimista y emprendedor, tiene 41 años, vive con su esposa ella trabaja como empleada doméstica, tiene tres hijos Josting de 18, Carlos de 16 y Angi de 11  ellos se encuentran estudiando en instituciones estatales gratuitas, Comenzó desde los 18 años a fabricar mochilas pese a que ganaba muy poco dinero como operario  se esforzaba diariamente  por perfeccionar lo que hacía  hasta que un buen día decidió con sus ahorros comprar una máquina  e independizarse. Eduardo necesita dinero para comprar material que emplea para la manufactura consiguiendo más utilidad que le alcance para alimentar y educar a sus hijos  e incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
41-year old Eduardo is optimistic and enterprising. He lives with his wife who works as a maid and his three children Josting aged 18, Carlos 16, and Angi 11. They are students in free state schools.

At the age of 18 Eduardo started to make backpacks, and although he didn't earn very much, he worked hard every day to perfect his skills. Then one day he decided to use his savings to buy a sewing machine and work independently.

Now Eduardo needs a loan to buy supplies which he will use to make backpacks and earn more money to feed and educate his children, and grow his business.

loans.use: buy materials to make backpacks

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: Mariée et  mère de quatre enfants, Charlotte est une femme âgée de 43 ans qui vit à Agoè. Charlotte est une couturière qui confectionne des habits de prêt à porter dans son atelier de couture à domicile et les revendent dans un emplacement au marché. Pour s’approvisionner du nécessaire pour la confection, Charlotte se rend deux fois par mois au marché. Charlotte demande ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes en vue de bien revendre ses marchandises puis de gagner un gain et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 4 children, Charlotte is a 43-year-old woman who lives in Agoè.

Charlotte is a seamstress who makes prêt-à-porter clothing in her sewing workshop at home and resells it from a location at the market. Charlotte goes to the market twice a month to get the supplies she needs to make the clothing.

Charlotte is requesting this loan in order to buy some pieces of pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth) so that she can sell more merchandise and make a profit which will enable her to cover her children's needs and their education expenses.

loans.use: to buy 10 pieces of pagnes.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a 51-year-old Palestinian widow living with her only son. She works very hard to provide her son a better life and improve their way of living.

In 2005 she started a job breeding livestock in her village, Al-Samou’. At present, she is thinking to expand her farm. So, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, Alibdaa. The loan will enable her son to complete his education and improve their standard of living.

She would like to have a steady income to save enough money for her son so he can have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for her farm in order to improve the farm and then have a better lifestyle.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is 38, married to a housewife, and he has one son and one daughter.

The only source of income for the family is a small electrical supplies and accessories business.

Youssef is currently requesting another 10,000 EGP loan to buy electrical supplies such as lamps, wires, starters, and cables. He previously borrowed 10,000 EGP and successfully repaid it on the due dates.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies such as lamps, wires, starters, and cables.   .

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es: Norma de 23 años de edad es madre soltera y vive junto a su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad en vivienda propia. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 3 años, por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes que solicitan sus productos por sus precios accesibles y su amabilidad. La vivienda de Norma cuenta con agua potable que le pasa una vecina, pero ella desea legalizar para tener agua propia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar el derecho de instalación de agua potable, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica, para ella es muy importante porque por su negocio utiliza mucha agua.
texts.en:
Norma, age 23, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her little two year old son. She is an enterprising woman who has been selling tortillas for three years. Therefore, she has a lot of customers who request her products because of her affordable prices and her kindness.

Norma's house has running water that comes from a neighbor. However, Norma wants to make it legal for her to have her own water. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy the rights to install running water. However, she does not have financial liquidity. It is very important to her because her business uses a lot of water.

loans.use: to pay for the right to install running water in her house and to maintain a healthy household.

loans.name: Beryl

texts.en:
Beryl is 34 years old. She is married with two children.

She has had a cosmetic shop business for five years and it has been profitable.

She has requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya that she will be using to purchase lotions, face powder, assorted lipsticks, and lip liners to stock and sell.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able expand her current business as well as repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to own a salon and boutique.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, face powder, assorted lipsticks, and lip liners to stock and sell.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a 42-year-old who sells ladies' handbags at Kilifi, Kenya. She is a married mother of four who has been in this business for the last twelve years and is doing well. This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business; she will use the money to purchase more handbags. The anticipated profits will be used to repay her loan. She hopes to have a successful business and a happy family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more handbags

loans.name: Zendere

texts.en:
Zendere is a 50-year-old livestock trader at Kilifi, Kenya. She is a mother of four who has been in this business for the last ten years. She does well at her business, with her spouse's support.

This is her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the money to purchase goats for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 25 years old. He is married with two children. He has had a retail shop business for three years and it has been profitable.

He will be using the loan to purchase additional stock of daily use products like margarine, cooking oil, tea leaves, bar soap, and sugar for resale.

With the anticipated profits, Benard will be able to start a new business which he has yet to decide on.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to progress well in life.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of daily use products like margarine, cooking oil, tea leaves, bar soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Herminia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. Herminia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing net for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Herminia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of canned goods, milk, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Glenda dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, milk, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Javene

texts.en:
Javene lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 41 and married with four children; all attend school.

He operates a beauty salon, mostly cutting hair for both men and women. In a bid to supplement his income, Javene does phone charging, and that has helped him accumulate more income to support his family.

He desires to expand and improve his services so as to meet the demand of his customers. He is seeking a loan to buy new machines for cutting hair.

loans.use: to buy new machines for cutting hair.

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Banteay Meanchey province, Ang is 59 years old. She is a married mother of three dependent children, two of whom are studying in university while the other one is working to earn additional income to release the financial burden of the family. Ang has been selling desserts for twenty years as her main source of income. Daily income for her family is about USD12 and Ang manages to save approximately USD4 per day.
With VisionFund, she is the sixth-cycled client. Past loans which were completely paid back have had a huge impact on her family. In fact, she's now able to renovate her house and buy a decent motorcycle. As the leader of a two-member group, Ang will use her loan to support her dessert business by buying rice and other ingredients. She hopes to earn additional income so as to fulfill her dream of expanding her dessert business and to support her children’s studies until they graduate.

loans.use: to support her dessert business through buying rice and other ingredients so that she can expand her dessert business and support her children’s studies until graduating.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en: Thavy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Thavy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer seller and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sophea Group

texts.en:
Sophea is 27 years old, a married mother with two children who lives in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has one child who attends school. Sophea is pictured 1st from right. She has been involved in animal husbandry and cultivated rice since 2005. Her husband is a 39-year-old rice farmer and animal husbandry as well. Together, they can earn approximately USD 4 per day.

Sophea is a group leader, would like to request a loan as six members and she will use her portion to buy pig feed and improve her family’s finance from selling those pigs. In the future, she is going to buy more pigs and cows, build a new bigger house and help her children to earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy pig feed to increase her family welfare .

loans.name: Mark Joseph

texts.en: Mark Joseph is a married man with one child. He is from Concepcion, Iloilo. He raised his family by driving a motorcycle. Aside from this, he also sells “Talaba” (a Filipino word which means oysters) and plan to start up a sari-sari store business to enhance their livelihood. Mark Joseph works hard to provide the needs of his family. He wishes to give them good and better means of living. Thus, he is asking for a loan for motorcycle maintenance and to buy more “Talaba” to sells. He will also buy grocery items to start a sari-sari store, such as coffee, sugar, powdered chocolate drink, noodles, canned goods, spices, candies, biscuits and toiletries.

loans.use: for motorcycle maintenance and to buy more “Talaba” ; coffee, sugar, powdered chocolate drink, noodles, canned goods, spices, candies, biscuits and toiletries.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en: Aurora is a hard-working woman who earns a living through selling fresh fish. She has been selling fish for more than 10 years. Her work is done around the market place of her town, Bihar, Bohol, Philippines. She is a 53-year-old, married woman with five children. One of them is still attending school. She is asking for a loan from CEVI to invest in her fish vending business to buy stocks of fresh fish. In this way she hopes to improve her financial income. Slowly, she will be able to settle her obligations and manage her finances wisely. Aurora successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of fresh fish

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena and her husband are engaged in fishing business to earn a living. They have been doing this for seven years. Lorena is a 52-years-old woman and a mother of seven children, six adult and one school aged children aged 12 years old. In the future, Lorena and her husband dreams to buy additional fishing boat to enhance their catch. For the meantime, she is asking for a loan to buy fishing net, fishing weights (known as fishing sinker that is used in conjunction with a fishing lure or hook to increase its rate of sink) and fishing knot (is used as the baseline of the fishing net).

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing weights and fishing knot

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma has been running her grocery store for many years.She has been a plain housekeeper for a long time, since she got married. As the years have gone by and her family needs more financially, she decided to engage in a retail business in their village to earn more income for the family. She joined Gata Daku MPC and has taken out a new loan to purchase additional grocery items for her retail store in order to increase her sales. She hopes to expand and improve her business to support the needs of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her retail store

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Melba works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Melba is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 55 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Corazon works hard to provide for her family. For five years, she has operated a general store in the Philippines, and she also earns an income from rice retailing. She requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Corazon has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. Corazon aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 43 years old and has five children. Rosie is married and has three children are presently in school.

Rosie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rosie has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, bread, chips, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buy and sell rice.

Marivic dreams that one day She will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, bread, chips, etc

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Emelyn is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Emelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Mpanga Farmers Group

texts.en:
Grace, a member of the Mpanga Farmers Group, is a very hardworking lady who works seven days a week.

Grace operates a retail shop selling mostly general merchandise such as sugar, salt, and cooking oil, among other items. In addition, she carries out farming, mainly cassava and beans for extra income.

Grace desires to grow and expand her business as well as pay school fees for her children. On the other hand, stiff competition and high rental fees affect the realization of her desires.

Grace is seeking a loan to buy more stock items such as salt, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock items such as salt, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has two children who attend school. She operates a fish selling business, which she has been doing for five years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. 	

Amina requested a loan for 40,000 KES from Yehu, which she will use to purchase sacks of fish to sell. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Amina lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish to sell

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a married woman and has been blessed with six kids, five of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Aisha has operated a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge to her business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase chick and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chick and poultry feed.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
This farmer lives with her two grandsons and uses a lot of firewood to cook.

She has been trying to obtain biogas but could not because of the high cost of getting one.

With this loan, she will get to cook with biogas.

She is most proud of being a mother to her children.

loans.use: to buy a biogas digester for clean, renewable cooking

loans.name: Akouele  Jacqueline

texts.fr: Akouele est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida avec un enfant à charge. Agée de 49 ans, Akouele vend des bijoux pour gagner son revenu quotidien. Pour s’approvisionner, Akouele se rend deux fois par mois au marché. Akouele demande ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de chaines, de bracelets et de boucles d’oreilles en vue de mieux revendre puis se faire une marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir aider son mari à supporter les charges quotidiennes de la famille et de bien prendre soin de son enfant.
texts.en:
Akouele is a married woman who lives in Baguida and has one dependent child. 49-year-old Akouele sells jewellery in order to earn her daily income. Akouele gets her supplies from the market twice a month.

Akouele is requesting this loan so that she can order dozens of necklaces, bracelets and earrings in order to sell more and earn a higher profit margin which will enable her to support her husband with the family's daily expenses and take good care of her child.

loans.use: to buy 3 dozen necklaces, 2 dozen bracelets and 6 dozen pairs of earrings.
